Name: Business Analyst - Contract
Description: We are looking for a Business Analyst for a 6+ month contract / Contract to hire position in San Antonio, TX. Required SkillsExperience with Sensitive Data discovery and remediation, Data Governance, or Data ManagementExperience working in cross-functional business partners in a highly-matrixed organization, between business and ITExperience working with regulatory or risk-management processes, especially around regulations around Payment Card (i.e. credit cards)Work with sensitive data scanning or remediation tools Experience creating workflow processes Experience creating dashboards and reporting (plus: Tableau skills)Understanding of data sources and technologyMinimum of Four years experience in an analytical and technical support functionIntermediate knowledge of data extraction techniques and applicationsAdvanced knowledge of identifying, documenting and analyzing business and/or data requirementsMust be able to work on a W2 Contract (we are not able to work on Corp-2-Corp for this requirement)Responsibilities: Will work with requestor(s) to develop and understand requirementsWill be responsible for developing high quality deliverablesDemonstrates an understanding of the connection between business operations and analytics to support business strategies and solutionsDevelops innovative approaches to address business problems and solutionsCollaborates with IT to facilitate the implementation of technical data solutions and standardsCollaborates with Information Management and Information Governance for correct data source usage and proper handling of the dataGLDR#LI-AW1

Name: Entry Level Business Analyst
Description: We are offering full-time positions to highly-motivated, tenacious career-seekers at our company headquarters in San Antonio. Business Analysts spearhead Labatt’s many continual improvement efforts by identifying problems and opportunities, making detailed assessments through interviews and quantitative analyses, working with internal software developers to codify robust, standardized processes and tools, and finally by working with business people to drive cultural and procedural changes. Business Analysts at Labatt follow our own specialized change management methodology that gains its inspiration from the tenets of Lean and Six Sigma as well as the philosophies of Demming and Drucker. By interfacing extensively with executives, operational managers, employees, engineers, vendors, and customers, Analysts are truly poised to gain dramatic insight into the food industry at large, and more importantly, into Labatt’s highly differentiated poise within the industry.As an Analyst at Labatt, you will:--Manage software development processes using Lean Startup and Agile methodologies--Aid in crafting and executing strategic initiatives--Solve some of the industry’s and our company’s hardest problems--Communicate excellently, assessing problems both abstractly and concretely--Analyze, and help the organization digest, large sources of data with untapped potential--Set individual and team goals and demonstrate the resourcefulness to achieve them--Hold yourself and your teammates accountable to achieving robust success--Live by a philosophy of genchi genbutsu--Learn continuously, through training, mentoring, and a strong culture of high-level reading Your direct manager is a corporate-level executive in one functional area of the business. Analysts who succeed at Labatt will settle for nothing less than the best, and have demonstrated this disciplined, accountable focus time and again in previous experiences, whether academically or at the workplace. A competitive undergraduate degree with outstanding marks is required. The Analyst position demands core values that constitute our company culture, including: a strong focus on excellence, hard work, integrity, teamwork, and customer-orientation.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Ventech Solutions is currently searching for an experienced Business Process Analyst to support task 2 and analyze, define, and recommend business process IT activities and efforts associated with AFCEC FMO-managed IT systems.  The position will provide technical IT support to the Air Force Civil Engineering Center (AFCEC)- Functional Management Office (FMO) in all IT program management activities and efforts associated with AFCEC Legacy PMO managed IT Systems in support of AFCEC and CE functional programs. Experience working with Department of Defense legacy systems, Civil Engineering and DoD environment experience is preferred.  The scope of this work is to provide management and associated tasks in support of six AFCEC PMO managed IT Systems. Infrastructure support is not included in this TO's scope. IT Administration SupportIT Business Process SupportIA/ and CyberDatabase ManagementProgrammingTraining This contract will also support AFCEC's transition from Department of Defense (DoD) Information Assurance Certification and Accreditation Process (DIACAP) to Risk Management Framework (RMF). Qualifications:3+ years providing technical knowledge and analysis of applications and operational environments, high-level functional systems analysis, design, integration, documentation and implementation advice on complex problems that need extensive knowledge of the subject matter for effective implementation.Customer requires a US Citizen.Ventech Solutions, Inc. provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Ventech Solutions, Inc. complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

Name: Business Process Analyst
Description: Performs business analysis, as well as, designs and implements enterprise business systems for Valero's trading, risk management, logistics, and wholesale marketing functions as part of the Information Services (IS) Commercial Systems team. Works collaboratively with team members, users, and other IS departments to innovate and deliver strategic, business critical solutions.Gathers business requirements.Documents as-is and to-be process flows.Facilitates meetings with business users and documents meeting notes and action items.Identifies business process improvement opportunities.Creates use cases.Writes test plans, test scripts, organizes and executes testing, and tracks issues to resolution.Writes high-quality design specifications.Provides user training and documentation.Provides work estimates for assigned activities to project management.Works independently on project tasks.May lead a project work stream.Maintains excellent relationships with business customers.Communicates effectively both written and verbally.Provides timely status updates to project management.Solves moderate to highly complex business and technical problems.Supports company policies and procedures and ensure adherence to computer and security policies.Contributes in all phases of the Information Systems project life-cycle including but not limited to business analysis, design, configuration, testing, data conversion, change management, and immediate post go-live support. This position is salaried exempt status, which means you are not eligible for overtime pay. Bachelor's degree (or higher) or foreign equivalent degree in Management Information Systems, Engineering, or technology-related field required.Minimum of five (5) years of technology consulting or relevant industry experience required.Experience in implementing custom development and/or systems integration projects required.“Big 4” consulting experience preferred.Proficient using Microsoft Office programs (i.e., Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook and Lync) required.May be required to work off-hours and on weekends, and some travel may be required.Position level and salary will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.About ValeroValero Energy Corporation, through its subsidiaries, is an international manufacturer and marketer of transportation fuels and other petrochemical products. Valero, a Fortune 50 company based in San Antonio, Texas, with approximately 10,000 employees, is an independent petroleum refiner and ethanol producer, and its assets include 15 petroleum refineries with a combined throughput capacity of approximately 3.1 million barrels per day and 11 ethanol plants with a combined production capacity of approximately 1.45 billion gallons per year. The petroleum refineries are located in the United States, Canada and the United Kingdom, and the ethanol plants are in the Mid-Continent region of the U.S. In addition, Valero owns the 2 percent general partner interest and a majority limited partner interest in Valero Energy Partners LP, a midstream master limited partnership. Valero sells its products in both the wholesale rack and bulk markets, and approximately 7,400 outlets carry Valero's brand names in the U.S., Canada, the U.K. and Ireland.About Valero HeadquartersAfter acquiring Ultramar Diamond Shamrock in 2001, Valero began planning the construction of its state-of-the-art corporate headquarters at the edge of the Texas Hill Country in San Antonio, at Interstate 10 West and Loop 1604. It was completed in 2004. Today, the 200-acre Valero campus includes a main building; two connected newer office buildings; a four-story, separate building; and two large parking facilities. The headquarters also features a beautiful cafeteria, state-of-the-art training facilities, a fitness center, a daycare facility and jogging trails. Valero's employees are the heart of its success, and there is a reason why the company is an employer of choice in the fuels manufacturing and marketing industry. It’s not just the excellent benefits package, or the opportunities for personal growth, it’s also the caring and committed culture of the organization that makes everyone feel like they’re truly part of a team. Valero is an EEO/AA Employer. All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply and will receive consideration for employment without regard to legally protected status including sexual orientation, gender identity, Women, Minorities, Individuals with Disabilities and protected Veterans.*LI-LP1

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: We are seeking a Business Analyst who will be responsible for understanding and documenting data, defining and prioritizing data requirements, preparing data reports, and providing thorough communication in reports and presentations to business owners. This role will work on project teams to make improvements to Rackspace Service offerings, analyzes data to draw conclusions and determine root causes. This role will be responsible for presenting findings to leadership, change processes based on findings from data, and lead projects driven by data analytics. KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITY: Must have excellent communication skills. Ability to understand and capture business problems and needs. Must be able to utilize Excel, Word, Powerpoint, and BI Tools (ie. – Qlikview) to present analytical findings and data. Must have advanced Excel expertise, including the ability to utilize pivot tables, charts, and graphs. Ability to use Excel to answer complex business questions in a timely fashion. Must have intermediate SQL skills including joins, case statements, aggregations, casting, and navigating errors. Ability to perform advanced UAT testing and write test cases for end user UAT. Must demonstrate a high level of team skills such as: Respecting, listening, persuading, helping, sharing and participating. Must demonstrate a high level of customer service skills and business acumen such as: Managing customer expectations, delivering customer experience, willingness to be flexible, eagerness to learn the customers business and passion for taking care of the customers. Must demonstrate a moderate level of leadership skills such as: Communication, Mentoring, Problem solving, self-management, decision making and integrity. Ability to communicate technical info and ideas so others will understand. Ability to successfully work and promote inclusiveness in small groups. Ability to provide FANATICAL support.JOB COMPLEXITY: Serves as liaison between BI Teams and business stakeholders to ensure stakeholder requirements are addressed through integration solutions in a manner that aligns with timelines and quality expectations. Able to extract data per requirements from SQL, Oracle, or other databases and consolidate using a variety of reporting tools and interfaces. Comfortable putting together and presenting findings to C-level leadership on the run of the business and on key findings from data analysis. Meets with end users to understand business processes. Gathers and documents BI requirements. Ensures projects remain on schedule and all target requirements are met. Uses business requirements to create detailed test cases and analyzes results. Analyzes results of testing to ensure BI solutions matches the documented business need. May play a key role in the training of customer and technical support personnel.EXPERIENCE/EDUCATION: High school diploma or equivalent required. Requires a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, MIS, or Business Administration from an accredited institution and 3-6 years of BI experience. Post-graduate education or training desirable. Strong skills in Excel and T-SQL recommended. Comfort using Qlikview desirable.#LI-MO1

you can envision a world different than the status quo with the ability to articulate a clear path to get there- Demonstrated ability to produce work products that make an impact on management decisions and business results- Advanced analytical skills, and the talent of leveraging data to tell a meaningful story- Self-directed and motivated to independently accomplish results- Proven track record of managing large-scale projects from conception to implementation- Demonstrated effectiveness in a fast paced, change oriented work environment- Ability to understand high-level technical concepts and work closely with software development teamsExperience and Education preferred- Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, I.S. or related field or comparable experience- 4-7 years of business experience in consulting, project management or business analysis expertise- Experience supporting retail, supply chain and ecommerce operations strongly preferred- Familiar with Agile development frameworks, Agile Product Owner Certification ideal- Advanced PC skills (Excel, PowerPoint,MSProject) required, SQL knowledge a plus- Working knowledge of retail accounting and finance principles with experience applying principles to development of costing and forecasting modelsFINACC3232DATANL3232

Name: Talent Management Consultant II
Description: DescriptionThe Talent Management Consultant implements the plans, programs, and agenda within Learning and Capabilities Development area of the Talent Management Center of Excellence for all Associates. The Consultant demonstrates a primary focus on the Learner Experience and ensures alignment to the CHRISTUS Health Cultural Attributes in all programing. The Talent Management Consultant partners with business leaders and HR strategic partners to determine learning needs, develop learning programs, and demonstrate current program effectiveness through a consistent application of the overarching learning philosophy. The consultant will design, update, and implement in-house, and vendor-provided programs using a variety of delivery methods; including but not limited to classroom, individual, self-paced, and computer-based training.User Experience Understand and align all programs and job function with CHRISTUS Core Values and Cultural Attributes. Be the Guardian of the Culture. Ensure personal brand aligns with Talent Management brand Build and manage relationships with stakeholders to better understand the business requirements. Assess and counsel Associates, managers, and business leaders on talent request Program Design & Delivery Deliver informal and formal learning solutions in a manner that both engages the learner and produces the desired outcomes; managing and responding to learner needs; ensuring that the learning is made available in appropriate platforms and delivered in a timely and effective manner. Design and deliver curriculum & programs, implement learning programs/projects, assessments, associate engagement initiatives, and change management initiatives. Partner with other content areas to implement programs and ensure alignment with System strategies Learning Technologies Responsible for providing the technical skills and business knowledge necessary for execution of Learning Programs. Evaluating Learning ImpactGathering, organizing and analyzing information regarding the impact of learning solutions against key business drivers; presenting the information in a way that is meaningful to the organization; using learning metrics and analytics to inform organizational decision making.Analyze feedback, data reports and metrics as they apply to Talent Management work. GeneralCoaching and mentoring of less experienced team members.Demonstrate strong communication and human relationship skills.Maintain and demonstrate effective teamwork on assigned projects through actions and job performance.Provide effective customer service by being courteous, polite and friendly at all times. Acknowledge customers timely in order to determine their need and help the customer resolve the issue or request. Participate in departmental programs that promote and deliver exceptional customer service. Ensure the services that he/she provides contribute to the successful accomplishment of the primary mission of the department. Practice service recovery; as necessary.Pursue professional growth and development through personal reading, seminars, workshops and professional affiliations to keep abreast of the trends in his/her field of expertise.Perform other duties and special projects as assigned by Talent Management Leaders.RequirementsA. Education/SkillsBachelor's degree in business, human resources, education or related field; required. Master's degree in business, human resources, education or related fields; requiredKnowledge of talent management theory, methods, and concepts. Ability to transform theory, methods, and concepts into tangible designs with measurable results.Knowledge of instructional design, including needs assessment methodologies, design alternatives, training evaluation, and continuous performance improvement.Technical expertise in mapping training needs requirements against business goals and objectives.Excellent effective presentation skills. Excellent written and oral communication skills.Experience designing and developing programs and initiatives to create and sustain an organizational learning culture.Developing professional expertise, applies company policies and procedures to resolve a variety of issues.Must be able to work effectively in a matrixed organizational structure.B. Experience3 or more years of directly related experience

Name: Business Systems Analyst - WellMed
Description: The Senior Business Systems Analyst is responsible for creating and refining business and systems requirements to address business opportunities and formulating documentation to support the development and implementation of the technical solution. This position plays a major role in the development and implementation of core business systems and mentors and guides other Business Systems Analysts. In addition, the Sr. Business Systems Analyst serves as the liaison between business users and technology programmers to understand user needs and develop required reporting and data analysis and may serve in a project manager capacity for smaller work efforts. Primary Responsibilities: Analyzes business needs, documents requirements and translates needs into functional, non-functional and/or technical specifications  Delivers requirements, performs analysis, and evaluates downstream business, systems, process, and/or organizational impacts  Plans and assists with oversight of testing processes and activities including defect identification and resolution  Analyzes charts and/or diagrams of the problem to be programmed and defines system requirements in terms of system capabilities  Develops or assists in the development of work plans, time schedules, and project task items and schedules and assists with estimating resource needs for analysts, programmers, user personnel, consultants, equipment, and prepares routine project status reports  Assists in the development of project cost and benefit estimates to establish project worth including the development of alternative considerations. This will result in recommendations for the installation of new systems or equipment, or to change existing systems and equipment  Advises the appropriate people on the implications of existing IT systems that can be applied to a problem. Identifies risks and issues, and seeks approval on complex matters  Checks, instructs, assigns work, and otherwise functionally directs technical staff in order to achieve desired end-results on complex problems  Provides subject matter expert and operational support to internal business partners  Performs all other related duties as assigned

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Job Summary The Business Analyst will support the Senior Leadership team of Cloud, Hosting and Network Operations in delivering their goals and strategic priorities within this education publishing company. The Business Analyst will be responsible for developing and refining metrics, supporting and implementing continuous communication to customers and key stakeholders, supporting and executing analysis needs and adhoc requests in support of continuous improvements and deep business understanding while supporting all executive level decisions through data and business awareness. The ideal candidate will be self-motivated, driven and keen on delivering results. Must be a strong team player who will help elevate the team and the organization to the next level. Responsibilities Support the operations team as a business partner and advisor, advising on and ensuring delivery of business and operational objectives. Support the operation teams in providing insight and analysis to the business to aid forward-looking and strategic decision making. Oversight of actual monthly results and KPIs, and informed and insightful commentary thereon. Highlight key risks and opportunities within functions and providing insights. Support decisions on project and portfolio budgets, ensuring they are measured against financial targets Identify and address operational improvement and cost opportunities. Work collaboratively with all organizations within the Company to deliver key reporting, planning and forecasting processes, providing accurate and timely future-facing data on which to base decisions. Qualifications Minimum Education Requirement Bachelor's Degree in Business or related field. Experience 2-5 years related experience. Skills Highly analytical: organizes information and manipulates data to identify/explain trends, problems and mitigating actions. Strong business acumen. Advanced Excel/Google Sheet skills (pivot tables). SQL skills a plus. Ability to create a wire frame requirements for dashboards and reports. Communication: strong verbal and written skills across the organization and with external parties. Influence: presence and confidence to interact with senior management. Ability to leverage influence across teams and cultures. Ability to leading meetings and present ideas to leadership. Emotional Intelligence (self-awareness, self-regulation, motivation, empathy, social skill) and the ability to apply it to work successfully. Collaboration: with internal and external team members. Time Management: ability to work under pressure and to tight timelines, producing a high standard of work with attention to detail. Identify opportunities for continuous improvement and innovation. Please submit your resume for consideration. Once submitted, feel free to contact Steve at 201-226-3500 for additional information. Approx. Duration: 9 months About Hired By Matrix Hired by Matrix, Inc. founded in 1986, is a certified Woman-Owned Business Enterprise (WBE) dedicated to providing the highest quality of job opportunities to our candidates and staffing services to our clients. We are a full service staffing firm with experience recruiting and delivering for IT, Accounting & Finance, Administrative & Clerical, Clinical & Scientific, and Marketing disciplines. Our long history in the staffing industry and dedication to excellence are the key differentiators that have fueled our success for over 30 years. Hired by Matrix offers our contract professionals competitive salaries, benefits after 60 days and a 401k option after one year. Name: Sr. Business Process Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSenior Business Process Analyst, Data Governance The ideal candidate will be able to apply their in-depth knowledge of business process and data mapping to reverse engineer existing Acelity processes for managing customer, product, and other data domains with the goal of identifying short- and long-term process improvements. Improvements may be defined as speed, quality, resource usage, or elimination of steps. The candidate will leverage their experience in continuous process improvement to develop an in-depth knowledge of Acelity processes and use that knowledge to work with stakeholders on creating and implementing process and system enhancements. Driven by curiosity and a passion for making work more efficient, the ideal candidate thrives in situations where they can apply problem solving know-how to understanding current state and to driving a better, more efficient and effective future state for the business. The candidate must be able to work both independently and as part of a team.  Responsible for analyzing complex processes and possess intermediate to advanced skills in process documentation. In addition to the technical skills, the candidate must be able to effectively communicate (via verbal, written and visualization means) process insights to internal stakeholders at all levels of the organization.  Reports to Director, Data Governance Primary Duties / ResponsibilitiesAct as an internal consulting resource for business partners and cross-functional projects in identifying, analyzing, mapping, and documenting business processes targeted as creating, maintaining, and processing Acelity data assets.Drive alignment between business processes and Data Governance rules.Perform in-depth, unstructured analysis on Acelity business processes and the related data assets to understand the workflow, data collection, data use, and resource usage.Work with the MDM and enterprise architecture teams to define how the process can be improved by leveraging existing and new technologies.Perform root cause analysis on business process errors and inefficiencies to determine the source, process, or person generating the issues.Work with cross-functional teams to identify interdependencies across processes and teams and how improvements can be made without disrupting order fulfillment, payment, and commissions.Leverage the Acelity Total Quality Management (TQM) process to take a weakness-based approach that drives continuous improvement.Develop a close collaboration with business and IT partners to strengthen alignment between technology and process.Communicate and collaborate effectively with all levels of the organization.Minimum QualificationsBachelor’s Degree in Business, Computer Science, or related major; Master’s Degree preferred10+ years’ experience working with end-users and key stakeholders in business process improvement rolesAdvanced process mapping skills with the ability to reverse engineer processes including data inputs and outputs to drive continuous improvementsThe ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlinesExcellent communication skills with executives and other internal stakeholders, catering to various levels of analytical proficiencyAbility to work independently and collaboratively, as required, in a fast-paced, matrixed, team environment consisting of internal and external team membersExcellent planning, organization and time management skills including the ability to support and prioritize multiple projectsResults oriented: Attention to detail, organized, and able to multi-task on multiple initiativesIntense curiosity and passion for business process improvementExperience with Master Data Management (MDM) business processes/systems and data analytics preferred.Healthcare industry experience preferred.Travel RequirementsOffice-based position10-20% within US (field visits and meetings) The information listed above is not a comprehensive list of all duties/responsibilities performed. This job description is not an employment agreement or contract. Management has the exclusive right to alter this job description at any time without notice. Any physical and mental requirements described in this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability: Acelity L.P. Inc. and its subsidiaries are an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer and give consideration for employment to qualified applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, pregnancy, national origin, age, disability, veteran status, or genetic information or any other legally protected characteristic. If you'd like more information about your EEO rights as an applicant under the law, please click here: http://www1.eeoc.gov/employers/upload/eeoc_self_print_poster.pdf VEVRAA Federal Contractor

Name: Business Analyst
Description: Business Analyst Carenet Healthcare Services San Antonio, TX 78230  Job Details  Carenet Healthcare Services is proud to open new paths to health for millions of people each year as we guide them to be more informed about their healthcare options, more engaged in their wellness, and more educated about healthcare costs the may face.  This Business Analyst position is based in San Antonio, Texas and reports directly to the Solution Manager. This hands-on challenging role is suitable for someone who comes from a strong background of business analysis and agile software development and has a can-do approach. Performing relevant and strategic analysis Your inquisitive nature and strong analytical skills will enable you to determine the root cause of a problem, identify the core need, and/or ensure all bases are covered when reviewing a potential solution All about the details You recognize the importance of designing and delivering precise documentation and communications and are skillful at managing large amounts of detailed information to scale your messaging and thought processes accordingly Engaging with the team Your diverse technical knowledge and years of experience will allow you to communicate and translate effectively across all members of the team from internal/external customers, Developers, Quality Analysts, Project Management and Solution Management Understanding the big picture You will be adept at identifying edge-cases, error conditions, dependencies and impacts to other areas by developing solid domain knowledge and deep understanding of current system functionality and creatively and positively influence solution design and product roadmaps Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to: Elicit, capture, analyze and articulate business requirements into user stories with supporting documentation such as acceptance criteria, process flows and wireframes, all in-order to clearly document and communicate a set of functional requirementsDocument existing and To Be processes using process-flow diagrams and perform detailed gap analysisPerform detailed analysis of data, uses case scenarios, systems, and integration points to identify potential gaps or areas of concernBalance business requirements with technical feasibility and sustainabilityCollaborate with the Solution Manager and technical team members to translate customer/product needs into deliverable, realistic features and improvementsEstablish and maintain agreements and understanding of requirements across all stages of the design, development and deploymentParticipate in Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing as appropriateUnderstand customer/product priorities and dependencies across multiple projects and advise the Solution Manager on the best way to approach and prioritize work to maximize valueManage updates or changes to requirements throughout the lifecycle of a user story and projectProvide Business Analysis status updates and escalate issues and risks to Solution ManagerExperience, Skills and Education:Bachelor's degree in IS or CC, or relatedMinimum 3+ years in a Business Analyst role or similarMinimum 5+ years of experience in ITAdvanced skills in Microsoft Office/Office 365 productsBroad working knowledge of Solution Development, IT process, tools and techniques, along with Production / Infrastructure Operations requiredCapable of understanding complex technical concepts and communicate and/or document them in simple, concise and unambiguous terms to non-technical team members and clientsSolid planning, prioritization, organizational and attention to detail skillsDesire to solve problems and be resourceful in seeking answers and knowledge with little or vague directionAbility to facilitate and conduct meetings while asking questions and soliciting feedback, presenting and capturing notes using various software applications and toolsComfortable delivering demonstrationsParticipation in Agile cadence such as Scrum standup meetings, backlog grooming sessions, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings preferredKnowledge of healthcare industry and HIPAA preferredExperience working in a 24/7 call center environment preferredKnowledge of coding concepts and database structures preferred Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Job Type: Full-time  Job Type: Full-time  Experience: Business Analyst: 3 years (Preferred)IT: 5 years (Preferred) Education: Bachelor's (Required)

Name: Jr-Business Analyst
Description: About the Role: Staffigo Technical Services, LLC is currently looking for Entry-level Business Analysts to join our team. This is an exciting opportunity to work with an established technology solutions and consultancy.  Our Entry-level Business Analysts are involved in all aspects of the project lifecycle and work hands on with client stakeholders during the consulting, design, and production stages of each engagement. Responsibilities:Serve as the liaison by gathering and analyzing business requirements from client and user groups and then communicating these requirements with development and software engineers.Hone client skills by gathering requirements from client discussions, interviews, testing, analysis, and other forms of requirements discoveryDocument and present requirements effectivelyWork closely in coordination with development teams to implement and develop technological solutions that satisfy client needsIterate on designs based on user feedback and UAT testing until solutions effectively meet end user requirementsLead the implementation cycle, drive decisions, track and document issues, and assist in managing and meeting tight deadlines while working with cross-functional teams to see projects from concept to completionAbility to discuss, manage, document, and design decisions to varied audiencesQualifications:Masters DegreeA self-starting, entrepreneurial attitude, willing to take initiative and work through all obstacles to accomplish tasksOutstanding communication is a must presentation, documentation, and interpersonal skills are critical for the roleStrong analytical and quantitative problem solving ability, able to think, and act decisivelyAbility to thrive when working with multiple groups in a variety of settings with ability to listen, articulate positions, advocate designs, and affect changeMust be open to relocateProficient with Microsoft Excel, Word, PowerPoint (databases and knowledge of SQL is also preferred) Staffigo Technical Services, LLC offers a competitive salary and benefits package.

Name: IT Business Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of an IT Business Analyst in San Antonio, Texas (TX).  Essential Functions:  Consult with end users and management to identify and document business requirements of proposed application systems or business mandate Evaluate current and future business needs to recommend applicable solutions to improve current systems Develop and maintain functional specifications for new or modified business systems; Inclusive of objective, input, process, output requirements, data scope/definitions/mapping, usage, formatting and security requirements Consult and coordinate with systems analysts and programmers to design and develop automated business systems Assist end users in the development of expected results for quality assurance testing; coordinate transition from development to QA. Coordinate activities between QA, Development and End Business Owners Track and document changes to business requirements and functional specifications Write and maintain detailed systems documentation, release notes, user instructions and procedures Monitor and document post-implementation problems and revision requests Aid in vendor system evaluations as requested Provide issue/resolution support as requiredREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of experience and education One (1) to three (3) years of business/systems analysis One (1) to three (3) years of progressive business operations experience, preferably in managed care or retail optical Proven experience with business analyst best practices and deliverables Strong understanding of IT Technologies and business systems processes Excellent analytical skills Experience with SQL preferred Experience with Agile development methodologies and tools preferred Language Skills:  Well-developed verbal and listening communication skills Strong written communication skills with the ability to write technical documentation, reports and correspondence Ability to clearly and concisely communicate verbally and in writing to Executive management Ability to speak and present information effectively before groups of customers or Associates of the organization Ability to read (in English) and comprehend complex documents including government regulations, detailed business requirements, instructions, correspondence, and/or memos is required Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Business Analyst II
Description: With a passion for excellence, Golden Key Group (GKG) helps clients solve their strategic, organizational and operational challenges to better meet their mission demands. We have serviced more than 25 Federal departments and agencies and several large commercial companies since our inception in 2002.Golden Key Group's talented professionals, combined with our strategic partners, bring a depth of commercial and government experience and expertise. We are relentless in delivering the highest levels of services to provide tangible value and create sustainable results for our clients.Position:  Business Analyst IIJob Summary:Job Responsibilities:Assist with the development of approaches, frameworks, and processes to achieve strategic plan objectives and program key performance indicators, as set by the CM.Provide industry expertise, including insight into industry structure, significant suppliers, value chain, and market drivers.Design and perform category research methodologies to include data mining, analysis and interpretation, and mathematical modeling to estimate category spend.Facilitate data analysis and benchmarking, development of business intelligence products, as well as performance measurement and reporting.Operate and exploit data from multiple Government tools and systems.Assist with the development of Category Strategic Plans, Category Intelligence Reports, and strategies to ensure milestones and deliverables associated with each will be met.Analyze internal category spend and integrate current Subject Matter Expert data with data collected from industry to identify opportunities to enhance mission performance, total cost of ownership or compliance through various CM processes.Engage with SME and analyze functional/operational data to assist the CM in development of performance metrics to include capability, cost, and compliance metrics.Provide Total Cost of Ownership analysis, including analysis of demand data and recommendations of innovative demand management approaches.Assess current policy impact on category performance and recommend policy changes that will positively impact category performance.Benchmark federal and commercial practices/performance, perform gap analysis between AF and benchmarked data.Recommend innovative acquisition strategies, including assessment of available Governmentwide, DoD, and AF contracts and build business cases to assist in contracting decisions. Support development, evaluation and/or implantation of Courses of Action resulting from CSP and CIRs.Identify any obstacles or risks to achieving plan outcomes, deliverables, milestones, and provide recommendations or mitigations as appropriate.Collaborate with Federal Category Management organizations to stay current on the federal Category Management program.Analyze Federal CM designated Best-In-Class contract vehicles and provide recommended usage comparing against current or projected AF strategies to provide optimal mission and Total Cost of Ownership objectives based on the CM strategic objectives.Analyze data in support of KPIs to include Spend Under Management and Addressable Spend Metrics, Provide recommendations for ‘Tier 0” actions.Collaborate with stakeholders in DoD and AF Reform initiatives as they pertain to category management activities.Enable cross-category collaboration and engage with other agencies and relevant stakeholders, in addition to the CM PSO, category manager and category teams, in support of this subtask.Develop and execute AF supplier relationship management strategies, consistent with AF Category Management standards.In collaboration with AF stakeholders, assist with development and execution of AF Strategic Sourcing strategies, consistent with AF Category Management and other acquisition standards. Qualifications: 3-5 years experience relevant to category management execution and business intelligence development/exploitationAbility to develop thorough market/business intelligence, research industry benchmarks, perform gap analysis and establish executable courses of action in support of demand management strategies, total cost management, strategic sourcing, application of best practices and supplier management strategiesExtensive knowledge and experience preparing and conducting business analyses and studies, needs assessments, requirements analysis/definition, gap analyses and cost/benefit analyses Ability to develop analyze and track metrics, performance measurements, and requirementsPeriod of Performance:Place of Performance: Joint Base, 2484 Stanley Rd, San Antonio, TX 78234EEO and Affirmative Action Policy: Golden Key Group (GKG) is an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. It is the policy of GKG to provide equal employment opportunity in accordance with all applicable Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action laws, directives and regulations to all employees and qualified applicants without regard to race, ethnicity, color, religion, national origin, sex, age, disability status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under Federal, State or Local laws.Pay Transparency Policy: In accordance with Presidential Executive Order 13665, Golden Key Group (GKG) will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. Authorization to Share Resume and Personal Information: By expressing your interest and submitting your resume for this position, you authorize Golden Key Group (GKG) to share your resume, as well as personal information included on the resume, with its subsidiaries, affiliates and teaming partners for the purpose of considering you for this position and other available positions requiring comparable skills, education and experience. Should GKG or its affiliates and teaming partners wish to initiate pre-employment discussions, you will be asked to complete an employment application and related employment documents

Name: Business Analyst - FiveOut
Description: Position Summary: The primary purpose of this position is to serve as a supporting liaison between members of the technical team and the business user community to analyze business and user needs, elicit and document requirements, identify system enhancements, and determine impacts to current processes. This is a client facing, consulting role, and as such, will require up to 80% travel. Primary Duties& Responsibilities:Elicits requirements, defines business requirements, use cases and user stories, and performs analysis on a solution implementationImplements techniques for eliciting and validating requirements including: Brainstorming, JAD Sessions, RAD Sessions, Interviews, Surveys, Nominal Group Technique, and/or Structured WalkthroughsConducts functional specification review sessions with cross-functional team membersConducts structured walkthroughs of process flow diagrams to establish“As-Is” and“To-Be” statesEnsures business requirements are met, optimal system design is achieved and differences between business requirements and systems capabilities are resolvedLeverages business experience and analytical skills to define recommendations and process improvements through industry best practices and personal line of business knowledge.Identifies potential solutions and evaluates them for both technical and business suitabilityServe as a liaison between business users and developersContributes to the adoption services/efforts of an implementation projectDevelops training materials for end usersBasic Qualifications:Bachelor’s Degree in Systems Analysis, Information Technology, Business, or related fieldAt least three (3) years’ full software lifecycle development experience in a Business Analyst or similar roleOther Position Requirements:Demonstrated ability to work autonomously on BA-related tasks/activities to develop end-customer deliverablesExperience with various project methodologies including Agile and Waterfall implementation approachesExperience with requirements management through a requirements tracking tool (e.g., Jira, SpiraTeam)Demonstrated ability to understand and explain both technical material& business-oriented consultingDemonstrated communication and presentation skillsDemonstrated skills in establishing interpersonal relationships with all levels, including business and end-user stakeholdersPreferred Requirements:Experience with one or more of the following: Adobe Experience Manager, Adobe Analytics, Adobe Target, Adobe Audience Manager, Adobe Campaign, ecommerce, web, mobile& digital marketing platforms and projectsConsulting experienceExperience delivering projects on Cloud platformsData Privacy& Security:All Sirius employees are responsible to safeguard the information and information systems that they use or handle in the execution of their duties. Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius authority.Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment.Essential Functions: This position exists to provide consulting solutions to customers and as such requires the ability to travel to and from customer sites and interact with customers on an ongoing and regular basis. The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive.  Sirius is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. As a government contractor, Sirius takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans; maintains a drug-free workplace; and participates in E-Verify.  Individuals who receive job offers will be required to complete pre-employment screening that includes a background check verifying name, residences, education, work experience, and criminal convictions consistent with the Fair Credit Reporting Act; and a drug test for controlled substances consistent with the Drug-Free Workplace Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.  Sirius will not sponsor work eligibility for this position.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Title: Senior Business Analyst  Location: San Antonio, TX (50% Remote)  Duration: 6+ Months  GDH is seeking a Senior Business Analyst to support a Fortune 500 client in San Antonio, TX. Must have experience working in the media / broadcast industry. Work will be performed 50% remotely (on-site every other week).  Responsibilities: Managing project work streams and deliverablesArticulating and training teams on high level technology conceptsCollaborating with team to create deliverables ranging from deep technical documentation to executive level readoutsTravel and work onsite at client locations (50%).  Gather business, functional and nonfunctional requirementsReview requirements with stakeholders and obtain agreementConduct stakeholder interviews and support the development of epics/user storiesDevelop collateral and documentation required by team and client Required Experience: BS degree in a Business or Technology related fieldDemonstrated interest in technologyPrior experience in any of the following - software implementations, software development, financial analysis, or technology professional servicesAbility to create technical documentation (including use cases, requirements, test plans, process maps)Aptitude for solving qualitative and quantitative problems – ability to deal with ambiguityStrong research/analytical and problem-solving skills and ability to gather, analyze and document information clearly and efficientlyAble to comprehend basic to complex business issues, contribute to IT business projects or IT sponsored technology projects by translating business needs into understandable requirementsWillingness to travel at least 50% to client locations in the US and internationally.Financial modeling and large data analysis is a Plus

Name: Business Risk Intmd Analyst
Description: About CitiCiti, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management. Our core activities are safeguarding assets, lending money, making payments and accessing the capital markets on behalf of our clients.Citi’s Mission and Value Proposition explains what we do and Citi Leadership Standards explain how we do it. Our mission is to serve as a trusted partner to our clients by responsibly providing financial services that enable growth and economic progress. We strive to earn and maintain our clients’ and the public’s trust by constantly adhering to the highest ethical standards and making a positive impact on the communities we serve. Our Leadership Standards is a common set of skills and expected behaviors that illustrate how our employees should work every day to be successful and strengthens our ability to execute against our strategic priorities.Diversity is a key business imperative and a source of strength at Citi. We serve clients from every walk of life, every background and every origin. Our goal is to have our workforce reflect this same diversity at all levels. Citi has made it a priority to foster a culture where the best people want to work, where individuals are promoted based on merit, where we value and demand respect for others and where opportunities to develop to are widely available to all.Business Risk Intmd AnalystThis position supports our Fraud Operations Retail Services function, serves as a partner to CBORC and all audit partners. This individual supports specific activity to include corrective action planning/tracking, audit support including deliverables, process improvement, continue cultural shift to prioritize/emphasize issue escalation and training completion. Supports the team in driving results associated with key projects like Call Monitoring, Complaints Capture Management and all Business Control related activities (Audit readiness - Process Reengineering, Procedure Rewrite, Training, Entitlements, Quality, Systems/Hardware, PRCM, Policy Regulations, CoB/Staffing, Vendor interactions, etc.). The role requires deep business knowledge and ability to manage significant Operating risks inherent in the day to day activities. In addition, individual will be responsible to identify control breaks and gaps, take corrective actions, execute and monitor to key risk indicators. Demonstrates the ability to lead projects and/or offer solutions at an advanced level, for assign operations area. Manage and lead Cross Departmental and Cross Functional team to deliver best in class Fraud processes, client experience and tools.Liaises with multiple operations team and serves as an analytical and/or procedural expert. Individual will represent a unit or team on cross function operational processes and project deliverables. Applies in-depth understanding of how various operational areas collectively integrate within the sub function. Applies in-depth knowledge to coordinate and contribute to initiatives that support the objectives of the operations function and overall business.Evaluates moderately complex and variable operations issues that have substantial potential impact, and recommends changes to streamline processes as required.Engages with the Policy, Analytics and Policy Execution to ensure alignment on POS experience, drive improvements in NPS, reduce Operational expense and Fraud Loss.Drive ongoing engagement with key external stakeholders (Re-engineering teams/Credit Policy) to ensure delivery of accuracy and control.Ongoing communication, updates and recommendations to Fraud Operations Leadership to ensure alignment and progress updates.Review Internal and External Control activities for improvements. Partner with the Operations Leadership team to create consistency with all Control initiatives.BA/BS degree preferred or equivalent training/experienceFraud Operations experience strongly preferredThree plus years of related business experience including at least one-year supervisory experienceProven leadership skills, leading groups or teamsStrong supervisory and basic management skillsAbility to link team objectives and business resultsExperience with conflict resolution and problem solvingStrong written, verbal and analytical skillsStrong communication and interpersonal skills

Name: Business Systems Analyst (FinancialForce)
Description: Position Summary: The Business Systems Analyst (BSA) utilizes broad knowledge of the FinancialForce applications (SCM, PSA, FFA) along with their knowledge of the business to implement IT solutions that address business needs. The BSA ensures the FinancialForce application reflects the functionality required to meet business goals and objectives. He/She will identify, analyze and implement effective technology solutions to address smaller, less complex initiatives. Along with technical knowledge of the FinancialForce application, the BSA has a deep understanding of the business process associated with its use. The BSA works closely with Business SMEs, Business Analysts, System Administrators and Developers. In addition to driving technology changes, the BSA may recommend process changes, training opportunities and/or modifications to business rules to meet goals and objectives.  Primary Duties & Responsibilities Collaborate with Business Analysts and SMEs to identify opportunities for improvement within the FinancialForce applicationUnderstand configuration, design and functionality of the FinancialForce applicationUnderstand business process and how users interact with the application to achieve outcomesParticipate in process design and documentation, utilizing various notations (Use Case, Activity Diagrams, Business Process Modeling Notation, Workflow, Swimlanes)Understand and document logical data design of FinancialForce objects utilizing Entity-Relationship Modeling or similar methodsCollaborate with Business Analysts to document requirements and establish test plans for enhancements to the FinancialForce applicationWork closely with Business Analysts, SMEs, Developers and/or Administrators to design solutions that meet requirements, utilizing tools within the application and the Force.com platformWork with Developers and Administrators as required to clarify requirements and/or provide guidance about the FinancialForce applicationActively engage with the FinancialForce user community to influence roadmap and ensure users are aware of new functionality delivered with releasesWork closely with Training Team to develop and implement material for end users of the FinancialForce applicationAssist BI and Reporting Team with report requests and provide guidance on data structure of FinancialForce application as neededAssist with service requests specific to the FinancialForce applicationParticipate in unit, regression and UAT testing Position Requirements Basic Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in an Information Technology or Business related fieldAt least 5 years experience as either:An IT Business Systems Analyst, or similar roleORA combination of 5 years total experience between a role within a relevant Line Of Business (Accounting, Operations) in the IT systems integrator industryAt least 3 years experience with FinancialForce applications or a similar system with a specific focus on Supply Chain, Professional Services Automation and Finance (can be concurrent with the 5 years Business Systems Analyst or IT systems integrator experience)Other Position Requirements:Experience with Salesforce and Force.com platform includingApproval ProcessesCustom Objects & FieldsPage LayoutsRecord typesWorkflow Rules & Process BuilderChange sets and other deployment methodsReport Types & ReportsDemonstrated financial background and understanding of Accounting principlesProven supply chain management background with an understanding of drop ship and inventory fulfillmentDemonstrated presentation and communication skills, including the ability to communicate effectively at all levels within an organizationDemonstrated written and verbal communication skillsExperience with process and data modeling conceptsData Privacy and Security:All Sirius employees are responsible to safeguard the information and information systems that they use or handle in the execution of their duties. Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius authority.Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment. The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive.  Sirius is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. As a government contractor, Sirius takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans; maintains a drug-free workplace; and participates in E-Verify.  Individuals who receive job offers will be required to complete pre-employment screening that includes a background check verifying name, residences, education, work experience, and criminal convictions consistent with the Fair Credit Reporting Act; and a drug test for controlled substances consistent with the Drug-Free Workplace Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.  Sirius will not sponsor work eligibility for this position.SDL2017

Name: Senior Consultant, Property Tax Commercial
Description: The Property Tax Senior Consultant (\"Senior Consultant\") works with a team to identify property tax savings opportunities for clients and possesses an intermediate understanding of valuation techniques. This includes conducting research, analyzing and interpreting comparable assessment data, market data and sales transactions. The Senior Consultant assists the team with assessment review and monitoring the appeal process for client portfolios.Duties and Responsibilities:Demonstrates full understanding of the annual property tax cycle for assigned real property portfolios.Builds awareness/understanding of jurisdictional rules and filing requirements.Demonstrates an ability to collect, review and fully understand client-provided data.Inspects properties and prepares appropriate reports deemed necessary by management.Analyzes assessment notices and determines potential assessment reductions.Applies software knowledge to efficiently work with client data.Possesses knowledge in assessment review, appeal determination, tax bill administration and the three valuation approaches; cost, sales comparison and income. Additionally, possesses knowledge of assessment equalization methodology that may apply in certain states.Handles appeals and monitors appeals process.Attends client status calls and meetings and provides supporting data and findings for leadership team.Works effectively with clients by taking an interest in the client’s industry and inquiring about trends and processes to gain a full understanding of their core business.Participates in recruiting efforts.Interacts and communicates effectively with team members.Performs other duties as assigned.Education and Experience:University Degree, College Diploma, or equivalent in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, Economics, Real Estate, Business Management, or other degree with MBA, MST or JD required and at least 2 years property tax related experience required. Candidates with appropriate valuation designations preferred.Computer Skills: To perform this job successfully, an individual must have intermediate knowledge of Microsoft® Word, Access, Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Internet navigation and research.Certificates and Licenses: Valid driver's license required.Supervisory Responsibilities:Requires limited supervisory responsibilities, including training employees, assigning work, and checking work for accuracy and completeness.Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disability

Name: Business Development Reports Analyst
Description: SWBC has been recognized as one of the Best Companies to Work for in Texas and has an exciting opportunity for the right individual to join an energetic and seasoned team, with an established and expanding national firm.  Headquartered in San Antonio, SWBC is a diversified financial services company providing a wide range of insurance, mortgage, and investment services to financial institutions, businesses, and individuals. With offices across the country, SWBC is committed to providing quality products, outstanding service, and customized solutions in all 50 states. SUMMARY Develops strategic reporting solutions for both internal operations and external clients while ensuring accuracy and timely delivery of reports; identifies trends and opportunities for improvement and provides recommendations to operations and other teams based on report findings; and assists the operations team in drafting reporting requirements and tracking requests through implementation. ESSENTIAL DUTIESDevelops and oversees dynamic reporting solutions for both internal and external clients to include on time and accurate distribution of daily/weekly/monthly reports as required; and performs ad hoc reports and dashboard reporting options.Analyzes reports for trends in activity and performance and provides data analysis tools such as charts, graphs, pivot tables, and the like.Identifies new reporting opportunities to include supplemental reporting, control reporting, and illogical conditions reporting to improve operational insight into business activity.Identifies and implements process improvement opportunities to include the accuracy and efficiency of assigned reports, the distribution process for internal/external reports, and the data sources for the reports.Documents and maintains detailed report specifications for all assigned reports.Creates business requirement specifications for new or existing systems.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTSMust have a Bachelor's Degree in Business Management, Finance, MIS, related field, or equivalent experience.Must have at least three to four (3-4) years in configuring and modifying reporting portals and applications to serve end users, preferably within an insurance industry environment.Experience in T-SQL and development abilities building CTE's, Stored Procedures, Functions, and Temp database usage preferred.Must have strong analytical and problem resolution skills.Must have demonstrated experience developing and maintaining reporting solutions using matrix, graphs, drill thru, drill down, and parameters in SSRS.Must have strong understanding and ability to interpret database structures with minimal direction.Must have excellent and effective communication skills, both verbal and written.Must have proficient computer and accurate keyboard skills in utilizing computer applications such as MS Word and Excel, including MS Access, WebFocus, SQL, and VB.Must have working knowledge of general office equipment such as phone system, copier, scanner, and the like.Must have excellent customer service and organizational skills to perform multiple work assignments.Must be able to perform well under pressure and to work independently with high levels of initiative.Must be able to make decisions and recommendations with minimal consultation.Must be able to sit for long periods of time performing sedentary activities.Must be able to lift up to 20 lbs. of files, supplies, documents, or other related items.Travel locally as needed.ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SWBC is a Substance-Free Workplace and requires pre-employment drug testing.  Please note, SWBC does not hire tobacco users as allowed by law.  SWBC offers an excellent employee benefits package that includes: 401(k) with company match, medical/dental, Life, Long Term Disability, Accidental Death and Dismemberment, and Long Term Care insurance policies. SWBC also provides opportunities for professional growth. To learn more about SWBC, visit our website at www.SWBC.com. If interested, please click the appropriate apply button. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements need apply.

Name: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: About TaskUs TaskUs provides a next-generation customer experience that powers the world’s most disruptive companies through the partnership of amazing people and innovative technology. We provide Ridiculously Good strategy, business process optimization, revolutionary technology and the best talent to deliver transformational, digital scale.  Our people are at the heart of everything we do. We embrace a culture that fosters a best-in-class employee experience. It’s no wonder we have been named as one of the “Best Places to Work” by the San Antonio Business Journal.  TaskUs has been recognized on the Inc. “5,000 Fastest Growing Private Companies in America” list the past five years and The Los Angeles Business Journal’s “100 Fastest Growing Private Companies” the previous three years. TaskUs is headquartered in Santa Monica, California, with operations across the United States, Latin America, and the Philippines. We are currently growing across 4 different locations in the San Antonio, TX metro area, including New Braunfels.  Job Description: The Business Intelligence Analyst position is responsible for working along with Business Intelligence team in order to provide reports, insight, and analysis for campaigns housed in our North American sites. In this highly collaborative role, you will be responsible for formulating sound strategies, coordinating the deliverables, gathering & documenting the requirements, providing insight into business operations through statistical analysis, report creation, and project management. The successful candidate will apply high-quality expertise to the implementation of our Business Intelligence solutions that leverage our reporting packages, technology platforms, and analytical tools.  The Business Intelligence Analyst role will require excellent communication and analytical skills as the candidate will work on department objectives for not just Business Intelligence but also across the business. Essential Functions and Responsibilities:Meet with end users to understand business needs and gather requirementsGathering and documenting the business/functional requirements.Translate requirements into actionable reports by working with the technical teams.Provide consultative support to our clients that is data-based, analysis-driven, and grounded in a solid understanding of call center operations and customer relationship managementManage projects, tasks, and systems utilizing project management methodology and agile methods.Perform various ad-hoc analyses, including but not limited to, customer satisfaction analysis, tenure and learning curve analysis, quality of service analysis, contractual KPI driver analysis, and financial performanceContinually optimize or build a more efficient process around reportingBecome an expert in client-owned systems and tools in order to provide recommendations to the account team on how to best utilize the system for their businessExtracting data from multiple source systems and creating comprehensive reports for our end usersExperience, Skills, and Education Requirements:2-4 years of Analyst experience preferredBachelor's Degree in Business or Computer Science field of study preferredData savvy – must be obsessed with optimization and efficiencyExperience in planning and logistics, preferably in a cross-functioning environmentExcellent verbal and written English skills. Business level Spanish a plusMicrosoft Excel expert (lookups, formulas, pivots, macros)SQL experience (writing SQL statements to analyze data: joining, filtering, aggregating)Experience in or at least ability to learn visual design using the Tableau and/or PowerBIplatformAbility to work with minimal supervision
