Name: Credit Analyst
Description: OVERVIEW OF VULCAN MATERIALS COMPANY Vulcan Materials Company is the nation's largest producer of construction aggregates and a major producer of aggregates-based construction materials including asphalt and ready-mixed concrete. We run our business with great discipline and integrity.  At Vulcan, our people share a competitive drive for excellence, in an environment of trust, teamwork, positive reinforcement, open-mindedness and communication.  Ours is a culture of mutual respect, integrity and committed spirit. Opportunity, community and unity is our way of doing business. We call it The Vulcan Way.  Summary Description of Position  The Credit Rep supports the Credit Manager in credit extension decisions, as well as monitoring Accounts Receivable in order to maximize profits, while at the same time managing the risk of loss. The Credit Rep should work to recommend improvement of the collections procedures to resolve customer and company receivable issues.  Education, Experience, Skills Required Education:High School degree required.Courses in accounting, finance or related field desirable but not essential.Any Credit Certifications a plus but not required.Experience:Individual should have 3-5 years' experience in credit and / or billing related responsibilities.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Knowledge of collection procedures. Must be able to make collection calls in a fast paced goal oriented credit department.Must be familiar with legal aspects of credit, collections, and construction or willingness to learn.Excellent customer service skills and ability to communicate clearly, both written and verbal, in an open, candid and consistent manner with both internal and external customers.Must be flexible and a team player. Establish trust and good working relationship with team members. Team members include Division Management, Sales, Account Receivable Services and credit personnel across Division lines.Must be self motivated and able to initiate and take action based on circumstances. Collaborates with others to address issues that arise.Must be able to work independently and make decisions based on information available.Proficiency in Excel and Word.Must also have ability to plan, organize and complete project assignments timely. Essential Functions Approve or decline new accounts.Perform collection calls and correspondence in a fast paced, goal oriented, and customer service focused fashion.Keep Sales personnel and Credit Manager updated on potential credit issues and offer possible solutions such as payment plans, collections proceedings, or legal action.Assist ARS in researching misapplication of payments received.Coordinates with customer service personnel, billing related issues such as pricing problems. Relays findings to sales and customer service personnel in order to insure timely resolution to billing errors.Handles daily customer calls in reference to a range of requests including requests for copies of invoices, tickets, billing errors, lien waiver requests, COD status, credit reference requests, and any additional assistance to answer customer inquiries. Behavioral Expectations  Position requires strong interpersonal skills to deal effectively with customers, sales and division personnel. Individual must pay close attention to detail and be able to work effectively under deadlines. Candidate must have the ability to understand the overall goals and processes of the company and carry out those goals into your daily decision making. Individual should have a strong drive to succeed, the motivation to improve the effectiveness of the credit function, and the willingness and ability to work independently. Individual should be able to make smart decisions, with the success of the company in mind. Position requires an individual that can recognize situations before they become issues and one who can develop a plan to avoid the problem.  Critical Competencies  High Integrity: Acts with unyielding integrity and honesty in business transactions, promoting company policies and holding self and other employees accountable, keeping promises and commitments.  Good Judgment: Knows when to stand tough and when to be flexible. Sees the "big picture" and the ramifications of one's actions.  Commitment to Learning: Applies intellect to the fullest, welcoming activities that require one to stretch.  Self-Motivated: Initiates and takes action before being required to do so. Collaborates with others to address issues that arise.  Strong Work Ethic: Uses time efficiently; finds the answers and makes sure the situation is taken care of correctly. BENEFITSVulcan Materials Company offers a competitive compensation program and benefits package including: medical/dental/vision, paid holidays and vacations, life insurance, 401(k) with match and flexible spending accounts. Vulcan is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or genetics, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law from discrimination.SDL2017

Name: IT Business/QA Analyst
Description: To be considered for employment opportunities at RBFCU, all application fields must be completed.Please enter your name and address in proper case format when completing the job application.Proper: John Examples, 123 Example StreetImproper: JOHN EXAMPLES, john examples, 123 example street, 123 EXAMPLE STREETJob Description and Requirements Works closely with end users, developers and other stake holders in an agile or traditional waterfall environment. In addition to defining, documenting and executing the testing of java/.net based web and mobile applications. You will be involved in sprint planning, daily scrum meetings, development and product deployment. Contributing to both manual and automated test case creation and execution of Java based applications, services, web applications, database objects, Mobile apps and data integrity. Responsibility to provide quality assurance and testing support for a variety of projects.  Perform tests to ensure code is functioning as defined. Develop and execute manual scripts to support testing requirements. Prepare test plans and test cases to ensure the product adheres to the system/application requirements. Analyze testing output based upon predefined input. Track and report test results to management, in the form of metrics. Actively participate in the team review of product definitions, design specifications and defect review and prioritization with other members from the QA, Development and Project Management departments. Work with business units and technical support specialist to resolve defects and installation issues. Review system/application requirements (functional specifications) for quality and completeness. Offer advice and insight on system/ application requirements and the associated effort required for quality assurance. Monitor tester progress, provide regular reports to management. Participate in functional specification reviews; identify potential defects prior to development. Ability to learn to mobile apps testing and familiar with browser and mobile device settings. Requirements:Graduation from an accredited college or university with an Associate’s Degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems or a closely related field6-year of Web application testing experienceOR successful completion of a relevant program from an accredited technical school; or an equivalent combination of education and experienceiOS, Android , different browsers knowledge is essentialAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, disability, veteran status, or other legally protected status.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Current employees and contingent workers click here to apply and search by the Job Posting Title.iHeartMediaJob Summary:iHeartMedia is the No. 1 all-in-one digital audio service with over a billion downloads; we reached our first 20 million registered users faster than any digital service in Internet history and reached 110 million registered users faster than any other radio or digital music service and even faster than Facebook. Our areas of operations include radio broadcasting, online, mobile, digital and social media, live concerts and events, syndication, music research services and independent media representation.The Senior Business Analyst will evaluate business processes, anticipate requirements, uncover areas for improvement, and create and implement solutions.Responsibilities:Partner with internal user base to capture current process workflows, establish baseline metrics, leverage Lean/Six Sigma techniques to identify quantifiable end state improvements, and create candidate roadmap to bridge the gaps between current and end states.Evaluating business processes for areas of improvement, defining measurable requirements/outcomes and proposing optimization solutions.Leading ongoing reviews of business processes and developing optimization strategies.Gathering critical information from meetings with various stakeholders and producing useful reports.Working closely with clients, technicians, and managerial staff.Effectively communicating your insights and plans to cross-functional team members and management.Performing user acceptance testingManaging projects, developing project plans, and monitoring performance.Prioritizing initiatives based on business needs and requirements.Serving as a liaison between stakeholders and users. Manage some platform config including roles, profiles, sharing rules, workflows and groups.Serve as a proxy product ownerManage operational requests and reporting including customer analysis and individual views, and troubleshoot issues.Ability to break down large projects/Business use cases into smaller work streams and stories with awareness to inter dependencies and delivering business value in an agile fashionExperience:Bachelor’s Degree required preferably in Computer Science, Business Systems Analysis, Computer Information Systems or Technology, or in lieu of degree must have a min of 5+ years of progressively complex related experience.Minimum of 5 years of progressively complex related experience working on an iterative value drive agile development teamMinimum of 6 years of progressively complex related experience in requirements gathering and elicitation processExperience working on digital transformation and modernization projectsExperienced in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and SOA design principalsProficient in leveraging Lean/Six Sigma processes.Experience in planning, presenting and reporting JIRA/Confluence/GIT updates to Senior Leaders/ManagementBackground in Data Analysis and backend Services Development a plusLocationSan Antonio, TX: 20880 Stone Oak Parkway, 78258Position Type RegularThe Company is an equal opportunity employer and will not tolerate discrimination in employment on the basis of race, color, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, disability, ethnicity, national origin, marital status, protected veteran status, genetic information, or any other legally protected classification or status.Our organization participates in E-Verify. Name: Business Analyst 2-Ops
Description: Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.  Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.  Duties and tasks are standard with some variation. Completes own role largely independently within defined policies and procedures. Attention to detail critical. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. Relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills to interact with management and possible clients desired. 2 plus years relevant work experience.  Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.  The M&A Deal Management Integration Lead will perform the following functions (but not limited to): Learning business drivers for Acquired CompanyProvide guidance on CIC Policy to Acquired CompanyAssist in determining Interim Process Design for CIC Compliance, including ETRsProvide input in Business Metric and KPI ReportingPerform Gap Analysis - Legacy Contracting to Oracle's Standard ProcessEnsure that Module Owners are engaged and that systems are readyTransition planning with GFE's by conducting Transfer of Information meetingsCollaborating with other resource teams across Finance Operations.Collaborating within the DM M&A TeamMaintain Process Workflow documents for each acquisition across all M&A DM functions.Maintain and manage the Rekey workflow and functions.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Here's the thing about challenges. They provide limitless opportunities for greatness. And what we have in mind for you is definitely big. At UnitedHealth Group, we're changing the future of health care and we have the expertise, advanced technology and global resources to make it happen. As a Senior Business Analyst, you'll work with the brightest minds in the business and find yourself digging deep to find the solutions to help people live healthier lives. You'll be responsible for analyzing, reviewing and forecasting data for operational and business planning to impact the health care system. What could be more satisfying than that? Join us! Primary Responsibilities:Analyze, review, forecast and trend complex dataPresent analysis and recommendations for operational and business review / planningSupport short - and long - term operational / strategic business activities through analysisDevelop, recommend and implement business solutions through research and analysis of data and business processesOversee and manage projects, project plans and timelines to achieve goals and outcomesTracking and analyzing education data for better learning results This is a complex, fast - paced, matrixed environment with a lot of moving parts. The challenge is in developing, enhancing and maintaining operational information and models. You'll be expected to interpret and analyze large amounts of data from multiple sources and use it to tell a meaningful story. Required Qualifications:Bachelors Degree or 5 years experience as a business analyst3 years of experience in business / finance analysisWorking knowledge of relational databases, database structures2 years project management and / or process improvement experienceIntermediate skills in MS Excel, Word, OutlookExperience building and delivering presentations to Senior LeadershipPreferred Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Business, Finance, Health Administration or related fieldExperience in HealthcareExperience working with SharepointIntermediate skills in MS AccessIntermediate skills in MS Project ManagementExperience in Education and TrainingExperience working with Tableau Careers with WellMed. Our focus is simple. We're innovators in preventative health care, striving to change the face of health care for seniors. We're impacting 240,000 lives, primarily Medicare eligible seniors in Texas and Florida, through primary and multi-specialty clinics, and contracted medical management services. We've joined Optum, part of the UnitedHealth Group family of companies, and our mission is to help the sick become well and to help patients understand and control their health in a lifelong effort at wellness. Our providers and staff are selected for their dedication and focus on preventative, proactive care. For you, that means one incredible team and a singular opportunity to do your life's best work.(sm)  Diversity creates a healthier atmosphere: UnitedHealth Group is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, protected veteran status, disability status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by law.  UnitedHealth Group is a drug-free workplace. Candidates are required to pass a drug test before beginning employment.  Job Keywords: Senior Business Analyst, Reporting Analyst, Project Manager, Project Coordinator, Training Analyst, Learning and Development, WellMed, San Antonio, Texas, TX

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job Details POSITION SUMMARY/RESPONSIBILITIES Assists the Sr. Director of Health Analytics in developing, implementing and enhancing evaluation and measurement models for quality, data and reporting that maximize evaluation and monitoring of population-focused initiatives and related enterprise priorities. Applies a logical, systematic approach to problem solving using mathematical and statistical techniques and/or innovative /quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make 'insight to action' recommendations to resolve business problems and drive change. The essence of work performed by the Sr. Business Analyst involves gathering, manipulating and synthesizing data (e.g., attributes, transactions, behaviors, etc.), models and other relevant information to draw conclusions and make recommendations resulting in implementable strategies. As a result of the focus on data gathering, synthesis and analysis, the work efforts will be central to fact-based decision-making. Succinctly delivers complex analysis/findings in a manner that conveys understanding, influences senior executives, garners support for recommendations, drives business decisions, and influences business strategy. Recommendations typically have a major impact on business results. Provides subject matter expertise in operationalizing recommendations. Works with data owners and data stewards on a tactical level in the completion and evaluation of population focused initiatives that strengthen continuum of care, quality reporting and patient safety. Creates customized reports based on data analysis and participates in efforts to improve and drive operational performance and will work to develop a culture of "self-service" reporting. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE Master's degree in healthcare administration, health services research, or related field is preferred. Bachelor's degree required. Three (3) years experience in project coordination, data manipulation techniques and proficiencies, and developing recommendations from data analysis required. Programming skills preferred, adept at queries and report writing, knowledge of data management. Experience with Allsciprts highly preferred; Demonstrated proficiency in navigating PCs; Advanced proficiency and experience with Microsoft Office Suite Experience also required with process flows, policies and procedures development, compliance monitoring, analysis, documentation skills, and service-oriented.SDL2017

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst I
Description: Job DescriptionKadence Collective is seeking a skilled Salesforce Business Analyst I to identify business needs, help create customized technology solutions, and interact between our technical team of Salesforce Developers/Consultants and our clients to maintain an inclusive and efficient environment. Job Duties:Identify key business insights based on analyzing multiple data sources and collaborate with clients to carry out technology strategies.Execute actionable recommendations after identifying business needs.Act as a liaison in understanding clients business information or process needs and communicate those needs the technical team.Facilitate business involvement, decision making, and coordination of business resources to deliver and implement high quality projects.Develop business/system artifacts requires for businesses and system requirements.Preferred candidates have the following skills:The ability to translate high volumes of data into business projections and identify opportunities to create efficiencies, and solutions using the Salesforce PlatformPrevious experience with custom CRM implementationExperience with Visio, and Microsoft Access is a plus.Excellent verbal and written communicationEthical, honest, trustworthy, and respectfulIndependent and self-motivatedProblem solver3 years of experience as a Business AnalystBachelor’s Degree, preferred in Computer Information SystemsSalesforce Administration certification preferredSalesforce experience preferred, but not required Company DescriptionKadence Collective, a Texas based Salesforce Partner company, focuses on building Salesforce solutions for businesses. We are a full service Salesforce consultancy who takes pride in the work we do. Our mission is to empower businesses to utilize the benefits of custom software applications in order to create efficiencies, reduce risk, and increase revenue by developing cost-effective, easy-to-use, quality applications built on the Salesforce platform. Our certified collective of architects, developers, and consultants have conducted hundreds of projects to include quickstarts, optimizations, community development, integrations, migrations, and AppExchange app development. Our services help you get the most out of your Salesforce investment.

Name: Business Analyst 4-Ops
Description: Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.  Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Collect, input, verify, correct, and analyze data to measure key performance indicator actual versus business objectives. Provide updates to management regarding budget to actual, informing them of deviations and opportunities. Provide management with economic impact and compliance issues surrounding key business decisions and/or deals. Communicate Oracle Business Practices to the organization and monitor process and approvals for full compliance. Drive implementation of new processes and procedures.  Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Ability to collect, organize, and display data in spreadsheet format. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.**Job:** **Business Operations**Organization:** **Oracle**Title:** *Business Analyst 4-Ops**Location:** *United States**Requisition ID:** *18001EC4*

Name: Salesforce.com Business Analyst
Description: Youll be joining a sporting business that is loved by the nation and one that values teamwork and inclusion at its core. Its an exciting time to join as a CRM Business Analyst as the business completes their digital transformation and focuses their sights on more game changing projects. Were looking for a Salesforce Business Analyst to join the fast-paced digital arm of a well-known sporting organisation. Youll be working in a great office space within a forward thinking and passionate customer marketing team to deliver critical projects across the organisation. With your salesforce expertise youll support and grow the use of salesforce across the business. Youll work closely with the commercial team and play a key role in improving business processes and growing the organisations ability to make data driven decisions.Skills and experience required; Salesforce Certified Administrator SQL Experience working in a data warehouse or with data solutions is a bonus Articulate communicator Strong stakeholder relationship skills 2 years experience in a Salesforce admin or Salesforce Development role. Complete the configuration for user stories within Salesforce, AppExchange products, or other cloud-based technologies Collaborate with developers to test and verify that solutions will meet the business requirements Participate in key meetings with clients including requirement sessions, system demos, user acceptance testing, and end user training

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 911098  Business Systems Analyst ****US Citizens and those authorized to work in the US without sponsorship are encouraged to apply. We cannot provide sponsorship at this time**** If interested please send resumes to Lauren Taylor at lataylor@apexsystems.com IT Systems Analysts are responsible for leading, managing, and facilitating activities pertaining to the development and completion of system deliverables. System deliverables include validating artifacts, developing system requirements, and assisting with translation into functional system specifications. Incumbents work with business and IT delivery teams in order to understand the business vision and collaborate with IT delivery teams to enrich understanding by thorough deliverables development and reviews. IT Systems Analysts research and help resolve defects and production issues with business and technical teams and assist with defining and creating test case scenarios. In addition, responsibilities include participation in the sign-off of key deliverables and the storage of critical artifacts, as well as accountability for managing systems requirements and artifacts to IT team members. Understands and applies advanced knowledge of the business and technical domains supported to include its products, processes and services.  Serves as a business proxy/SME on business topics within one or more domain.  Serves as the conduit between the customer community (internal and external) and the software development team through which requirements flow.  Facilitates/oversees the analysis and design of technology solutions to ensure business needs are met.  Employs creativity, ingenuity, and innovation in the search for technology solutions designed to support analyses and business need.  Effectively leads the elicitation and documentation of system requirements and solutions into work products.  Proactively communicates and collaborates with external and internal customers to analyze information needs and requirements to deliver system artifacts as needed.  For example: Functional/system requirements, use cases, GUI specifications and Business Rules.  Effectively serves and business and technical SME on PLN efforts, research and other pre project topics.  Analyzes and verifies requirements for completeness, consistency, comprehensibility, feasibility, and conformity to standards.  Manages and ensures traceability of approved and base lined work products through the software development lifecycle to include application specifications, design, development, usability, testing, implementation, and defect prioritization.  Provides guidance on Test Scenarios and reviews Test Cases and ensures coverage of testable requirements.  Collaborates with Test Leads and subject matter experts to establish the Testing Approach including usability and performance needs.  Provides certification and actively participates in defect management activities to confirm requirements are being met.  Manages change control for affected system artifacts.  If interested please send resumes to Lauren Taylor at lataylor@apexsystems.com EEO EmployerApex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at 844-463-6178

Name: WellMed: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Challenge brings out the best in us. It also attracts the best. That's why you'll find some of the most amazingly talented people in health care here. Bring your skills and talents to a role where you'll have the opportunity to make an impact on a huge scale. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for creating and refining business and systems requirements to address business opportunities and formulating documentation to support the development and implementation of the technical solution. This position plays a major role in the development and implementation of core business systems and mentors and guides other Business Systems Analysts. In addition, the Business Systems Analyst serves as the liaison between business users and technology programmers to understand user needs and develop required reporting and data analysis and may serve in a project manager capacity for smaller work efforts. Primary Responsibilities: Analyzes business needs, documents requirements and translates needs into functional, nonfunctional and/or technical specifications  Delivers requirements, performs analysis, and evaluates downstream business, systems, process, and/or organizational impacts  Plans and assists with oversight of testing processes and activities including defect identification and resolution  Analyzes charts and/or diagrams of the problem to be programmed and defines system requirements in terms of system capabilities  Develops or assists in the development of work plans, time schedules, and project task items and schedules and assists with estimating resource needs for analysts, programmers, user personnel, consultants, equipment, and prepares routine project status reports  Assists in the development of project cost and benefit estimates to establish project worth including the development of alternative considerations. This will result in recommendations for the installation of new systems or equipment, or to change existing systems and equipment  Advises the appropriate people on the implications of existing IT systems that can be applied to a problem. Identifies risks and issues, and seeks approval on complex matters  Checks, instructs, assigns work, and otherwise functionally directs technical staff in order to achieve desired end-results on complex problems  Provides subject matter expert and operational support to internal business partners  Performs all other related duties as assigned

Name: Technical Business Analyst
Description: Title: Technical Business Analyst Duration: Perm Direct Hire Location: San Antonio, TX Hours: 8-5 Interview Process: Quick Phone Screening follow by either one and done Video IV or additional phone interview Number of Openings: 3+ Relocation Package: Yes Remote Option: No Industry: Banking/Healthcare Day to Day Responsibilities:  Headed down scaled agile path, so these people will likely perform two roles: Supporting the local product owner who is driving scrum teamAt some level, also supporting the program level that is feeding the SAFe epic/feature mold Deliverables – doesn’t want you to write acceptance criteria for POs, rather support them and work so they understand what good acceptance criteria look likeFor example, the business wants these three things – what value do they bring. Based on what value, properly sequence them – decomposition to still provide valueWrite user stories with acceptance criteriaHas flow of work from business to IT teams – that flow of work needs optimization – person will be the proxy between business and ITFiguring out ways to add value and helping POs get to detailed definitionReverse engineeringWill not be acting in SM roleTesting support: For example, won’t be writing and executing 100 test cases, but will: Provide FB as proxy for POServe as interim proxy for PO to provide FB as they’re constantly trying to shorten FB loopsWhat they say should be 80-90% of what PO would sayData analysis – will be writing some queries – analysis of work in backlog – mid-level analysis, not deep # crunching, not doing true data miningExperience Need:At least one will need SAFe experienceAll need Agile experience – creating user storiesAbility to create detailed acceptance criteria – understand the definition of success – influence this criteria towards value and level of granularityDomain experience a plusSomeone that is going to ask WHY a lot? Dig through data to see if aligns with rational. Dig through some of code to reverse engineer how it works.Rational Team Concert or Jira – can train on it – proven ability to learn new toolsFlexible with years of experience – open to different levels – some mix of Mid/Sr/LeadTesting supportData analysis skillsSoft skills:Can-do attitudeTakes ownershipUrgency to make progress/try next thing – part of challenge is to take an attempt at something and not make a lot of progress the 1st time and have to get back on horse and try different routeFortitudeResiliencyGood team playerStrong communication and documentation skills - provided by Dice  SAFe, Agile, SQL, Cobol, RTC, Jira, Data Analysis exp, reverse engineering

Name: Business Systems Analyst
Description: RESPONSIBILITIES:Kforce has a client in search of a Business Systems Analyst in San Antonio, Texas (TX).  Summary:  The main function of a business systems analyst is to analyze science, engineering, business and all other data processing problems for application to electronic data processing systems. A typical business systems analyst is responsible for analyzing user requirements, procedures and problems to automate or improve existing systems and review computer system capabilities, workflow and scheduling limitations.  Job Responsibilities:  Supervise the testing, maintenance, and monitoring of computer programs and systems, including coordinating the installation of computer programs and systems Advise clients regarding the nature of the information processing or computation needs Advise management on current system principles and necessary updates and recommendations Supervise the expansion or modification of system to serve new purposes or improve work flow Interview or survey workers, observe job performance or perform the job to determine what information is processed and how it is processed Train staff and users to work with computer systems and programsREQUIREMENTS: Bachelor's degree in a Technical field such as Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related field required; MBA or other related advanced degree preferred 10+ years of experience required Expert ability to work independently and manage one's time Expert leadership and mentoring skills necessary to provide support and constructive performance feedback Expert knowledge of design techniques and principles involved in production of drawings and models Verbal and written communication skills, problem solving skills, attention to detail and interpersonal skills Kforce is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

Name: Business Analyst - IT
Description: Carenet Healthcare Services is proud to open new paths to health for millions of people each year as we guide them to be more informed about their healthcare options, more engaged in their wellness, and more educated about healthcare costs the may face.  At Carenet Healthcare Services, our teams have the wonderful responsibility to guide millions of people to the healthcare resources and cost savings they need, and to help make the healthcare process less complicated for them. Whether it's finding the best doctors and pharmacies under their health insurance coverage, receiving expert guidance from a registered nurse, enrolling in extra benefits such as gym memberships, or getting an expensive test or procedure done without breaking the bank we can guide them to the right resources at the right time.  This Business Analyst position is based in San Antonio, Texas and reports directly to the Solution Manager. This hands-on challenging role is suitable for someone who comes from a strong background of business analysis and agile software development and has a can-do approach. Objective of this role: You will be working closely with a highly knowledgeable professional team, helping them analyze the needs of our client and internal partners and translating those needs into requirements documentation, user stories and acceptance criteria. You will have a high level of confidence and can negotiate at the highest level with people both face to face and remote.  Relevant and strategic analysis  Your inquisitive nature and strong analytical skills will enable you to determine the root cause of a problem, identify the core need, and/or ensure all bases are covered when reviewing a potential solution  All about the details  You recognize the importance of designing and delivering precise documentation and communications and be skillful at managing large amounts of detailed information to scale your messaging and thought processes accordingly  Engaging with the team  Your diverse technical knowledge and years of experience will allow you to communicate and translate effectively across all members of the team from internal/external customers, Developers, Quality Analysts, Project Management and Solution Management  Understanding the big picture  You will be adept at identifying edge-cases, error conditions, dependencies and impacts to other areas by developing solid domain knowledge and deep understanding of current system functionality and creatively and positively influence solution design and product roadmaps  Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to: Elicit, capture, analyze and articulate business requirements into user stories with supporting documentation such as acceptance criteria, process flows and wireframes, all in-order to clearly document and communicate a set of functional requirementsRepresent the Solution Development team as a subject matter expertDocument existing and To Be processes using process-flow diagrams and perform detailed gap analysisPerform detailed analysis of data, uses case scenarios, systems, and integration points to identify potential gaps or areas of concernBalance business requirements with technical feasibility and sustainabilityCollaborate with the Solution Manager and technical team members to translate customer/product needs into deliverable, realistic features and improvementsEstablish and maintain agreements and understanding of requirements across all stages of the design, development and deploymentParticipate in Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing as appropriateUnderstand customer/product priorities and dependencies across multiple projects and advise the Solution Manager on the best way to approach and prioritize work to maximize valueManage updates or changes to requirements throughout the lifecycle of a user story and projectProvide Business Analysis status updates and escalate issues and risks to Solution ManagerExperience, Skills and Education:Bachelor's degree in IS or CC, or relatedMinimum 3+ years in a Business Analyst role or similarMinimum 5+ years of experience in ITAdvanced skills in Microsoft Office/Office 365 productsBroad working knowledge of Solution Development, IT process, tools and techniques, along with Production / Infrastructure Operations requiredCapable of understanding complex technical concepts and communicate and/or document them in simple, concise and unambiguous terms to non-technical team members and clientsStrong interpersonal and leadership skillsSolid planning, prioritization, organizational and attention to detail skillsAbility to quickly assimilate and apply new concepts, business models, and technologiesDesire to solve problems and be resourceful in seeking answers and knowledge with little or vague directionAbility to facilitate and conduct meetings while asking questions and soliciting feedback, presenting and capturing notes using various software applications and toolsComfortable delivering demonstrationsParticipation in Agile cadence such as Scrum standup meetings, backlog grooming sessions, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings preferredKnowledge of healthcare industry and HIPAA preferredExperience working in a 24/7 call center environment preferredKnowledge of coding concepts and database structures preferredSDL2017

Name: Senior Salesforce Business Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionSummary: The Senior Salesforce Business Analyst position works directly with business departments within Acelity to build and manage a pipeline of features and enhancements on the Global Salesforce platform. A successful candidate must have experience defining and optimizing business processes in the following areas: Commercial Operations / Sales Operations, Sales Automation, Marketing Automation, and Customer Relationship Management. The position liaises with both the business and technical organization to determine the scope, timeline and budgetary impacts of new features and enhancements. Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Translate business goals and objectives into strategic business capabilities.Benchmark current and future processes against best industry practices.Develop a roadmap of projects and initiatives for enablement of new capabilities.Project Management and mentorship of junior level analysts.Engage in efforts to establish scope and business case for new programs and initiatives.Deploy an appropriate methodology for the identification and documentation of business requirements.Plan and manage user acceptance testing activities.Support Organization Change Management activities with end users and supporting functional departments.Provide the methodology, standards and tools for efficient and effective process optimization.Identify technical functionality that aligns with desired new business capabilities.Identify opportunities to innovate and differentiate Acelity from its competitors.Up to 20% travel requiredEducation and Experience:Bachelor's degree required, preferably in Business, Engineering or Computer Science or related field required. Masters degree in Business or Information Technology preferredAt least Eight years experience within a business function (Commercial Operations / Sales Operations, Sales Automation, Marketing Automation, and Customer Relationship Management) with business analysis or business process improvement activity in an enterprise setting requiredPrevious involvement in the deployment or optimization of a Global Customer Relationship Management platform (Salesforce.com) requiredPrevious experience deploying Salesforce platform globally a plusPrevious position in Pharma or Medical Device industry a plusExperience working in a projects where multiple functions work in a matrix structure a plusExperience with managed packages such as Cornerstone (CFS), Apttus CLM, Marketing Cloud integration, and Cvent a plusKnowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:Salesforce Administrator Certification required.Salesforce Service Cloud Certitication a plusExperience with process improvement techniques and tools. Lean or Six Sigma preferred.Understanding of the major functions in a global organization.Strong communication (written and oral) and presentation skills.Ability to work comfortably at all levels within the organization up to the senior management level. The information listed above is not a comprehensive list of all duties/responsibilities performed. This job description is not an employment agreement or contract. Management has the exclusive right to alter this job description at any time without notice. Any physical and mental requirements described in this job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  EOE AA M/F/Vet/Disability: Acelity L.P. Identifies and interprets trends and patterns in datasets to locate influences. Creates specifications for reports and analysis based on business needs and required or available data elements. Name: Clinical Business Intelligence Analyst
Description: Job Summary:Designs and develops organizational relevant data analysis and reporting in support of clinical and institutional operations.Job Duties:1. Queries, reviews and analyzes data from multiple internal/external sources to create dashboards, drill down capable reports and key performance indicators. 2. Collaborates and communicates results and provide awareness of processes to leadership, while performing analysis. 3. Documents the report templates and maintains a library of active reports. 4. Validates the extraction, transformation and loading of source data before migration to various data repository (Clarity, Caboodle, and other databases). 5. Supports ongoing collaboration with subject matter experts and ad-hoc reporting requests from clinical operations, administrative leaders and physicians. 6. Serves as a liaison to research focused departments and related clinical data needs.7. Develops, documents and prepares user test plans as a part of the team supporting Epic upgrade cycle or other supported systems.Education:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Technology or related field.Experience:One (1) year of related experience.Preferred Qualifications:Education in Information Technology or related field. Work experience in Healthcare Analytics.  Additional Information

Name: Analyst
Description: BlackStar Fiber, LP is looking for an Analyst with strong analytical and interpersonal skills to assist in the development of new business opportunities and leverage its existing asset base. The ideal candidate will be able to identify and solve a wide variety of interdisciplinary problems. Position will involve work spanning across multiple divisions within the company including fiber optics, oil and gas, and telecommunications.  Examples of projects the applicant will be responsible for: Performing financial analysis of new business opportunities and existing contractsPerforming data-driven analysis through applications like Excel, ArcGIS, and SpotfireBuilding reports to assist in effective communication between business divisionsAssisting in contract management and project controlsBuilding and revising presentations for customers, management, and the board of directors Position is an entry-level position with 0-2 years of experience expected. Experience with any of the following is desired but not required: Geographic Information Systems (ArcGIS, QGIS, Google Earth)Programming or Coding Experience (Any, but Python is further preferred)Telecommunications or Oil and Gas industry experience Significant growth opportunities exist within the organization for an individual who can learn and adapt quickly to different technical challenges and disciplines. Ability to self-select areas of interest and assist other divisions during free time is encouraged. Culture is relaxed, with an emphasis on results based performance and personal responsibility. Normal operating hours are 8 to 6 Monday through Thursday and 8 to 12 on Friday.  BlackStar Fiber, LP is a subsidiary of EPIC Pipeline Holdings, LP a private equity backed midstream oil and gas operator.  Job Type: Full-time

Name: Business Development Reports Analyst
Description: SWBC has been recognized as one of the Best Companies to Work for in Texas and has an exciting opportunity for the right individual to join an energetic and seasoned team, with an established and expanding national firm.  Headquartered in San Antonio, SWBC is a diversified financial services company providing a wide range of insurance, mortgage, and investment services to financial institutions, businesses, and individuals. With offices across the country, SWBC is committed to providing quality products, outstanding service, and customized solutions in all 50 states. SUMMARY Develops strategic reporting solutions for both internal operations and external clients while ensuring accuracy and timely delivery of reports; identifies trends and opportunities for improvement and provides recommendations to operations and other teams based on report findings; and assists the operations team in drafting reporting requirements and tracking requests through implementation. ESSENTIAL DUTIESDevelops and oversees dynamic reporting solutions for both internal and external clients to include on time and accurate distribution of daily/weekly/monthly reports as required; and performs ad hoc reports and dashboard reporting options.Analyzes reports for trends in activity and performance and provides data analysis tools such as charts, graphs, pivot tables, and the like.Identifies new reporting opportunities to include supplemental reporting, control reporting, and illogical conditions reporting to improve operational insight into business activity.Identifies and implements process improvement opportunities to include the accuracy and efficiency of assigned reports, the distribution process for internal/external reports, and the data sources for the reports.Documents and maintains detailed report specifications for all assigned reports.Creates business requirement specifications for new or existing systems.MINIMUM REQUIREMENTSMust have a Bachelor's Degree in Business Management, Finance, MIS, related field, or equivalent experience.Must have at least three to four (3-4) years in configuring and modifying reporting portals and applications to serve end users, preferably within an insurance industry environment.Experience in T-SQL and development abilities building CTE's, Stored Procedures, Functions, and Temp database usage preferred.Must have strong analytical and problem resolution skills.Must have demonstrated experience developing and maintaining reporting solutions using matrix, graphs, drill thru, drill down, and parameters in SSRS.Must have strong understanding and ability to interpret database structures with minimal direction.Must have excellent and effective communication skills, both verbal and written.Must have proficient computer and accurate keyboard skills in utilizing computer applications such as MS Word and Excel, including MS Access, WebFocus, SQL, and VB.Must have working knowledge of general office equipment such as phone system, copier, scanner, and the like.Must have excellent customer service and organizational skills to perform multiple work assignments.Must be able to perform well under pressure and to work independently with high levels of initiative.Must be able to make decisions and recommendations with minimal consultation.Must be able to sit for long periods of time performing sedentary activities.Must be able to lift up to 20 lbs. of files, supplies, documents, or other related items.Travel locally as needed.ADDITIONAL INFORMATION SWBC is a Substance-Free Workplace and requires pre-employment drug testing.  Please note, SWBC does not hire tobacco users as allowed by law.  SWBC offers an excellent employee benefits package that includes: 401(k) with company match, medical/dental, Life, Long Term Disability, Accidental Death and Dismemberment, and Long Term Care insurance policies. SWBC also provides opportunities for professional growth. To learn more about SWBC, visit our website at www.SWBC.com. If interested, please click the appropriate apply button. Only those candidates who meet the minimum requirements need apply.

Name: Senior Business Analyst
Description: Job Details POSITION SUMMARY/RESPONSIBILITIES Assists the Sr. Director of Health Analytics in developing, implementing and enhancing evaluation and measurement models for quality, data and reporting that maximize evaluation and monitoring of population-focused initiatives and related enterprise priorities. Applies a logical, systematic approach to problem solving using mathematical and statistical techniques and/or innovative /quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make 'insight to action' recommendations to resolve business problems and drive change. The essence of work performed by the Sr. Business Analyst involves gathering, manipulating and synthesizing data (e.g., attributes, transactions, behaviors, etc.), models and other relevant information to draw conclusions and make recommendations resulting in implementable strategies. As a result of the focus on data gathering, synthesis and analysis, the work efforts will be central to fact-based decision-making. Succinctly delivers complex analysis/findings in a manner that conveys understanding, influences senior executives, garners support for recommendations, drives business decisions, and influences business strategy. Recommendations typically have a major impact on business results. Provides subject matter expertise in operationalizing recommendations. Works with data owners and data stewards on a tactical level in the completion and evaluation of population focused initiatives that strengthen continuum of care, quality reporting and patient safety. Creates customized reports based on data analysis and participates in efforts to improve and drive operational performance and will work to develop a culture of "self-service" reporting. EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE Master's degree in healthcare administration, health services research, or related field is preferred. Bachelor's degree required. Three (3) years experience in project coordination, data manipulation techniques and proficiencies, and developing recommendations from data analysis required. Programming skills preferred, adept at queries and report writing, knowledge of data management. Experience with Allsciprts highly preferred; Demonstrated proficiency in navigating PCs; Advanced proficiency and experience with Microsoft Office Suite Experience also required with process flows, policies and procedures development, compliance monitoring, analysis, documentation skills, and service-oriented.SDL2017

Name: Credit Analyst
Description: OVERVIEW OF VULCAN MATERIALS COMPANY Vulcan Materials Company is the nation's largest producer of construction aggregates and a major producer of aggregates-based construction materials including asphalt and ready-mixed concrete. We run our business with great discipline and integrity.  At Vulcan, our people share a competitive drive for excellence, in an environment of trust, teamwork, positive reinforcement, open-mindedness and communication.  Ours is a culture of mutual respect, integrity and committed spirit. Opportunity, community and unity is our way of doing business. We call it The Vulcan Way.  Summary Description of Position  The Credit Rep supports the Credit Manager in credit extension decisions, as well as monitoring Accounts Receivable in order to maximize profits, while at the same time managing the risk of loss. The Credit Rep should work to recommend improvement of the collections procedures to resolve customer and company receivable issues.  Education, Experience, Skills Required Education:High School degree required.Courses in accounting, finance or related field desirable but not essential.Any Credit Certifications a plus but not required.Experience:Individual should have 3-5 years' experience in credit and / or billing related responsibilities.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Knowledge of collection procedures. Must be able to make collection calls in a fast paced goal oriented credit department.Must be familiar with legal aspects of credit, collections, and construction or willingness to learn.Excellent customer service skills and ability to communicate clearly, both written and verbal, in an open, candid and consistent manner with both internal and external customers.Must be flexible and a team player. Establish trust and good working relationship with team members. Team members include Division Management, Sales, Account Receivable Services and credit personnel across Division lines.Must be self motivated and able to initiate and take action based on circumstances. Collaborates with others to address issues that arise.Must be able to work independently and make decisions based on information available.Proficiency in Excel and Word.Must also have ability to plan, organize and complete project assignments timely. Essential Functions Approve or decline new accounts.Perform collection calls and correspondence in a fast paced, goal oriented, and customer service focused fashion.Keep Sales personnel and Credit Manager updated on potential credit issues and offer possible solutions such as payment plans, collections proceedings, or legal action.Assist ARS in researching misapplication of payments received.Coordinates with customer service personnel, billing related issues such as pricing problems. Relays findings to sales and customer service personnel in order to insure timely resolution to billing errors.Handles daily customer calls in reference to a range of requests including requests for copies of invoices, tickets, billing errors, lien waiver requests, COD status, credit reference requests, and any additional assistance to answer customer inquiries. Behavioral Expectations  Position requires strong interpersonal skills to deal effectively with customers, sales and division personnel. Individual must pay close attention to detail and be able to work effectively under deadlines. Candidate must have the ability to understand the overall goals and processes of the company and carry out those goals into your daily decision making. Individual should have a strong drive to succeed, the motivation to improve the effectiveness of the credit function, and the willingness and ability to work independently. Individual should be able to make smart decisions, with the success of the company in mind. Position requires an individual that can recognize situations before they become issues and one who can develop a plan to avoid the problem.  Critical Competencies  High Integrity: Acts with unyielding integrity and honesty in business transactions, promoting company policies and holding self and other employees accountable, keeping promises and commitments.  Good Judgment: Knows when to stand tough and when to be flexible. Sees the "big picture" and the ramifications of one's actions.  Commitment to Learning: Applies intellect to the fullest, welcoming activities that require one to stretch.  Self-Motivated: Initiates and takes action before being required to do so. Collaborates with others to address issues that arise.  Strong Work Ethic: Uses time efficiently; finds the answers and makes sure the situation is taken care of correctly. BENEFITSVulcan Materials Company offers a competitive compensation program and benefits package including: medical/dental/vision, paid holidays and vacations, life insurance, 401(k) with match and flexible spending accounts. Vulcan is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability or genetics, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law from discrimination.SDL2017

Name: Credit Analyst
Description: A growing and stable community-oriented financial institution in the Area is confidentially looking to add a Credit Analyst to their team. This position offers great opportunity for advancement and facilitates close working relationships with executive management, commercial lenders, and customers to grow the bank's presence in the area.  Responsibilities Include: Analyze credit information and business financial statementsReview C&I, agriculture, commercial real estate, and other business loansPerforms credit administration, financial analysis, monitoring and due diligence review of various financial packages and loan originations for the association and other reports as requested by management.Ensures that all assigned loans are properly risk rated, assigned loss given defaults are correct and performance status assignments are proper.Maintain an assigned portfolio of creditsPerform risk management responsibilities Job Requirements: Bachelor's Degree (can be substituted with 3+ years direct experience)Three (3) or more years of experience in the banking or financial services industryExperience in the administration and analysis of credit and working with commercial and mortgage loans preferredExcellent communication skillsDemonstrated risk management skills Please contact our Texas Banking Specialist Jarrad Emery directly at 605.809.8545 or email me at Jarrad.Emery@gogpac.com for more information on this, or any other positions you might be interested in. GPAC (Growing People and Companies) is an award winning search firm specializing in placing quality professionals within multiple industries across the United States over the past 27 years. We are extremely competitive, client-focused and realize that our value is in our ability to deliver the right solutions at the right time.

Name: Salesforce Business Analyst I
Description: Job DescriptionKadence Collective is seeking a skilled Salesforce Business Analyst I to identify business needs, help create customized technology solutions, and interact between our technical team of Salesforce Developers/Consultants and our clients to maintain an inclusive and efficient environment. Job Duties:Identify key business insights based on analyzing multiple data sources and collaborate with clients to carry out technology strategies.Execute actionable recommendations after identifying business needs.Act as a liaison in understanding clients business information or process needs and communicate those needs the technical team.Facilitate business involvement, decision making, and coordination of business resources to deliver and implement high quality projects.Develop business/system artifacts requires for businesses and system requirements.Preferred candidates have the following skills:The ability to translate high volumes of data into business projections and identify opportunities to create efficiencies, and solutions using the Salesforce PlatformPrevious experience with custom CRM implementationExperience with Visio, and Microsoft Access is a plus.Excellent verbal and written communicationEthical, honest, trustworthy, and respectfulIndependent and self-motivatedProblem solver3 years of experience as a Business AnalystBachelor’s Degree, preferred in Computer Information SystemsSalesforce Administration certification preferredSalesforce experience preferred, but not required Company DescriptionKadence Collective, a Texas based Salesforce Partner company, focuses on building Salesforce solutions for businesses. We are a full service Salesforce consultancy who takes pride in the work we do. Our mission is to empower businesses to utilize the benefits of custom software applications in order to create efficiencies, reduce risk, and increase revenue by developing cost-effective, easy-to-use, quality applications built on the Salesforce platform. Our certified collective of architects, developers, and consultants have conducted hundreds of projects to include quickstarts, optimizations, community development, integrations, migrations, and AppExchange app development. Our services help you get the most out of your Salesforce investment.

Name: Business Analyst 4-Ops
Description: Provides programs to improve operational efficiency, consistency, and compliance in support of the organization*s financial and tactical business objectives. Provides business practices and processes. Develops, communicates, and trains the organization on business practices and processes.  Serve as a liaison with other divisions such as Finance, Contracts, HR, Legal, Shared Services, Accounts Receivable, Purchasing, and Risk Management in an effort to ensure accurate and timely transaction processing. Follow-through skills necessary to get information from internal and third parties and have data errors/omissions corrected. For this, relationship management skills strongly desired. Strong written and verbal communication skills. 8 plus years relevant work experience. Oracle is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. Our people are at the heart of everything we do. We embrace a culture that fosters a best-in-class employee experience. Name: ITSM Business Analyst / Problem Manager
Description: Energize your career with one of Healthcares fastest growing companies.  You dream of a great career with a great company where you can make an impact and help people. We dream of giving you the opportunity to do just this. And with the incredible growth of our business, its a dream that definitely can come true. Already one of the worlds leading Healthcare companies, UnitedHealth Group is restlessly pursuing new ways to operate our service centers, improve our service levels and help people lead healthier lives. We live for the opportunity to make a difference and right now, we are living it up.  This opportunity is with one of our most exciting business areas: Optum a growing part of our family of companies that make UnitedHealth Group a Fortune 6 leader.  Optum helps nearly 60 million Americans live their lives to the fullest by educating them about their symptoms, conditions and treatments; helping them to navigate the system, finance their healthcare needs and stay on track with their health goals. No other business touches so many lives in such a positive way. And we do it all with every action focused on our shared values of Integrity, Compassion, Relationships, Innovation & Performance.The ITSM Business Analyst / Problem Manager will be responsible for reviewing IT processes in accordance to best practices. He or she should be a practitioner in the area, focused on IT Service Management functions, including but not limited to areas such as Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management, Configuration Management, Service Catalog, Service Level Management, and Knowledge Management. Identified and Contributes process evolution to develop and assist with implementation of continual service improvement cycles across all operational processes. Designs ITSM work flows as directed, creating efficiencies and delivery standards for all IT Service Management stakeholders. Works on problems of diverse scope where analysis of data requires evaluation of identifiable factors. Primary Responsibilities:  Participates with cross functional teams that contribute to the definition of the processes, standards, and methodologies, as well as their adoption and governance  Monitors and reports on adherence to defined ITSM processes  Responsible for the identification of integration points with other processes. Ensures all integrated processes are fully documented, understood, and maintained  Responsible for the identification of appropriate automation and process technology support to further process improvement within the environment  Responsible for the creation of, manipulation of, and the analyses of applicable data as directed, as well as making recommendations for new metrics, KPIs, and additional reporting as directed  Updates and maintains the IT Infrastructure Metrics Dashboard / Scorecard  Partner with stakeholders to ensure ITSM processes are understood, adhered to, and improved  Interpret metrics and participate in the development of appropriate actionable plans for the definition of a new and / or improvement of existing ITSM processes. This will include detailed tactical steps to drive the changes desired with clearly defined success criteria  Maintains the Major Incident Management On-Call listing within ServiceNow  Reviews Knowledge Articles for process compliance  Demonstrates good judgment and logic in selecting methods and techniques for obtaining solutions  Interacts with senior internal and external personnel

Name: WellMed: Business Systems Analyst
Description: Challenge brings out the best in us. It also attracts the best. That's why you'll find some of the most amazingly talented people in health care here. Bring your skills and talents to a role where you'll have the opportunity to make an impact on a huge scale. This is the place to do your life's best work.(sm)  The Business Systems Analyst is responsible for creating and refining business and systems requirements to address business opportunities and formulating documentation to support the development and implementation of the technical solution. This position plays a major role in the development and implementation of core business systems and mentors and guides other Business Systems Analysts. In addition, the Business Systems Analyst serves as the liaison between business users and technology programmers to understand user needs and develop required reporting and data analysis and may serve in a project manager capacity for smaller work efforts. Primary Responsibilities: Analyzes business needs, documents requirements and translates needs into functional, nonfunctional and/or technical specifications  Delivers requirements, performs analysis, and evaluates downstream business, systems, process, and/or organizational impacts  Plans and assists with oversight of testing processes and activities including defect identification and resolution  Analyzes charts and/or diagrams of the problem to be programmed and defines system requirements in terms of system capabilities  Develops or assists in the development of work plans, time schedules, and project task items and schedules and assists with estimating resource needs for analysts, programmers, user personnel, consultants, equipment, and prepares routine project status reports  Assists in the development of project cost and benefit estimates to establish project worth including the development of alternative considerations. This will result in recommendations for the installation of new systems or equipment, or to change existing systems and equipment  Advises the appropriate people on the implications of existing IT systems that can be applied to a problem. Identifies risks and issues, and seeks approval on complex matters  Checks, instructs, assigns work, and otherwise functionally directs technical staff in order to achieve desired end-results on complex problems  Provides subject matter expert and operational support to internal business partners  Performs all other related duties as assigned

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Job Title: Financial Analyst Assignment Duration: 3 months (Potential to Extend/Convert) Work Location: San Antonio, TX-78218 Hours: 45 to 55 hours a week Overtime Status: No Interview Process: Online excel assessment, phone screen, followed by in person interviews with the teamResponsibilities:Assist in several different projects required customer and product level analyses, creating revenue forecasts based on several different inputs, creating expense forecasts (both opex and capex) based on headcount and non-headcount assumptions, etc.Required Skills (and years of experience): TOP 5 SKILLS NEEDEDExcel – financial modeling and reporting (3 to 5 years)Work with large data sets and draw conclusions (3 to 5 years)Collect inputs and ask questionsAbility to communicate results clearlyUnderstanding of financial statements and impacts of changes to EBITDA, cash flows, etcPreferred Skills: (NICE TO HAVES)Ability to prepare executive level presentationsHow will the performance be measured? • Performance will be measured by the successful and accurate completion of standardized reporting as well as the completion of fully built out financial models with variables that can be changed. This includes the summary of the models’ findings as well as preparation of presentation materials. What does a typical work day look like? (How much time will be spent in meetings? Etc.) • 0 to 1 hour spent in meetings, most interactions will be 1x1 with the manager or with the associated financial analysts to gather data Project Description:Two main projects:Create rest of year financial forecasts/models that incorporate YTD actual results with expected future results.Maintain and update standard monthly reporting for several business units. Research revenue and expense variances, as well as understand revenue accounting changes and impact to forecasts.How does this project impact the business? • Projects ensure that financial data is reported accurately and in a timely fashion to business leaders. Forecast allows business unit leaders to adjust strategy for remainder of year based on updated outlook. How does your team impact the business? • Finance team helps business unit leaders both measure and forecast results. What does the team environment look like? • Manager, team of analysts. Works closely with accounting and other finance teams to ensure accuracy. What is the interaction level this resource will have with the team? The manager? • Most interaction will be with the manager, some partnering with other analysts will be done to maintain continuity across the team. Education Requirement: • B.S. in Finance Operating System needed for this role:Microsoft Office suite, MS SQL, Hyperion Planning

Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Mailgun is currently seeking a talented Financial Analyst to join our team! In this role you will be responsible for solving complex business problems spanning a wide range of business activities. Core activities will include deep analytics, insight building, and business recommendations with a heavy focus on revenue and identification of key drivers in order to assist senior management in the decision making process. Additional responsibilities include being the go to person for preparation of financial forecasts, budgets, and reports. Requirements5+ years’ experience in financial analysisExpert skills using Excel and PowerPointHigh degree of autonomy, self-motivation, and ability to check your own workConfidentiality and discretion – demonstrated ability to handle sensitive information in an appropriate mannerStrong analytical, organizational, and creative problem solving skillsBachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field requiredExperience presenting to management and executivesRESPONSIBILITIESBuild and maintain detailed driver based financial forecasts for revenue and expense items with corresponding tracking/reporting packageIndependently create recurring and ad hoc analysis to support and provide insights and recommendations for management decision-makingActs as a valued business partner by providing informed, proactive analysis and business insights to enable effective decision-making and efficient resource utilization.Interprets and analyzes revenue and expense variances to identify business growth opportunities and cost savings on a monthly, quarterly and annual basis.Delivers financial results and analysis to business unit leadership and upper management utilizing excellent written and verbal communication skills.Collaborates with peers to complete special projects while effectively managing multiple priorities.Benefits6+ weeks PTO (treat yo’self)100% Dental, Medical and Vision coverage for employee50% Dental, Medical and Vision coverage for dependentsMailgun contribution of $250 for every 1% of earnings that you contribute to the 401(k) up to $2500Flexible spending accountsHealth savings accountLife insurance 1x annual salary

Name: Senior Salesforce Business Analyst

A successful candidate must have experience defining and optimizing business processes in the following areas: Commercial Operations / Sales Operations, Sales Automation, Marketing Automation, and Customer Relationship Management. The position liaises with both the business and technical organization to determine the scope, timeline and budgetary impacts of new features and enhancements. Masters degree in Business or Information Technology preferredAt least Eight years experience within a business function (Commercial Operations / Sales Operations, Sales Automation, Marketing Automation, and Customer Relationship Management) with business analysis or business process improvement activity in an enterprise setting requiredPrevious involvement in the deployment or optimization of a Global Customer Relationship Management platform (Salesforce.com) requiredPrevious experience deploying Salesforce platform globally a plusPrevious position in Pharma or Medical Device industry a plusExperience working in a projects where multiple functions work in a matrix structure a plusExperience with managed packages such as Cornerstone (CFS), Apttus CLM, Marketing Cloud integration, and Cvent a plusKnowledge and Skill Requirements/Specialized Courses and/or Training:Salesforce Administrator Certification required.Salesforce Service Cloud Certitication a plusExperience with process improvement techniques and tools. Lean or Six Sigma preferred.Understanding of the major functions in a global organization.Strong communication (written and oral) and presentation skills.Ability to work comfortably at all levels within the organization up to the senior management level.
