Name: Business Analyst - IT
Description: Carenet Healthcare Services is proud to open new paths to health for millions of people each year as we guide them to be more informed about their healthcare options, more engaged in their wellness, and more educated about healthcare costs the may face.  At Carenet Healthcare Services, our teams have the wonderful responsibility to guide millions of people to the healthcare resources and cost savings they need, and to help make the healthcare process less complicated for them. Whether it's finding the best doctors and pharmacies under their health insurance coverage, receiving expert guidance from a registered nurse, enrolling in extra benefits such as gym memberships, or getting an expensive test or procedure done without breaking the bank we can guide them to the right resources at the right time.  This Business Analyst position is based in San Antonio, Texas and reports directly to the Solution Manager. This hands-on challenging role is suitable for someone who comes from a strong background of business analysis and agile software development and has a can-do approach. Objective of this role: You will be working closely with a highly knowledgeable professional team, helping them analyze the needs of our client and internal partners and translating those needs into requirements documentation, user stories and acceptance criteria. You will have a high level of confidence and can negotiate at the highest level with people both face to face and remote.  Relevant and strategic analysis  Your inquisitive nature and strong analytical skills will enable you to determine the root cause of a problem, identify the core need, and/or ensure all bases are covered when reviewing a potential solution  All about the details  You recognize the importance of designing and delivering precise documentation and communications and be skillful at managing large amounts of detailed information to scale your messaging and thought processes accordingly  Engaging with the team  Your diverse technical knowledge and years of experience will allow you to communicate and translate effectively across all members of the team from internal/external customers, Developers, Quality Analysts, Project Management and Solution Management  Understanding the big picture  You will be adept at identifying edge-cases, error conditions, dependencies and impacts to other areas by developing solid domain knowledge and deep understanding of current system functionality and creatively and positively influence solution design and product roadmaps  Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to: Elicit, capture, analyze and articulate business requirements into user stories with supporting documentation such as acceptance criteria, process flows and wireframes, all in-order to clearly document and communicate a set of functional requirementsRepresent the Solution Development team as a subject matter expertDocument existing and To Be processes using process-flow diagrams and perform detailed gap analysisPerform detailed analysis of data, uses case scenarios, systems, and integration points to identify potential gaps or areas of concernBalance business requirements with technical feasibility and sustainabilityCollaborate with the Solution Manager and technical team members to translate customer/product needs into deliverable, realistic features and improvementsEstablish and maintain agreements and understanding of requirements across all stages of the design, development and deploymentParticipate in Integration Testing, User Acceptance Testing (UAT) and Functionality Testing as appropriateUnderstand customer/product priorities and dependencies across multiple projects and advise the Solution Manager on the best way to approach and prioritize work to maximize valueManage updates or changes to requirements throughout the lifecycle of a user story and projectProvide Business Analysis status updates and escalate issues and risks to Solution ManagerExperience, Skills and Education:Bachelor's degree in IS or CC, or relatedMinimum 3+ years in a Business Analyst role or similarMinimum 5+ years of experience in ITAdvanced skills in Microsoft Office/Office 365 productsBroad working knowledge of Solution Development, IT process, tools and techniques, along with Production / Infrastructure Operations requiredCapable of understanding complex technical concepts and communicate and/or document them in simple, concise and unambiguous terms to non-technical team members and clientsStrong interpersonal and leadership skillsSolid planning, prioritization, organizational and attention to detail skillsAbility to quickly assimilate and apply new concepts, business models, and technologiesDesire to solve problems and be resourceful in seeking answers and knowledge with little or vague directionAbility to facilitate and conduct meetings while asking questions and soliciting feedback, presenting and capturing notes using various software applications and toolsComfortable delivering demonstrationsParticipation in Agile cadence such as Scrum standup meetings, backlog grooming sessions, sprint planning, and retrospective meetings preferredKnowledge of healthcare industry and HIPAA preferredExperience working in a 24/7 call center environment preferredKnowledge of coding concepts and database structures preferredSDL2017

This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not be able to change your responses. Name: Federal - Agile Business Senior Analyst
Description: Job descriptionOrganization: Accenture Federal ServicesLocation: Dayton, OH, Arlington, VA or San Antonio, TX Accenture Federal Services, a wholly owned subsidiary of Accenture LLP, is a U.S. company with offices in Arlington, Virginia. Accenture's federal business has served every cabinet-level department and 30 of the largest federal organizations. Accenture Federal Services transforms bold ideas into breakthrough outcomes for clients at defense, intelligence, public safety, civilian and military health organizations.Count on us to help you embrace new ways of working, building for change and put customers at the core. A wholly owned subsidiary of Accenture, we bring over 30 years of experience serving the federal government, including every cabinet-level department. Our 7,200 dedicated colleagues and change makers work with our clients at the heart of the nation’s priorities in defense, intel, public safety, health and civilian to help you make a difference for the people you employ, serve and protect.As a Agile Business Senior Analyst, your primary responsibility is to lead the collection of client requirements, document user and develop user stories, and define acceptance criteria for which developers must meet for an acceptable solution. Analyze client data to define reportable KPIs and identify visual solutions for optimal data display. Secondarily support function as a SME within Joint Application Design sessions including requirements analysis, wireframe diagram decomposition, functionality assessments, and peer review tasks. Lead collaboration between multiple teams to sponsor innovative and effective user interface designs for increasing client satisfaction, adoption rates, and process improvement. Specifically collaborate with data engineering/data scientist teams to enable superior visual representation of analyzed data. + Basic qualificationsBasic Qualifications:2 years of Agile Scrum experience1 year of product owner experience5 years of experience defining, collecting user requirements1 year of experience writing test cases/script for functional and UAT testingExperience leading JAD and requirements definition sessionsExperience conducting user acceptance testingUS Citizenship requiredPreferred Qualifications:Strong analytical, organizational, and interpersonal skillsExperience in supporting functional writing including ability to complete requirements and functional designs that are in line with functional and technical requirementsAbility to follow applicable enterprise methodologies and system delivery life cyclesAn active security clearance or the ability to obtain one may be required for this role.Candidates who are currently employed by a client of Accenture or an affiliated Accenture business may not be eligible for consideration.  Applicants for employment in the U.S. must possess work authorization which does not require now or in the future sponsorship by the employer for a visa.  Accenture is a federal contractor, an EEO and Affirmative Action Employer of Females/Minorities/Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities.  Equal Employment Opportunity  All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, race, creed, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, marital status, citizenship status or any other basis as protected by federal, state, or local law.  Job candidates will not be obligated to disclose sealed or expunged records of conviction or arrest as part of the hiring process.  Accenture is committed to providing veteran employment opportunities to our service men and women. APPLY SAVE THIS JOBShare

Name: Senior Systems Analyst/Developer
Description: The mission Graham Technologies is hiring a Senior Systems Analyst/Developer in San Antonio, TX. We are looking for a candidate to  plan, direct, and monitor the work of team members. The challengeSets priorities to meet the needs of users.Formulates/defines system scope and objectives.Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations.Prepares detailed specifications from which programs will be written.Designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents those programs.Participates in related areas, such as such as design, implementation, integration, management, and maintenance of complex databases web-sites, with respect to the operating system, access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, organization, protection and security, documentation, guidelines, and statistical methods; evaluation of commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products; and analysis of network hardware/software issues.Supports CCB activities.Ensures compliance with standards and may assist with accreditation activities.Maintains awareness of applicable current technology, methodology, and products.Directs the work of other developers.What we're looking for To land this job, you will have to have an active TS/SCI Clearance and have the skills below: Required Skills:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field required.Eight years of technical experience in applications software development, three of which are in systems analysis.Three years of acting as technical lead for a team of developers.Has a good understanding of the business or function for which the application is designed.Six years of experience in the development of Internet/intranet applications such as home pages, interfaces with databases, and security.Six years of technical experience in administration, analysis, and programming of computerized databases.Proficient with HyperText Markup Language (HTML), JAVA, C++, Client/Server, Oracle, PowerBuilder, Visual Basic.What you can expect from us We’ll pay you a competitive salary commensurate to your experience. Through Superior IT support services and application modernization, Graham has assisted customers in achieving their respective goals and objectives; increasing their return on investment (ROI); and maintaining efficiency and effectiveness of their IT solutions. Name: Business Intelligence Analyst, Lead
Description: Business Intelligence Analyst, Lead  San Antonio, TX  We are currently accepting applications for a full-time Business Intelligence Analyst, Lead for company headquarters located in San Antonio.  We encourage you to Join Our Team and apply! Upon applying and meeting the qualifications, we will reach out to you and answer any further questions you may have about this opportunity. Job Summary: As a member of our growing Business Intelligence Team the Business Intelligence Analyst Lead will be responsible for producing insightful market and business analytics for workforce solution programs. This includes external economic/global business trends, client specific analytics and overall program key performance indicators (KPIs) and service level agreements (SLAs). Acts as a project manager for all analytic deliverables coordinating with InGenesis executives, stakeholders and developers to ensure an on time and high-quality product is delivered. Qualifications: Bachelors Degree preferably in Mathematics, Economics, Finance, or Business  Minimum of 3 years experience in in business analytics  Strong research and analytical skills with exceptional attention to detail  Excellent interpersonal skills, including verbal and written communication, ability to work and interact well with others, and ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships  Strong initiative and ability to meet deadlines  Ability to identify problems and opportunities, gather relevant evidence, and make effective decisions using sound judgment  Ability to independently handle multiple projects and tasks in a fast-paced environment Preferred Skills (not required): Experience with Vendor Management Systems (VMS) such as Fieldglass, Beeline or PeopleFluent  Experience with Applicant Tracking Systems (ATS) such as Bullhorn, Healthsource or Taleo  Experience with business intelligence software such as Power BI, Business Objectsor equivalent Responsibilities: Responsible for market research and client specific analytics  Contributes analysis for regular client quarterly business reviews  Provided contractual Service Level Agreement (SLA) reporting  Works with InGenesis leadership to develop and report client specific and enterprise metrics  Collaborates with internal stakeholders to develop process recommendations  Provides written explanation of results and trends to stakeholders  Builds reports within the VMS and ATS according to requirements from requestor  Project manages new analytic deliverables  Develops presentation of data trends that provides business insight  Utilizes case management system to manage, monitor, and track all reporting requests from internal and external clients.  Participates in special projects and performs other duties as assigned.  We support a diverse workforce and is an Equal Opportunity Employer who does not discriminate against employees and applicants for employment on the basis of race, gender, color, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, disability, veteran status, or other classification protected by law.

Name: Business System Analyst with SAP AP/AR
Description: Job DescriptionOverview We are looking for Business System Analyst with experience on SAP AR/AR for our investment managment client based at San Antonio, TX.  This is a Long Term contract position and need candidates with strong experience on Business Analysis, SAP AP/AR, Open Text Vendor Invoice Management, MM/SRM Integation with FI module. ResponsibilitiesWork closely with the business partners (AP and AR) to understand and document business requirementsAct as a subject matter expert for the SAP AP and AR modules.Contribute to the development and testing required to deliver business solutions.Make recommendations to improve business processes, expand application features, resolve defects or enhance business capabilities.Conduct analysis of current and proposed business operations and partner other ITG associates to deploy, deliver, test and operate applications.Identify opportunities to improve team practices and processes.Provide project leadership for assigned projects.Provide thought leadership, stay informed of industry and technology trends and share knowledge with the business and team members.Preferred:Experience with financial services industry is preferred Experience with SAP security and roles relating to financial transactions and processesExperience with configuration, usage and support of DMEE ABAP and PMW bank payment filesExperience with Open Text Vendor Invoice Management and OCR product would be preferredExperience with Concur Travel and Expense product for reimbursement processing or similar tools would be preferred, including integration with SAPExperience with other FI modules like FI-GL, FI-FA, FI-AR, CO-CCA, Ariba and SAP HANA would be a strong plusExperience with SAP Portal My Tasks and User Interface for invoice approval.Job Description: Senior Business Systems AnalystReviews, analyzes, and evaluates business systems and user needs.Documents requirements defines scope and objectives and formulates systems to parallel overall business strategies.Requires at least 7 years of experience.Qualifications 6+ years of SAP Accounts Payable and Receivables. Hands-on experience with AP/AR functionality (vendor master, bank master, invoice posting, payment processing, check printing and EFT payment files). Experience with workflow tool for AP invoice management for scanning, invoice approval routing and invoice posting is required Hands-on experience of end-to-end configuration of the AP/AR module. At least one complete life cycle implementation experience required. Experience with integration of AP/AR module with FICO (GL, IO, Fixed Assets), MM and SRM modules. Hands-on experience with PO Invoice functionality (MM/SRM integration). Experience with set-up and resolution of issues relating to batch jobs, outgoing and incoming file transfer. Experience with translating business requirements into system requirements and configuration. Name: Data Analyst
Description: Argo Group US is a national underwriter of specialty insurance in niche areas of the property-casualty market. Focused on the success of each of our customers, Argo Group offers specialty coverage through its six subsidiaries. Our full line of high-quality products and services is designed to meet the unique coverage and claim-handling needs of our Excess and Surplus Lines and Commercial Specialty segments.  Argo Group US currently has a challenging opportunity for a Business Delivery Services Analyst in our offices located in Chicago, IL or San Antonio, TX. This position will become a member of the Business Delivery Services team for a publically traded, international writer of property and casualty insurance and reinsurance. You will join a team focused on delivering maximum value for Argo business owners by driving efficiency and excellence in business processes handled by an offshore partner and through automation. Within the team, the Business Delivery Services Analyst will provide data analysis balanced with operational oversight and business support.What does a Business Delivery Services Analyst Team Member’s day to day duties look like:Lead the retrieval, aggregation, validation, and analysis of performance metrics across multiple lines of business and functions. The Business Analyst will summarize data regularly and on an ad hoc basis in various formats that provide actionable findings used to drive business behavior.Produce and distribute regular reporting on performance.Assist in maintaining excellent standards of customer service through the management and delivery of outsourced, automated and in house claims, underwriting, finance, and other support services.Assist in identifying opportunities for standardizing/optimizing business processes across business units through data and process analysis.Assist and support other members of wider BDS and Global Operations teams where business process improvement and analysis opportunities arise.Maintain process documentation, following established change control requirements; identify opportunities to improve process efficiency.Work closely with Argo Finance to ensure consistent delivery of Transactional Services support for AP, AR, FP&A, and Accounting functionsAssist and support in transitioning work to our offshore partners through process mapping, internal customer communication, data analysis, and project planning.Communicate effectively and clearly across multiple lines of business, within the Business Delivery Services team and with our offshore partner.What’s required for the position:Minimum Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.1 or more years of experience in an Analytical or Process Improvement role, preferably in an Insurance or Financial Services Role.Highly proficient in Microsoft ExcelExperience with Microsoft Access or other database applicationsIn addition, you embody our core values as they are the key to our success:We desire to excelWe are committed to our clients and to each otherWe have the courage to do the right thingWe apply original thinkingIf you have these preferred skills, that is even better:Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Excellent attention to detail.Excellent problem solving and analytic skills.Ability to work with and alongside colleagues of differing experience and skill levels.Experience communicating and collaborating in an environment in which teams, vendors and customers are spread across multiple time zones and continents.Ability to work within a team environment as well as on self-directed projects.Strong interpersonal skills, including the ability to elicit information from business users and to accurately document findings.A strong desire to learn. The successful candidate will possess an open mind but will not be afraid of developing and expressing their own ideas, opinions and solutions.Experience engaging directly with business customers and stakeholders and comfortable communicating with senior business users.Able to deliver consistent work product in accordance with overall team objectives. Able to identify and escalate issues representing a risk to overall team objectives.Strong organizational skills. Developing our employees professionally and personally strengthens our organization. Name: Project Analyst
Description: IBA is currently recruiting for a Project Analyst to support our government client in San Antonio, TX. The Project Analyst will serve as the Program Deliverables Manager, Defense Business Certification Coordinator, Contract Issues Coordinator, and Supporting Financial Analyst. Essential Duties and Responsibilities: - Provide support for contract oversight for deliverables management and tracking/managing for all Program CDRLs (Contract data Requirements List) and maintenance of updates required by supporting systems, such as the MISR (Medical System Inventory Repository) and DHP SIRT (System Inventory Reporting Tool).  - Provide complex financial analysis and acquisition support as a backup to the MODS Budget Analyst.  - Provide interpretive opinion and guidance on contract specifics following close coordination/collaboration with the Contracting Agency and Contracting Officer.  - Analyze and prepare documentation packages that support the Defense Business Certification process (DBC) to secure required Operations and Maintenance (O&M) and Research, Development, Test & Evaluation (RDT&E funding for MODS software/development modernization efforts.  - Other duties as assigned. Minimum Requirements: - Knowledge in applying analytical and evaluative methods and techniques and ability to plan, conduct and document a variety of analytical and financial reports, including findings, conclusions and recommendations.  - Ability to coordinate, evaluate and edit work prepared by others and develops it into a consistent whole product.  - Must have excellent oral and written communications in order to present and define program information, conduct briefings, write reports and correspondence on a variety of administrative, financial and mission-related matters and to effect coordination and cooperation with acquisition and contract activities.  - Ability to multi-task.  - Ability to perform essential duties and responsibilities. Preferred Requirements: - Knowledge of government and DoD acquisition policies, practices and procedures as they relate to research, development and technology integration and procurement and contracting processes for Information Management/Information Technology.  - Knowledge of contract management to ensure proper and accurate tracking of Program financials.  - Prior experience working with Microsoft Project, SharePoint, and Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC). Education, Certifications and Work Experience Requirements: Bachelors degree required.  Three (3) years of experience required. Security Clearance: Existing ADP II Public Trust clearance level or above.  *Pursuant to a government contract, this position requires U.S. citizenship.  EOE/M/F/Disability/ Veteran

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst  Location: San Antonio, Texas USApplyJob Number10095San Antonio, Texas USAB is a leading global investment-management and research firm with more than $500 billion in assets under management and a presence in 22 countries, with more than 3,400 employees worldwide. We serve clients ranging from institutions to individuals and private clients, and we offer independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services tailored to our clients’ unique needs. With forward-looking perspective and expertise in equities, fixed-income, alternatives and multi-asset strategies, more than 500 investment professionals collaborate to share ideas and make connections across disciplines, geographies, asset classes and sectors. These collective insights drive innovation and better solutions, helping us keep our clients AHEAD OF TOMORROW®.AB is a leading global investment management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, individuals and private clients in major markets around the world. AB employs more than 500 investment professionals with expertise in growth equities, value equities, fixed income securities, blend strategies, and alternative investments, and, through its subsidiaries and joint ventures, operates in more than 20 countries. AB’s research disciplines include fundamental research, quantitative research, economic research and currency forecasting capabilities. Through its integrated global platform, AB is well-positioned to tailor investment solutions for its clients. AB also offers independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services to institutional investors.  IT Group Description:  Client Group Technology provides development, configuration, testing, project management, and business analyst support for the Client Group’s applications and externally facing websites. The Client Group is comprised of Retail and Institutional Sales, Client Services, Business Development Groups, Marketing, with over 500 staff globally, concentrated in the US, Europe, Asia-ex Japan, Australia, and Japan.  IT Job Description:  We are seeking a San Antonio based Data Analyst to join our Sales Data Management team in Client Group Technology.  This relates to ITBRS Resource ID S126  Describe the role:  The Client Group Technology Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring the integrity of global Retail and Institutional client data by performing ongoing quality checks, facilitating ad hoc setup and clean-up tasks, providing ongoing reporting and monitoring, and playing a key role in improvement initiatives that have an impact on client related data.  Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports:  This role will immediately be in support of a broad revamping of our data and toolsets for the Client Group that needs to take place to fuel our future growth globally across channels. This includes the building a new data warehouse, bringing together client interactions, sales, content, readership, and third-party data sets, to enable more nimble, effective, and predictive business intelligence, a re-organization and simplification of our CRM, and the build out of new customized front end tools for our global Sales teams.  The data analyst will analyze existing data sets to provide input into how the new structures and tools should be built, they will be responsible for mapping data sets from existing to future state, coordinating reviews and clean-ups with the business, facilitate the migration of data from existing to the new models, and will establish and be responsible for ongoing process for ensuring the accuracy of this data going forward.  The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Quality ControlRunning quality control reports against CRM data to identify issues.Assigning Tasks to data owners to confirm appropriate values and/or resolve issues.Provide support in resolving issues where mass updates are needed.Consider controls to prevent issues going forward; consider how to manage false positives.Ad Hoc RequestsSupport setup of new offshore sales territories.Support mass updates, deletes, archiving, merges of CRM and data warehouse records.Investigation and resolution of issues, discrepancies.Act as gatekeeper for creation of new Relationships.Maintenance of pick-list values such as the various, independent, lists of products on activities, opportunities, contacts.ReportingProduce ongoing reports to measure volumes, quality of data sets.Produce ongoing reports showing data team performance against agreed key performance indicators and/or service level agreements.ImprovementsExtract and analyze data sets in relation to enhancements.Contribute to strategy for data migrations and clean-ups.Coordinate migrations and clean-ups with end users, technical support teams.Contribute to evaluation of third-party tools, define requirements for data management tools.Contribute to requirements for implementing controls or automated solutions to reduce manual effort required for data maintenance. Define and document data management policies and procedures.What makes this role unique or interesting (if applicable)?The role will provide a wide variety of experiences and exposures, across different business units, processes, and technology. It will help the candidate develop business analyst and project management expertise skills, along with client servicing and data analysis.What is the professional development value of this role, i.e. what learning and professional growth Qualifications, Experience, Education: Basic QualificationsBachelor’s degree or equivalent3+ years data reporting experience is required (mutual fund data reporting is a plus)2 + years project coordination experienceMust have strong relationship/customer management experienceExperience managing multiple projects and prioritiesUnderstanding and experience with basic data concepts – SQL experience highly preferredPreferred QualificationsProficient in MS ExcelProficient in and enjoys problem solving, critical thinkingAbility to communicate thoughts clearly orally and in writingAbility to work independentlyStrong teamwork and interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with all management levelsStrong communication and presentation skillsMethodical and preciseAbility to adapt and learn quicklyTechnology savvyClient service oriented Special Knowledge (if applicable): CRM experience, ideally Salesforce.comExperience with Business Intelligence / analytics related tools (Microstrategy, Tableau, Qlik, etc.) Experience with Robotics Process Automation nice to have  Location: City/State/Country: San Antonio, TX, USA

Name: Financial Analyst - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Job Summary:Provides financial planning and analysis. Responsibilities Designs, implements and provides products, programs, projects, processes and policies in support of the Financial Planning and Analysis function.  Provides financial services and consulting at the corporate, business unit and/or market level; performs analysis and interpretation of financial and other data; directly supports the CFO and Director of Finance team.  Forecasts, analyzes, and evaluates financial plans and budgets; develops recommendations to achieve financial objectives.  Participates in expense forecasting and actuals process, including research and communication of variances, quarterly earnings, press release support, and competitor analysis.  Analyzes and reports on results of various requests for proposals (RFPs) and programs to include total cost modeling, and prepares cost benefit analysis (CBA) recommendations.  Prepares forecast results commentary; compiles consolidated expense actual and forecast reports for distribution to appropriate leadership.  Analyzes trends, researches issues and responds to inquiries.  Contributes to the development of best practices for company.  Participates in and leads financial variances for forecast, budget and monthly close packages.  Acts as point of contact for programming, responsible for understanding detailed financials, key variances and identifying risks/opportunities to the business  Builds process improvements that identify and track key operating metrics that can be leveraged to develop planning tools.  Creates financial models to support P&L forecasting, annual budgeting process, and evaluation of strategic business decisions.  Interfaces with business, finance & sales leads, accounting partners and IT to ensure accurate data and information gathering.  Performs analysis/deep dives on profitability, revenue trends and other periodic ad-hoc analytical projects.  Performs ad hoc research as necessary; prepares and presents comprehensive evaluations, proposals and recommendations to appropriate leadership.  May assist with annual update of long range forecasts.  May manage budgeting process including preparation of templates, coordination of budget meetings, entering budget information into appropriate systems and preparation of presentation materials.  May develop spend profiles and any performance to business requirements.  May be responsible for training and/or acting as the lead for lower level positions in the group. Qualifications Proficient in Microsoft Office suite; advanced skills in Excel with a focus on speed and efficiency  Experience with accounting software, Salesforce.com, Thinkcell, VB and SQL, or ability to learn new systems quickly  Knowledge of FCC rules  Self-starter, can work independently under minimal supervision  Highly detail oriented, with strong attention to accuracy  Excellent planning and organization skills; can multitask and prioritize workload under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment  High degree of quantitative, analysis, problem-solving and decision-making skills; critical thinker  Stress tolerance, can maintain composure when faced with difficult situations/personalities  Excellent oral and written communication skills  Strong interpersonal skills; professional and confident demeanor  Work Experience  3+ years analytical experience in financial planning, operations or other finance-heavy division Education Minimum of 4-year college degree in Accounting or Finance  Certifications  CPA a plus

Name: Financial Analyst
Description: Summary  As the Financial Analyst, you will work as a business partner to the Operations (Manufacturing) Team, in providing overall financial support in making informed strategic decisions & Financial / Business Analysis. In addition, this role will support the preparation of daily and monthly management reports and analysis, including Variance, Root Cause, and KPI analysis. This role is focused on Operations Finance (which is daily, weekly and monthly reporting), with the majority of the time spent working with plant operations data. The remainder of the time will be spent providing analytical support to the Controller, GL maintenance review, and assisting with period close procedures.  Primary Responsibilities  The role works across the management spectrum to help understand the business and support in business decisions  Support in daily Operations variance analysis, identifying the key drivers for variances for each plant location  Ensure timely collection & integrity of Manufacturing data to develop actionable analysis & reconcile data between systems to determine inconsistencies and recommend/initiate process changes to improve performance  Working closely with various managers to identify cost savings opportunities, through cost analysis  Create periodic reports and analyze variances against the standard for corrective action  Build analytical models to perform ad-hoc financial analysis to provide a broad perspective on financial impact and make recommendations to Management  Provide general business analytical support  Assist in period end closing reconciliation and review process Required Experience Bachelors degree in Accounting / Finance. CPA and/or CMA designation or progress towards designation preferred. CFA considered a plus.  Manufacturing industry or public accounting experience strongly preferred  Strong interpersonal and oral communication skills with demonstrated ability to work with multiple cross-functional business partners  Strong financial acumen and analytical skills  Advocate for continuous process improvement and process optimization  Ability to work under tight deadlines with the ability to manage multiple competing priorities and be flexible and resilient  Strong work ethic and ensures high-quality outcomes are achieved  Advanced Excel and other Microsoft Office applications including PowerPoint  Experience with SAP is considered an asset, but not required  Depending on deadlines may be necessary to work extra hours on occasion.  Core Competencies  Customer and Product Centricity - Responds to the needs of both internal and external customers in a timely and courteous manner, showing a sense of urgency; always keeping our products front and center.  Flexibility, Agility, Adaptability - Adapts to changes; changes strategy in response to new information; responds appropriately and quickly without having all parameters defined; demonstrate tolerance for speed and uncertainty.  Team Work and Collaboration - Uses appropriate interpersonal styles and methods of communication to gain agreement or acceptance of a plan or activity. Is effective in building constructive relationships; uses tact; interacts with others in an open, friendly manner, encourages collaboration.  Passion for Excellence Always looks for ways to improve effectiveness or efficiency, making recommendations to increase productivity in the quality of work; develops innovative solutions, challenges the status quo. To be the best, never compromising.  Drives Execution - Takes risks, learn from their mistakes, builds trust and is a role model to others. Has a hands-on style; is aggressive in achieving desired results.  Disclaimer: The above describes the general responsibilities, required knowledge and skills. Please keep in mind that other duties may be added or this description may be amended at any time.

Name: Financial Analyst

The Financial Analyst will be based in San Antonio, TX and will report to the Controller.  At TaskUs we look for individuals who are constantly striving for excellence in both their personal and professional lives. Name: Compliance Analyst
Description: Title of Position: Senior Compliance AnalystDepartment: Compliance Assurance DepartmentReports to: Director of Compliance AssuranceOverall Responsibility: This individual will perform monitoring and advisory functions of the Enterprise-wide Compliance Assessment and Advisory Program. This position is accountable for scheduling and implementing compliance calculation reviews to: Identify gaps between applicable laws, rules, regulations and documented company policies, practices, processes, procedures;  This individual will also document findings, make references to elude future compliance gaps, tract agreed upon remediation determinations. An overall compliance assessment is needed in the area or unit evaluated on its ability to maintain compliant operations. Assesses member complaints from the NCUA Office of Consumer Protection and other channels in order to coordinate business unit responses for resolution and assess potential compliance risks. Consults with: Operations and Executive Leadership Term: Direct Hire Qualifications: Required Bachelor Degree in Finance, Accounting, Business, Management or related degree  Previously worked in a highly cross-functional/matrix environment leading compliance initiatives.  2+ years Compliance, Risk, Audit experience with proven ability to proactively collaborate with colleagues and management.  Experience reading, understanding and interpreting regulations, laws, and statutes.  Experience working in a Financial Institution and with auditors and regulatory agencies, including NCUA, FDIC, OCC or CFPB.  5+ years Financial Industry experience, specifically in a Financial Depository Institution. Salary Range: $60K-$68K Recruiter Contact Information: ivy@triquestbusiness.com

Name: Data Science Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 916346  Apex Systems, 2nd largest staffing firm, has immediate Contract-to-Hire opening for a Data Science Analysts in San Antonio, TX with one of our top Fortune 500 Clients! If interested, please respond by sending your most updated Word resume and best method of contact to Nicholas at nbianco@apexsystems.com Data Science Analyst Schedule: 8hr shift starting no later than 8:30am (Mon-Fri) Duration: Contract-to-hire Duties: Conducts advanced analytics leveraging predictive modeling, machine learning, simulation, optimization and other techniques to deliver insights or develop analytical solutions to achieve business objectives.  Supports Subject Matter Experts (SME's) on efforts to develop scalable, efficient, automated solutions for large-scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation.  Translates complex analytical and technical concepts to non-technical employees to enable understanding and drive informed business decisions.  Identify a breach or instance, create a solution and implement it into the system; 'cat and mouse' environment  Business Drivers: Fraud loss avoidance: how can they bring loss numbers down and improve going forward  Becoming more efficient at bringing down losses  Current projects include: released a new model for authorization phone on mobile, big focus in machine learning, and upgrades  Team: 'Consulting' focused: interact with other groups within the enterprise to figure out pain points, then creates a prototype solution, and hand off to IT counterpart for fine tuning and rollout  Work in 5+1 sprints (5 weeks dictated work by manager, 1 week of innovation where you are free to brainstorm new creative solutions for security pain points)  Collaborative environment: must be in by 8:45am for morning huddle, 9-10am is a questions and collaborative design/demo/proposing works to colleagues, and after is where they return to project work  10 team members (CE's or converted CE's), one serves as POC for 5 week sprint then would serve as team member for next  Requirements: Data Acquisition: SQL, *Hadoop*, Spark, Big Data (be able to move data from command line in Unix/Linux)  Expert level in one or more of these Programming languages (Python, Java, R, C#)  Background in statistics: Statistical modeling, decision trees, neural networks, time services (any outside hobbies in stats are a plus like trading stocks or kaggle exercises)  Must be collaborative, speak up with ideas and take in feedback  Nice to Haves: Cloud computing platforms and leveraging their advantages of built in ML/AI libraries  Simulation and optimization techniques and methodologies (Monte Carlo, parametric bootstrapping, etc.)  Monitor trends and determine impacts of upcoming, data science related technologies and techniques through ingesting leading research from academic and practitioner sources  Data wrangling very large, structured and unstructured data sources across distributed environments (Hive, Pig, Scala, etc.)  EEO EmployerApex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at 844-463-6178* Data Acquisition: SQL, *Hadoop*, Spark, Big Data (be able to move data from command line in Unix/Linux) * Expert level in one or more of these Programming languages (Python, Java, R, C#) * Background in statistics: Statistical modeling, decision trees, neural networks, time services (any outside hobbies in stats are a plus like trading stocks or kaggle exercises) * Must be collaborative, speak up with ideas and take in feedback

Name: BIS Analyst

Name: Data/Systems Analyst SME
Description: Position: Data/Systems Analyst SME Location: United States- Texas Lackland AFB US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes Relocation Assistance: No relocation assistance available Clearance Type: This position is an ADP Level II position and requires a NACLC. Who We Are: Sumaria Systems, Inc. is a CMMI® Level 3 appraised, ISO 9001 certified Information Technology, Engineering, and Professional Services and Solutions Company headquartered in Danvers, Mass. With operating locations across the U.S., Sumaria provides a full range of services and is capable of responding rapidly and accurately to meet our clients surge requirements. Sumaria has a proven track record of delivering cost-effective services and solutions to our clients on time and within budget. With more than 30+ years of experience and hundreds of successful projects, Sumaria provides a diverse range of technology-based solutions and is recognized as a source of quality information, technology, engineering and professional services and solutions for the Department of Defense and the Federal contractor community. Job Description: • Manages one Windows-based server that is used to process the incoming data and host the Secure Fi le Transfer application (MOVEit DMZ).  • Consults with other HID projects concerning CHCS data.  • Serves as backup for other BDQAS positions as necessary.  • Provide analysis of data requirements to determine data elements, field and table interrelationships, projected data size and data growth, HIPAA/PII data security, access and retention requirements, and fault tolerance and disaster recovery requirements.  • Designs and implements custom reports in MOVEit DMZ for assessing data receipt, system performance, security concerns, and other ad-hoc reporting as needed.  • Designs, implements, and maintains SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) packages for data loading and report generation.  • Assesses, documents, and remediates Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) processes and develops automation mechanisms for unattended processing of data feeds from source systems.  • Serve as subject matter expert on SQL and database issues, providing cross-team support and advice on a variety of issues pertaining to RDBMS usage, data retrieval, and statistical analysis. Minimum Experience/Education: • Security Requirement: This position is an ADP Level II position and requires a NACLC.  • Must meet DoD 8570.01 IAT Level II Certification (Sec+)  • Windows 2008 R2 system administration.  • Database systems including MS SQL 2005/2008 and MySQL.  • System performance, server backups, emergency planning, and network trouble-shooting.  • SQL programming, SSIS package design, and Data Transfer System package design.  • Database design and management is desired as this position performs DBA functions for BDQAS. What We Offer Sumaria is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes Sumaria a great place to work and grow. Sumaria is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status, or any other protected factor.

Name: Resource Management Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob Summary: Work to provide financial planning, execution, accounting, and analytical support to the AFMOA Medical Support Operations Directorate (SGA)/Resource Management Division (SGAR), San Antonio, Texas to MAJCOMs and the 76 Medical Treatment Facility (MTF)s throughout the AFMS. May work independently and or as part of a team. Principal Duties and Responsibilities include:Advise AFMOA and AFMS leadership regarding new operating procedures for consideration by the Government.Attend and participate in various team, workgroup and branch meetings.Issue and control all Air Force (AF) Defense Health Program (DHP) appropriations across all AF MAJCOMS MTFs via the Program Budget Accounting System (PBAS).Manage the overall AFMOA checkbook including any withhold accounts. Track DHP budget execution, funding disbursements using PBAS and develop funds management reports.Conduct analyses, reviews, and special studies of budget and funds execution, and evaluate their impact on program plans and current and prior year funding.Provide accounting support, including financial and cost analysis, in support of AFMS financial statements, audit readiness, and individual compliancy efforts.Prepare, coordinate, and support Planning and Programming across the AFMS to determine better ways to support mission requirements given system constraints.Develop, implement, and articulate strategies to support all programming actions such as the Program Objective Memorandum (POM), Future Years Defense Plan (FYDP) management, etc.Utilize various AF manpower management databases to manage, analyze, and implement programming tools. Such databases may include Medical Planning and Programming Tool (MPPT), POM programs, Data Collection Tool, Impact Application Tool, Make versus Buy modeling, etcInteract with AFMS staff at all levels to understand their requirements and develop strategies to support and prioritize those requirements.Other duties as assignedDesired Minimum QualificationsEducation and Experience:  Minimum of a Baccalaureate Degree in a business or related field (e.g., business administration, computer information systems, finance, healthcare, economics, health management, etc.); or five (5) years of equivalent experience.  Minimum of two (2) years’ experience in AF MTF Resource Management Office or equivalent MAJCOM Medical Resources Office.  Minimum of two (2) years of analytical experience using the BER and AF Manpower tools and documents.  Minimum of three (3) years of experience working with the AFMS medical organizational structure, clinical missions, programs and requirements to study and analyze procedures related to the provision of medical care, staffing requirements, and link to financial operations.  Minimum of three (3) years’ experience in AFMS financial systems and manpower processes.  Minimum of three (3) years of experience with specific DHP issues, accounting processes, commodities, Budget Activity Groups (BAG), budgetary processes, third party reimbursement programs, POM, and Manpower documents.  Minimum of three (3) years of experience with the Commander’s Resource Integration System (CRIS), to include how to create DHP-specific queries, data extraction, data import/export, and information analysis and AF Manpower tools and documents.  Minimum of four (4) years of experience preparing oral and written presentations (analysis).  Must be able to perform necessary coordination to provide the results of financial analyses to leaders at all levels of the organization, to include the activity's executive committee  May necessitate occasional travel.  Must meet the eligibility requirements for a US government issued security clearance NECESSARY KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS and ABILITIES: · Knowledge of qualitative and quantitative techniques to apply DoD, Joint, and Air Force management principles, concepts and methodologies and financial management directives, concepts, procedures, guidance, and policy.  · Working technical knowledge of government and DoD medical and financial regulations  · Knowledge of policies and procedures related to the Defense Health Agency, AFMS, and the delivery of healthcare.  · Ability to prepare, evaluate and monitor program analyses from conceptualization, data collection, identification of alternatives, preparation, and submission. Types of analyses may include, but are not limited to, return on investment, cost-benefit analysis, business process reengineering and other ad hoc studies.  · Systems skills and proficiency using Microsoft (MS) Office products.  · Ability to accurately enter, record and retrieve financial data  · Ability to organize, interpret and present financial data  · Ability to prepare and interpret complex financial reports.  · Ability to maintain efficient and effective financial systems and procedures; ability to accurately account for service funds.  · Working knowledge of AFMS office automation and computerized financial applications.  · Knowledge and experience in AFMS financial planning, programming, execution, and accounting processes  · Demonstrated attention to detail  · Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, and government/military officials.  · Ability to effectively communicate in writing and verbally. SUPERVISION RECEIVED Works with nominal supervision from the Project Manager or his or her designee. SUPERVISION EXERCISED None RESPONSIBILITY FOR PUBLIC CONTACT Daily contact with diverse audience requiring courtesy, discretion, and sound judgment. LICENSING AND CERTIFICATION None TOOLS AND EQUIPMENT USED Personal computer, including spreadsheet, presentation and word processing software; financial and data software and databases; telephone; copy machine; and fax machine. PHYSICAL DEMANDS · The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  · While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, talk and hear. The employee is occasionally required to walk; use hands and fingers to operate, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and reach with hands and arms.  · Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision and the ability to adjust focus. WORK ENVIRONMENT · The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  · The noise level in the work environment is usually moderately quiet.  · The duties listed above are intended only as illustrations of the various types of work that may be performed. The omission of specific statements of duties does not exclude them from the position if the work is similar, related, or a logical assignment to the position.  · The job description does not constitute an employment agreement between the employer and employee and is subject to change by the employer as the needs of the employer and requirements of the job change. DIMENSIONS Review, interpret, and analyze workload, manpower, financial and demographics data. Validate/manipulate data and formulate positions and responses in relation to the data. May contact customers to obtain data and or to clarify data.Company DescriptionWith deep expertise in both services and technology, and strong execution skills focused on delivering mission critical results for our clients, Ecompex transcends conventional information management and processing solutions. We serve clients in multiple Government agencies, institutions, and infrastructure organizations including Federal, State, and Local Government; Defense and Military; healthcare; Financial; and Litigation & Administrative industries.  At Ecompex, we are more than a business - we are a family. We are an energetic, dynamic company that prides itself on quality and is constantly growing and expanding. Among the reasons that we are an industry leader is because of our talented, motivated, and hard working team of professionals.If you enjoy challenges and want to be part of a successful technology leader, then Ecompex has a place for you. Name: Tier One SOC Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 910824  Apex Systems is hiring for a SOC Tier 1 Analyst for a DoD Customer, If qualified, please send your most up to date resume to Patrick Herbelin. His email is pherbelin@apexsystems.com. Position: Tier 1 SOC Analyst  Location: San Antonio, Texas  Program: Brand new contract - on the beginning of year 2 out of 5 years. You will be analyzing / monitoring network traffic for a global implementation of Microsoft UC (Skype for Business) for a DoD Customer. In this role, you will you will be responsible for the following: Monitoring and analyzing network traffic, Intrusion Detection Systems (IDS), security events and logs  Prioritizing and differentiating between potential intrusion attempts and false alarms  Creating and tracking security investigations to resolution  Opening tickets and assigning to correct resolver and validating/closing tickets related to false positives.  Providing Tier 1 investigation, triage, and mitigation of detected security events  Composing security alert notifications and other communications  Advising incident responders in the steps to take to investigate and resolve computer security incidents  Staying up to date with current vulnerabilities, attacks, and countermeasures  This position requires the ability to work shifts on a 24*7*365 schedule  Knowledge / Skills / Experience / Certifications: 1-2 years of related experience in a Security Operations Center capacity  Previous experience on a Computer Incident Response Team (CIRT), Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT), Computer Security Incident Response Center (CSIRC), Cyber Defense Team (CDT), or a Security Operations Center (SOC)  Experience with Anti-Virus, Intrusion Detection Systems, Firewalls, Active Directory, Vulnerability management and Federal/Military security protocols  Assessment tools and other security tools found in large network environments; along with experience working with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions, including Splunk  Familiarity with various network and host-based security applications and tools, such as network and host assessment/scanning tools, network and host based intrusion detection systems, and other security software packages  Familiarity with and the ability to follow ITSM, ITIL, and InfoSecurity Best Practices  Experience with Log Event Monitoring solutions is strongly desired but not required  Candidates must be able to work on-site at Federal Agency located in the Vienna, VA or San Antonio, TX areas  Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship now or in the future  The ability to communicate security events, potential impacts, and actions taken to higher-tier resolvers and management team  Candidates must be a US Citizen and be able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Clearance per condition of employment  Meet IAT II Certification requirements  Security+ Certification is required  EEO EmployerApex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at 844-463-6178* 1-2 years of related experience in a Security Operations Center capacity * Previous experience on a Computer Incident Response Team (CIRT), Computer Emergency Response Team (CERT), Computer Security Incident Response Center (CSIRC), Cyber Defense Team (CDT), or a Security Operations Center (SOC) * Experience with Anti-Virus, Intrusion Detection Systems, Firewalls, Active Directory, Vulnerability management and Federal/Military security protocols * Assessment tools and other security tools found in large network environments; along with experience working with Security Information and Event Management (SIEM) solutions, including Splunk * Familiarity with various network and host-based security applications and tools, such as network and host assessment/scanning tools, network and host based intrusion detection systems, and other security software packages * Familiarity with and the ability to follow ITSM, ITIL, and InfoSecurity Best Practices * Experience with Log Event Monitoring solutions is strongly desired but not required * Candidates must be able to work on-site at Federal Agency located in the Vienna, VA or San Antonio, TX areas * Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship now or in the future * The ability to communicate security events, potential impacts, and actions taken to higher-tier resolvers and management team * Candidates must be a US Citizen and be able to obtain and maintain a DoD Secret Clearance per condition of employment * Meet IAT II Certification requirements * Security+ Certification is required

Name: Systems Analyst/Developer
Description: The Mission: Graham Technologies is hiring a Systems Analyst/Developer in San Antonio, TX. We are looking for a candidate to formulate/define system scope and objectives. The Challenge:· Works under general direction.· Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations· Prepares detailed specifications from which programs will be written.· Designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents programs.· Develops and maintains web-site components if applicable.· Participates in related areas, such as design, implementation, integration, management, and maintenance of complex databases, with respect to the operating system, access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, organization, protection and security, documentation, guidelines, and statistical methods; evaluation of commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products; and analysis of network hardware/software issues.· Provides guidance to other developers.· Ensures compliance with standards and may assist with accreditation activities.What We're Looking For: To land this job you will have to have an active TS/SCI Clearance and the following skills: Required Skills:· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.· Four years of technical experience in applications software development, three of which are in systems analysis, and one year of which is acting as technical lead for a team of developers.· Has a good understanding of the business or function for which the application is designed.· Six years of experience in the development of Internet/intranet applications such as home pages, interfaces with databases, and security.· Proficient with HyperText Markup Language (HTML), JAVA, or other Internet/intranet application engines as required.· Six years of technical experience in administration, analysis, and programming of computerized databases.· Competent to work at a high level for all phases of system/database development and management.What You Can Expect from Us:We’ll pay you a competitive salary commensurate to your experience. Graham Technologies’ benefits package includes comprehensive health and dental care, life insurance and AD&D, 401(k), up to 27 days of paid time off per year, ten holidays per year, short and long-term disability, education/training assistance, referral program and transportation benefits. We also believe in work-to-life balance and treating our employees as part of the Graham Tech family. Through Superior IT support services and application modernization, Graham has assisted customers in achieving their respective goals and objectives; increasing their return on investment (ROI); and maintaining efficiency and effectiveness of their IT solutions. Graham Technologies is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.Are you willing to accept the mission?Sounds interesting? Start the conversation. Tell us what the next step in your career could be.

Name: Corporate Compliance Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Summary The Corporate Compliance Analyst is responsible for ensuring that the activities of the companies adhere to guidelines established by Federal, State, Local and Industry agencies. Essential Job Duties and Responsibilities · Maintains licensing requirements in all required jurisdictions.  · Uses Industry tools for tracking requirements and regulatory statuses.  · Researches regulations by reviewing regulatory bulletins and other sources of information.  · Compiles information by coordinating rate deviation filings; maintaining updated rate matrices; providing overviews of product disclosures.  · Keeps other departments abreast of requirements by researching regulatory and filing information; writing and communicating guidelines.  · Prepares reports by collecting, analyzing, and summarizing information.  · Maintains rapport with regulatory personnel by arranging continuing contacts; resolving concerns.  · Maintains quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.  · Maintains professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies.  · Contributes to team effort by accomplishing related results as needed.  · Must work well in a team environment  · Perform other department related duties as directed, or operationally necessary Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required · Strong attention to detail.  · Work in a fast pace environment and prioritize multiple work assignments.  · Must be a team player  · Excellent written communication skills.  · Solid communication, interpersonal, and organizational skills.  · Strong problem solving skills. Education and Work Experience Requirements Any combination equivalent to the following education and experience that would provide the required knowledge, skills and abilities would qualify. A typical way to obtain the knowledge, skills and abilities would be: Bachelors Degree or 4+ years of related professional experience.2+ years of working with Regulatory AgenciesPEO experience is preferred but not requiredPhysical and Other Requirements This position will require 8 hour days, flexible hours and overtime on occasion. Minimal travel is required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Additional Information This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive, and employee will also perform other reasonably related business duties as assigned by immediate supervisor and other management as required. eESI reserves the right to revise or change job duties and responsibilities as the need arises. This job description does not constitute a written or implied contract of employment.  eESI is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer.Company DescriptionWe are a privately held company operating nationwide with our corporate headquarters in San Antonio, TX. We have been in business for 20 years and are looking for a new member to join our talented team. Share your expertise, skills and commitment to excellence with us, and be a part of our growing team!

Name: NAM-US-Info Security Analyst-Analyst (USD)
Description: Job DescriptionThe Global ID Administration (GIDA) is a global organization within Client Shared Services (CSS) with 900 employees located across the globe. GIDA manages entitlement and provisioning of access for internal Client employees / contractors and increasingly for external Client clients who are using Client applications. GIDA works in partnership with Global Information Security to build appropriate security architecture in new apps and supports large business-driven technology projects related to information security issues.  Job Overview  Individuals are responsible for developing data security policies as well as safeguarding of information, evaluating existing data security procedures and identifying new areas of risk. Ensure the execution of directives over various disciplines and set direction on Information Security. Manage and implement a framework whereby control weaknesses are identified, corrective actions are planned and tracked through to completion. Provide core customer service support regarding the targeted applications and systems. This position requires the individual to operate within a team environment and work closely with other groups within the business and throughout Client.  Key Responsibilities  " Process entitlement, compliance review requests and/or incident/change management handling for Client's global customer base within established support thresholds.  " Utilize key information security administration tools  " Support bulk customer requests for comparable granting of entitlements  " Conduct basic housekeeping tasks, such as inactivity maintenance. Perform manual entitlement review maintenance  " Able to perform ID provisioning such as developer and Admin IDs and basic Functional ID related processes  " Ensure adherence to pre-assigned SLO requirements for designated requests at a personal and team level.  " Maintain excellent availability to achieve strong results  " Utilize Microsoft applications for creating and maintaining basic files  " Limited but direct impact on the business through the quality of the tasks/services provided. Impact of the job holder is restricted to own team.  " Participate on compliance conference calls and team meetings  " Understands Service Delivery Process Controls and under supervision, participate in annual review of Process Control documents associated with specific systems assigned  " Demonstrates basic understanding of Client Lean processes  " Understands the high-level principle behind Information Security concepts and policies; and applies / implements into day-to-day work  " Implements already established security procedures within the framework of specific system assignments, focusing on the full scope of GIDA Service Catalog requirements for simple thru complex, multi-tiered applications  " Identifies potential compliance issues and raise to management attention  " Understands Talent Management process and system. Knows how to develop action items to meet goals. Knows how to create a basic IDP (Individual Development Plan). Understands and meets deadlines for system inputs  " Must be able to exchange information in a concise and logical way as well as be sensitive to audience diversity.  " Proven use of discretion and judgment given the subject sensitivity of the work data  " Ability to manage multiple efforts and adjust priorities with evolving work efforts. Requirement Qualifications " Minimum High School Degree, however Bachelor's degree or higher desired or the candidate should have proven equivalent work experience  " Minimum 2 year related experience for non-degree (Bachelor or higher degree) holder  " Good command of English language (both verbal and written)  " Strong communications skills  " Analytical and detail oriented  Spanish a plus but not required

Name: Data Business Solutions Analyst - 135310 with Strategic Staf
Description: The position listed below is not with San Antonio Interviews but with Strategic Staffing Solutions (S3)  San Antonio Interviews is a private organization that works in collaboration with government agencies to promote emerging careers. Our goal is to connect you with supportive resources to supplement your skills in order to attain your dream career. Job DescriptionSTRATEGIC STAFFING SOLUTIONS HAS AN OPENING! Keywords: SAS SQL Tableau  Data Business Solutions Analyst - 135310  Leading Financial Services Firm  Metro San Antonio, TX  W2 Contract Only; No c2c  Pay DOE  What are the responsibilities that this resource will have on a day to day basis:  Decomposing user developed applications mostly written in SAS or Excel and to help develop a solution to retire those processes.  Top technology tools that this resource must have knowledge using:  SAS (Statistical Analysis System) SQL Tableau is a plus  Top skills in the order of importance:  Read the SAS code(1-2 years),  Read/write complex SQL(5-6 years),  Analytical / Process engineer/ Solution Engineer(1-2 year)Company DescriptionStrategic Staffing Solutions (S3) is an international, woman-owned, over $300 million IT and business services corporation based in Detroit. With a composite average annual growth rate of 19%, S3 is fiscally sound and debt free. S3 has had $3.3 Billion in sales since its inception with $1.2 billion of those sales occurring in the last 5 years. It is ranked 16th among the largest staffing firms in the US by Staffing Industry Report and is one of two companies nationally certified as a Charter Partner with Staffing Industry Analysts. S3 is also ranked as the sixth largest diversity staffing firm in the US by Staffing Industry Analysts and one of the top 25 among woman-owned businesses in the nation by Women’s Enterprise USA Magazine.  S3 provides staff augmentation, direct hire recruiting, workforce programs, and outsourced solutions with global industry expertise in energy/utility, healthcare services, insurance, communications, and financial services. It has more than 3,000 direct consultants in 49 out of 50 states in the U.S. and 15 countries including Europe and the Americas.
