Name: Data Analyst
Description: Data Analyst  Location: San Antonio, Texas USApplyJob Number10095San Antonio, Texas USAB is a leading global investment-management and research firm with more than $500 billion in assets under management and a presence in 22 countries, with more than 3,400 employees worldwide. We serve clients ranging from institutions to individuals and private clients, and we offer independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services tailored to our clients’ unique needs. With forward-looking perspective and expertise in equities, fixed-income, alternatives and multi-asset strategies, more than 500 investment professionals collaborate to share ideas and make connections across disciplines, geographies, asset classes and sectors. These collective insights drive innovation and better solutions, helping us keep our clients AHEAD OF TOMORROW®.AB is a leading global investment management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, individuals and private clients in major markets around the world. AB employs more than 500 investment professionals with expertise in growth equities, value equities, fixed income securities, blend strategies, and alternative investments, and, through its subsidiaries and joint ventures, operates in more than 20 countries. AB’s research disciplines include fundamental research, quantitative research, economic research and currency forecasting capabilities. Through its integrated global platform, AB is well-positioned to tailor investment solutions for its clients. AB also offers independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services to institutional investors.  IT Group Description:  Client Group Technology provides development, configuration, testing, project management, and business analyst support for the Client Group’s applications and externally facing websites. The Client Group is comprised of Retail and Institutional Sales, Client Services, Business Development Groups, Marketing, with over 500 staff globally, concentrated in the US, Europe, Asia-ex Japan, Australia, and Japan.  IT Job Description:  We are seeking a San Antonio based Data Analyst to join our Sales Data Management team in Client Group Technology.  This relates to ITBRS Resource ID S126  Describe the role:  The Client Group Technology Data Analyst will be responsible for ensuring the integrity of global Retail and Institutional client data by performing ongoing quality checks, facilitating ad hoc setup and clean-up tasks, providing ongoing reporting and monitoring, and playing a key role in improvement initiatives that have an impact on client related data.  Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports:  This role will immediately be in support of a broad revamping of our data and toolsets for the Client Group that needs to take place to fuel our future growth globally across channels. This includes the building a new data warehouse, bringing together client interactions, sales, content, readership, and third-party data sets, to enable more nimble, effective, and predictive business intelligence, a re-organization and simplification of our CRM, and the build out of new customized front end tools for our global Sales teams.  The data analyst will analyze existing data sets to provide input into how the new structures and tools should be built, they will be responsible for mapping data sets from existing to future state, coordinating reviews and clean-ups with the business, facilitate the migration of data from existing to the new models, and will establish and be responsible for ongoing process for ensuring the accuracy of this data going forward.  The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to: Quality ControlRunning quality control reports against CRM data to identify issues.Assigning Tasks to data owners to confirm appropriate values and/or resolve issues.Provide support in resolving issues where mass updates are needed.Consider controls to prevent issues going forward; consider how to manage false positives.Ad Hoc RequestsSupport setup of new offshore sales territories.Support mass updates, deletes, archiving, merges of CRM and data warehouse records.Investigation and resolution of issues, discrepancies.Act as gatekeeper for creation of new Relationships.Maintenance of pick-list values such as the various, independent, lists of products on activities, opportunities, contacts.ReportingProduce ongoing reports to measure volumes, quality of data sets.Produce ongoing reports showing data team performance against agreed key performance indicators and/or service level agreements.ImprovementsExtract and analyze data sets in relation to enhancements.Contribute to strategy for data migrations and clean-ups.Coordinate migrations and clean-ups with end users, technical support teams.Contribute to evaluation of third-party tools, define requirements for data management tools.Contribute to requirements for implementing controls or automated solutions to reduce manual effort required for data maintenance. Define and document data management policies and procedures.What makes this role unique or interesting (if applicable)?The role will provide a wide variety of experiences and exposures, across different business units, processes, and technology. It will help the candidate develop business analyst and project management expertise skills, along with client servicing and data analysis.What is the professional development value of this role, i.e. what learning and professional growth Qualifications, Experience, Education: Basic QualificationsBachelor’s degree or equivalent3+ years data reporting experience is required (mutual fund data reporting is a plus)2 + years project coordination experienceMust have strong relationship/customer management experienceExperience managing multiple projects and prioritiesUnderstanding and experience with basic data concepts – SQL experience highly preferredPreferred QualificationsProficient in MS ExcelProficient in and enjoys problem solving, critical thinkingAbility to communicate thoughts clearly orally and in writingAbility to work independentlyStrong teamwork and interpersonal skills and ability to communicate with all management levelsStrong communication and presentation skillsMethodical and preciseAbility to adapt and learn quicklyTechnology savvyClient service oriented Special Knowledge (if applicable): CRM experience, ideally Salesforce.comExperience with Business Intelligence / analytics related tools (Microstrategy, Tableau, Qlik, etc.) Experience with Robotics Process Automation nice to have  Location: City/State/Country: San Antonio, TX, USA

Name: Branch Analyst Program
Description: POSITION SUMMARY:The Branch Analyst Diversity Program is available to students from diverse backgrounds, ethnicities, gender and sexual orientation. Individuals are placed in one of our branches located throughout the United States. The placement in Branch Administration includes rotations throughout Operations / Service, Risk / Compliance and Business Development. Analysts are then placed in a separate rotation, working alongside Financial Advisor teams. Branch Analysts will participate in a week-long orientation in our Westchester and New York offices where they will learn about the organization, products and strategic initiatives. They will also hear from senior leaders within the Firm as well as have the opportunity to meet their program peers.DUTIES and RESPONSIBILITIES:Processing and analyzing financial data for client portfoliosCreating asset allocation reviews and financial plansDeveloping proposals and presentations for prospects and clientsAnalyzing the Financial Advisors’ books of business and identifying new business opportunitiesIdentifying opportunities to promote the development of client relationshipsAnalysts will obtain training for and are required to pass the Series 7 and Series 66 licensing examsEDUCATION, EXPERIENCE, KNOWLEDGE, and SKILLS:Education and/or ExperienceBachelor’s Degree in Administration, Management, or Finance preferredMinimum GPA of 3.2A strong desire and commitment to understand the global wealth management business.An ability to understand and interpret numeric data, especially as it relates to financial services.Effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.Demonstrated leadership skills.Knowledge/SkillsStrong desire to gain further understanding of the global wealth management businessDemonstrated leadership skillsEffective written and verbal communication skillsStrong interpersonal skillsStrong team playerExceptional time management and organizational skillsStrong attention to detailExcellent judgment and ability to be discreet in all mannersOutstanding interpersonal skillsStrong work ethicREPORTS TO:Complex Business Service OfficerMorgan StanleyEOE committed to diversifying its workforce.M/F/D/V

Name: Applications Solutions Senior Analyst
Description: Company DescriptionTeamwork · Integrity · Innovation · Professionalism.  The City of San Antonio has identified four Core Values that represent who we are as a City organization.  They are the driving force behind our success as a public service team.  To ensure commitment to these values and to further integrate them with our organizational mission and vision, it is imperative that we seek these behaviors in the people we hireJob DescriptionUnder general direction, is responsible for working closely with clients, business analysts and team members to understand the business requirements that drive the analysis and design of quality technical solutions. Involved in the full systems life cycle including designing, coding, testing, implementing and supporting application software products. Responsible for supporting the selection and implementation of packaged solutions. Exercises no supervision. Essential Job Functions:Project Planning and Strategy: Participates in the project planning process with clients, business analysts and team members.Technical Requirements and Design: Organizes and documents business and technical requirements. Creates conceptual, functional, and technical design specifications to include data modeling.Evaluation and Selection: Assists in evaluating and providing recommendations for application packages and tools. Collects research on the competition in terms of best practices, business processes and procedures. May provide buy vs. build recommendations.Solution Analysis: Analyzes existing applications and platform to identify weaknesses and develop opportunities for improvements when assigned.Systems Definition: Identifies system requirements.Installation and Deployment: Assists in the deployment of new modules, upgrades and fixes.Solution Integration: Integrates solutions with other applications and platforms outside the framework. Participates in integration testing.Solution Development: Defines, develops or modifies software application modules using disciplined development processes.Documentation: Documents functions and changes to new or modified modules and test activities/results.Quality Assurance: Adheres to quality standards and procedures. Reviews modules for quality assurance and checks compliance with application standards and SLAs.Testing: Conducts unit testing of system enhancements, modifications, applications updates, fixes and upgrades to ensure software meets vendor and client specifications. Implements integration plans. Interfaces with testing teams to incorporate plans into integration testing process.Release Management: Makes modules production-ready by moving them to libraries, completing forms, following procedures, completing version control documents, etc.Support and Maintenance: Provides ongoing maintenance of applications. Provides Tier II (application) support. Troubleshoots existing information systems to identify errors or deficiencies and develops solutions.Performance Management: Assists in capturing and tracing operational metrics to understand performance and to ensure success in process improvements.Data Analysis: May produce and analyze customized data extracts from system based on user requirements.User Training: Assists in the development of user guides and training documentation for manual and web enabled systems.Vendor Support: Monitors solution analysis, design, development, integration, enhancement, maintenance and support for contract staff or teams.Coaching and Mentoring: Provides technical coaching and mentoring to less-experienced team members.Performs related duties and fulfills responsibilities as required.Job Requirements:Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university.Two (2) years of programming and/or systems analysis experience.Applicants for this position must pass a Criminal Justice Information Systems (CJIS) fingerprint-based background check and maintain CJIS eligibility. Due to CJIS requirements related to system access, the following will result in being disqualified for this position: Felony Convictions, Felony Deferred Adjudication, Class A & B Misdemeanor Deferred Adjudication, Class B Misdemeanor Convictions, an Open Arrest for Any Criminal Offense (Felony or Misdemeanor), and Family Violence Convictions.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: • Two (2) years of application development, support, and/or systems analysis experience.  • Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) concepts.  • Working experience with system analysis, design, and programming principles.  • Knowledge of JavaScript, VBScript, CSS, HTML and DHTML, VB, jQuery, Ajax, JAVA, C++, or other programming languages.  • Experience with Filenet, Chameleon, Lagan, Accela, Remedy, STARLims, Netsmart, or FASTER applications.  • Knowledge of MS SQL, and/or Oracle.  • Knowledge of Visual Studio 2003 or higher.  • Skills in providing technical assistance.  • Skills in supporting COTS application software.  • Skill in identifying and solving system and application problemsQualificationsJob Requirements:Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university.Two (2) years of programming and/or systems analysis experience.Applicants for this position must pass a Criminal Justice Information Systems (CJIS) fingerprint-based background check and maintain CJIS eligibility. Due to CJIS requirements related to system access, the following will result in being disqualified for this position: Felony Convictions, Felony Deferred Adjudication, Class A & B Misdemeanor Deferred Adjudication, Class B Misdemeanor Convictions, an Open Arrest for Any Criminal Offense (Felony or Misdemeanor), and Family Violence Convictions.PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS: • Two (2) years of application development, support, and/or systems analysis experience.  • Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) and Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) concepts.  • Working experience with system analysis, design, and programming principles.  • Knowledge of JavaScript, VBScript, CSS, HTML and DHTML, VB, jQuery, Ajax, JAVA, C++, or other programming languages.  • Experience with Filenet, Chameleon, Lagan, Accela, Remedy, STARLims, Netsmart, or FASTER applications.  • Knowledge of MS SQL, and/or Oracle.  • Knowledge of Visual Studio 2003 or higher.  • Skills in providing technical assistance.  • Skills in supporting COTS application software.  • Skill in identifying and solving system and application problemsAdditional InformationAPPLICANT INFORMATION:If selected for this position, official transcripts, diplomas, certifications and licenses must be submitted at the time of processing. Unofficial transcripts and copies of other relevant documents may be attached to the application for consideration in advance.Please be advised that if selected for this position, information regarding employment history as it relates to the qualifications of the position will be needed for employment verification. Applicants claiming military service to meet the experience requirement for this position may attach a DD214 to the application.Unless otherwise stated, applicants are permitted to substitute two years of related full-time experience for one year of higher education or one year of related higher education for two years of experience in order to meet the minimum requirements of the job. One year of full-time experience is defined as 30 or more hours worked per week for 12 months. One year of higher education is defined as 30 credit hours completed at an accredited college or university.Applicants selected for employment with the City of San Antonio in this position must receive satisfactory results from pre-employment drug testing and background checks. If required for the position, a physical, motor vehicle record evaluation, and additional background checks may be conducted.PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS:Physical requirements include occasional lifting/carrying of 5 pounds; visual acuity, speech, and hearing; hand and eye coordination and manual dexterity necessary to operate a computer keyboard and basic office equipment. Subject to sitting, standing, and walking, to perform the essential functions. Working conditions are primarily inside an office environment.Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:Knowledge of principles and practices of budget preparation and administration.Knowledge of automated financial and accounting systems.Knowledge of planning and research principles, practices, and procedures.Knowledge of administrative and management practices.Ability to communicate clearly and effectively, both verbally and in writing.Ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships with City staff and the general public.Ability to analyze and evaluate accounting and financial problems, documents, and reports.Ability to provide technical and professional advice and direction to subordinate staff.Website: http://www.sanantonio.gov/HR/CareerCenter.aspx

Name: Financial Analyst I
Description: Purpose of JobWe are currently seeking talented Financial Analyst I for our San Antonio, TX facility.  Independently uses financial principles to solve moderately complex to complex business problems while performing forecasting, planning, and financial modeling related to income, profitability, liquidity, capital, leverage, asset and liability management or operating expense.Job RequirementsDevelops financial forecasts/plans for a major business area or expense category; with little or no supervision, develops and implements forecasting/planning process, and model improvement initiatives.Independently prepares recurring or ad hoc financial reports and analysis or cost benefit analysis to support and provide insights for internal and external management decision-making.With little or no supervision, delivers moderately complex to complex financial research and value-added business decision support, and recommends or implements solutions to key financial and operational opportunities.Responsible for product assignments, product pricing, product profitability and ad hoc analysis.Acts as a valued business partner by providing informed, proactive analysis and business insights to enable effective decision-making and efficient resource utilization.Acquires and applies intermediate knowledge of the business, its products and processes to resolve issues and navigate obstacles to deliver work product.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field required. Four additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree OR Masters degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field required.If Bachelor's, Four or more years of related experience and accountability for complex tasks and/or projects required OR If Masters, Two years of financial / accounting analysis or related work experience OR If One year of progress towards an advanced financial degree or completion of Two exams towards the CFA designation, Two years of financial / accounting analysis or related work experiencePreferredMaster's Degree in business, finance, economics, mathematics or a related field, CFA, CPAThree plus years of experience in finance at USAA or another financial services companyExperience with financial modeling; high proficiency with excelAbility to present financial concepts to Executive leadershipSuccessfully lead multiple projects that span across multiple lines of businessStrong ability to influence cross functional teams to achieve a desired outcome The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.  At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals.  USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

Name: Billing Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionWe are seeking a Billing Analyst to become an integral part of our client's team! Responsibilities:Provides accounting support to accounting team, and assists accounting personnel in month end close procedures, sorting and processing accounts payable and receivables, reconciliation, expense reports, etc.Verifies invoices and other accounting records are accurate.Makes recommendations to resolve discrepancies.Maintains and audits accounting system and updates documents and records. Compiles data and prepares a variety of reports.Researches and investigates discrepancies in data. Researches and reconciles records to respond to inquiries both internally and externally.Returns records to vendor with incomplete/incorrect information. Maintains off-site storage. Retrieves records as requested.Assume the responsibility of receiving and sorting incoming payments with attention to credibilityManage the status of accounts and balances and identify inconsistenciesIssue and post bills, receipts and invoicesCheck the validity of debit accountsUpdate accounts receivable database with new accounts or missed paymentsEnsure all clients remain informed on their outstanding debts and deadlinesProvide solutions to any relative problems of clientsWrite thorough reports on billing activity with clear and reliable dataComputing balances, recording billing payments and compiling account statements for a company.Responsible for preparing invoices for the delivery of goods or services renderedOther duties they may perform include calculating penalties, interest and late fees for clients who are past due on their payment and accounts.Qualifications: Education: Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance or related field  Experience: 2 or more years of experience in accounting support, BillingCompany DescriptionManpowerGroup is the world leader in innovative workforce solutions, and we create and deliver high-impact solutions that enable our clients to achieve their business goals and enhance their competitiveness. As workforce experts, we connect more than 600,000 people to meaningful work across a wide range of skills and industries every day. Through our ManpowerGroup family of brands we help more than 400,000 clients in 80 countries and territories address their critical talent needs, providing comprehensive solutions to resource, manage and develop talent. In 2016, ManpowerGroup was named one of the Worlds Most Ethical Companies for the sixth consecutive year and one of Fortune's Most Admired Companies for the 13th consecutive year, confirming our position as the most trusted and admired brand in the industry.

Our client is a world leader in manager cloud computing and uses cutting-edge technologies  Interested candidates, please send the resume along with rate and contact. Name: Financial Analyst - Entertainment and Media Industry Opportunity
Description: Job Summary:Provides financial planning and analysis. Responsibilities Designs, implements and provides products, programs, projects, processes and policies in support of the Financial Planning and Analysis function.  Provides financial services and consulting at the corporate, business unit and/or market level; performs analysis and interpretation of financial and other data; directly supports the CFO and Director of Finance team.  Forecasts, analyzes, and evaluates financial plans and budgets; develops recommendations to achieve financial objectives.  Participates in expense forecasting and actuals process, including research and communication of variances, quarterly earnings, press release support, and competitor analysis.  Analyzes and reports on results of various requests for proposals (RFPs) and programs to include total cost modeling, and prepares cost benefit analysis (CBA) recommendations.  Prepares forecast results commentary; compiles consolidated expense actual and forecast reports for distribution to appropriate leadership.  Analyzes trends, researches issues and responds to inquiries.  Contributes to the development of best practices for company.  Participates in and leads financial variances for forecast, budget and monthly close packages.  Acts as point of contact for programming, responsible for understanding detailed financials, key variances and identifying risks/opportunities to the business  Builds process improvements that identify and track key operating metrics that can be leveraged to develop planning tools.  Creates financial models to support P&L forecasting, annual budgeting process, and evaluation of strategic business decisions.  Interfaces with business, finance & sales leads, accounting partners and IT to ensure accurate data and information gathering.  Performs analysis/deep dives on profitability, revenue trends and other periodic ad-hoc analytical projects.  Performs ad hoc research as necessary; prepares and presents comprehensive evaluations, proposals and recommendations to appropriate leadership.  May assist with annual update of long range forecasts.  May manage budgeting process including preparation of templates, coordination of budget meetings, entering budget information into appropriate systems and preparation of presentation materials.  May develop spend profiles and any performance to business requirements.  May be responsible for training and/or acting as the lead for lower level positions in the group. Qualifications Proficient in Microsoft Office suite; advanced skills in Excel with a focus on speed and efficiency  Experience with accounting software, Salesforce.com, Thinkcell, VB and SQL, or ability to learn new systems quickly  Knowledge of FCC rules  Self-starter, can work independently under minimal supervision  Highly detail oriented, with strong attention to accuracy  Excellent planning and organization skills; can multitask and prioritize workload under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment  High degree of quantitative, analysis, problem-solving and decision-making skills; critical thinker  Stress tolerance, can maintain composure when faced with difficult situations/personalities  Excellent oral and written communication skills  Strong interpersonal skills; professional and confident demeanor  Work Experience  3+ years analytical experience in financial planning, operations or other finance-heavy division Education Minimum of 4-year college degree in Accounting or Finance  Certifications  CPA a plus

Name: Data/Systems Analyst SME
Description: Position: Data/Systems Analyst SME Location: United States- Texas Lackland AFB US Citizenship Required for this Position: Yes Relocation Assistance: No relocation assistance available Clearance Type: This position is an ADP Level II position and requires a NACLC. Who We Are: Sumaria Systems, Inc. is a CMMI® Level 3 appraised, ISO 9001 certified Information Technology, Engineering, and Professional Services and Solutions Company headquartered in Danvers, Mass. With operating locations across the U.S., Sumaria provides a full range of services and is capable of responding rapidly and accurately to meet our clients surge requirements. Sumaria has a proven track record of delivering cost-effective services and solutions to our clients on time and within budget. With more than 30+ years of experience and hundreds of successful projects, Sumaria provides a diverse range of technology-based solutions and is recognized as a source of quality information, technology, engineering and professional services and solutions for the Department of Defense and the Federal contractor community. Job Description: • Manages one Windows-based server that is used to process the incoming data and host the Secure Fi le Transfer application (MOVEit DMZ).  • Consults with other HID projects concerning CHCS data.  • Serves as backup for other BDQAS positions as necessary.  • Provide analysis of data requirements to determine data elements, field and table interrelationships, projected data size and data growth, HIPAA/PII data security, access and retention requirements, and fault tolerance and disaster recovery requirements.  • Designs and implements custom reports in MOVEit DMZ for assessing data receipt, system performance, security concerns, and other ad-hoc reporting as needed.  • Designs, implements, and maintains SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) packages for data loading and report generation.  • Assesses, documents, and remediates Extract, Transform and Load (ETL) processes and develops automation mechanisms for unattended processing of data feeds from source systems.  • Serve as subject matter expert on SQL and database issues, providing cross-team support and advice on a variety of issues pertaining to RDBMS usage, data retrieval, and statistical analysis. Minimum Experience/Education: • Security Requirement: This position is an ADP Level II position and requires a NACLC.  • Must meet DoD 8570.01 IAT Level II Certification (Sec+)  • Windows 2008 R2 system administration.  • Database systems including MS SQL 2005/2008 and MySQL.  • System performance, server backups, emergency planning, and network trouble-shooting.  • SQL programming, SSIS package design, and Data Transfer System package design.  • Database design and management is desired as this position performs DBA functions for BDQAS. What We Offer Sumaria is a place where you can put your innovative thinking and business skills into high gear and work alongside other highly intelligent and motivated people. It's a place where you can apply your skills to some of the world's most challenging, interesting, and meaningful projects worldwide. It's a place that values the diversity of our areas of practice and our people. It's what makes Sumaria a great place to work and grow. Sumaria is an equal opportunity employer and considers qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, age, disability, or Vietnam era, or other eligible veteran status, or any other protected factor.

Name: Data Science Analyst
Description: Job DescriptionJob #: 916346  Apex Systems, 2nd largest staffing firm, has immediate Contract-to-Hire opening for a Data Science Analysts in San Antonio, TX with one of our top Fortune 500 Clients! If interested, please respond by sending your most updated Word resume and best method of contact to Nicholas at nbianco@apexsystems.com Data Science Analyst Schedule: 8hr shift starting no later than 8:30am (Mon-Fri) Duration: Contract-to-hire Duties: Conducts advanced analytics leveraging predictive modeling, machine learning, simulation, optimization and other techniques to deliver insights or develop analytical solutions to achieve business objectives.  Supports Subject Matter Experts (SME's) on efforts to develop scalable, efficient, automated solutions for large-scale data analyses, model development, model validation and model implementation.  Translates complex analytical and technical concepts to non-technical employees to enable understanding and drive informed business decisions.  Identify a breach or instance, create a solution and implement it into the system; 'cat and mouse' environment  Business Drivers: Fraud loss avoidance: how can they bring loss numbers down and improve going forward  Becoming more efficient at bringing down losses  Current projects include: released a new model for authorization phone on mobile, big focus in machine learning, and upgrades  Team: 'Consulting' focused: interact with other groups within the enterprise to figure out pain points, then creates a prototype solution, and hand off to IT counterpart for fine tuning and rollout  Work in 5+1 sprints (5 weeks dictated work by manager, 1 week of innovation where you are free to brainstorm new creative solutions for security pain points)  Collaborative environment: must be in by 8:45am for morning huddle, 9-10am is a questions and collaborative design/demo/proposing works to colleagues, and after is where they return to project work  10 team members (CE's or converted CE's), one serves as POC for 5 week sprint then would serve as team member for next  Requirements: Data Acquisition: SQL, *Hadoop*, Spark, Big Data (be able to move data from command line in Unix/Linux)  Expert level in one or more of these Programming languages (Python, Java, R, C#)  Background in statistics: Statistical modeling, decision trees, neural networks, time services (any outside hobbies in stats are a plus like trading stocks or kaggle exercises)  Must be collaborative, speak up with ideas and take in feedback  Nice to Haves: Cloud computing platforms and leveraging their advantages of built in ML/AI libraries  Simulation and optimization techniques and methodologies (Monte Carlo, parametric bootstrapping, etc.)  Monitor trends and determine impacts of upcoming, data science related technologies and techniques through ingesting leading research from academic and practitioner sources  Data wrangling very large, structured and unstructured data sources across distributed environments (Hive, Pig, Scala, etc.)  EEO EmployerApex is an Equal Employment Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Apex will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of applicable law. If you have visited our website in search of information on employment opportunities or to apply for a position, and you require an accommodation in using our website for a search or application, please contact our Employee Services Department at 844-463-6178* Data Acquisition: SQL, *Hadoop*, Spark, Big Data (be able to move data from command line in Unix/Linux) * Expert level in one or more of these Programming languages (Python, Java, R, C#) * Background in statistics: Statistical modeling, decision trees, neural networks, time services (any outside hobbies in stats are a plus like trading stocks or kaggle exercises) * Must be collaborative, speak up with ideas and take in feedback

Name: Systems Analyst/Developer
Description: The Mission: Graham Technologies is hiring a Systems Analyst/Developer in San Antonio, TX. We are looking for a candidate to formulate/define system scope and objectives. The Challenge:· Works under general direction.· Devises or modifies procedures to solve complex problems considering computer equipment capacity and limitations· Prepares detailed specifications from which programs will be written.· Designs, codes, tests, debugs, and documents programs.· Develops and maintains web-site components if applicable.· Participates in related areas, such as design, implementation, integration, management, and maintenance of complex databases, with respect to the operating system, access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, organization, protection and security, documentation, guidelines, and statistical methods; evaluation of commercial off-the-shelf (COTS) products; and analysis of network hardware/software issues.· Provides guidance to other developers.· Ensures compliance with standards and may assist with accreditation activities.What We're Looking For: To land this job you will have to have an active TS/SCI Clearance and the following skills: Required Skills:· Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.· Four years of technical experience in applications software development, three of which are in systems analysis, and one year of which is acting as technical lead for a team of developers.· Has a good understanding of the business or function for which the application is designed.· Six years of experience in the development of Internet/intranet applications such as home pages, interfaces with databases, and security.· Proficient with HyperText Markup Language (HTML), JAVA, or other Internet/intranet application engines as required.· Six years of technical experience in administration, analysis, and programming of computerized databases.· Competent to work at a high level for all phases of system/database development and management.What You Can Expect from Us:We’ll pay you a competitive salary commensurate to your experience. Graham Technologies’ benefits package includes comprehensive health and dental care, life insurance and AD&D, 401(k), up to 27 days of paid time off per year, ten holidays per year, short and long-term disability, education/training assistance, referral program and transportation benefits. We also believe in work-to-life balance and treating our employees as part of the Graham Tech family. We are looking for employees who want to grow in their career and with our company.About Graham Technologies: Established in 2007, Graham Technologies provides Information Technology (IT) and engineering support services to the commercial and federal sectors. Through Superior IT support services and application modernization, Graham has assisted customers in achieving their respective goals and objectives; increasing their return on investment (ROI); and maintaining efficiency and effectiveness of their IT solutions. Graham Technologies is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status.Are you willing to accept the mission?Sounds interesting? Start the conversation. Tell us what the next step in your career could be.

Name: Bosnian Operational Language Analyst 3
Description: OUR COMPANY RBR-Technologies is a service disabled veteran owned small business providing services and solutions in software and web development, IT engineering, knowledge management, language and training services. RBR has a reputation amongst customers and partners alike as the company of choice when high quality and mission success are top requirements. Our success is attributed to the intelligence, dedication, and years of experience our staff comprises within many government organizations including the Intelligence Community (IC), Department of Defense (DoD), and Defense Information Systems Agency (DISA). Join RBR's winning team and use your excellent Bosnian language skills to support vital national security missions. POSITION SUMMARY The Bosnian Operational Language Analyst 3 will be located at San Antonio, Texas and transcribes and/or translates advanced source material, both printed and audio, provides analysis and reporting of translated foreign language source material, and quality control of junior linguists. They typically work as part of or may lead a team of linguists supporting operations CONUS or OCONUS. Must be a U. S. citizen and able to obtain a customer granted security clearance. Must possess native or near native proficiency in the foreign language, typically a 3/3 on the DLPT. RESPONSIBILITIESTranslates advanced level printed materials including technical manuals and foreign language periodicals into good grammatical English.Transcribes and translates foreign language audio files into good grammatical English. Prepares and updates databases of translated source material.Operates customer furnished monitor/recording equipment.Scans intercepted data and determines as pertinent or non-pertinent to mission requirements.Participates in analytical meetings or conferences when applicable.Drafts product reports.Provides quality control of junior linguist transcribed and translated material.REQUIREMENTSThis position requires a TS/SCI with polygraph security clearance.Must have a minimum of ten (10) years of transcription, translation or other language-related cryptologic experience.Bachelors degree or 14 years full time experience experience is required.Performance at Level 3 in Serbian/Croatian listening or reading as defined by the Interagency Language Roundtable (ILR) or Defense Language Proficiency Test (DLPT) is required.This position requires the employee to work on site at San Antonio, TXMust have excellent command of the English language knowledge and ability to produce translations independently.Must have demonstrated superior and professional competency in their previous assignments and positions.BENEFITS401K (Automatic Employer Contribution)Medical Insurance(Multiple CareFirst BlueChoice Plans)Employer Paid Dental and Vision CoverageShort and Long Term DisabilityLife InsuranceAccidental Death and Dismemberment InsurancePaid Time Off10 Federal HolidaysAnnual Community Outreach EntitlementBi-Annual IT EntitlementAnnual Cell Phone EntitlementAcademic Reimbursement ProgramCertification Reimbursement ProgramProfessional Dues ReimbursementEmployee/Family focused EventsFlexible Work Schedules RBR is an Equal Opportunity Employer

Name: Quantitative Risk Analyst Senior

We are currently seeking talented Quantitative Risk Management analysts with large financial institution expertise in credit modeling, model validation, model risk management, or other quantitative experience.  Little to no travel is required.  Conducts and develops quantitative and analytic models, assessments and/or applications in support of risk management efforts that assess the market and identify risks and gaps in existing or proposed processes. Applies diverse methodologies and deep experience in a variety of disciplines to identify and solve complex and/or undefined risk problems. In each of the past five years, we've been a top-40 Fortune 100 Best Companies to Work For®, and we've ranked among Victory Media's Top 10 Military Friendly® Employers 13 years straight. It is an exciting time at USAA and in our Risk Management organization. Or 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree.6 or more years related quantitative analysis experience in a discipline relevant to risk management to include statistical analysis, modeling, mathematics or other quantitative discipline; Or advanced degree/designation in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, or other quantitative discipline and 4 or more years work experience in a quantitative discipline relevant to risk management; Or PhD in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative discipline and up to 2 years work experience in a quantitative discipline relevant to risk managementPreferredAdvanced degree in a quantitative discipline such as: Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, other quantitative discipline; PhD strongly preferredCFA or Risk Management certification.Risk management experience in large financial institution.Working experience with Risk Controls and Risk Assessments.Knowledge of regulatory environment including role of federal oversight agencies. Name: Sales Operations Business Manager
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION: To provide guidance and leadership in developing and implementing strategic programs that drive sales results and increased revenue through exceeding quota and productivity targets and growing pipeline. Understands business goals and objectives and utilizes information to identify gaps and evaluate solutions to enable sales excellence through market development, resource allocation, sales force development, and policy and process improvement. JOB REQUIREMENTS:Key AccountabilitiesExecutes against strategic initiatives at the business segment and department levels: e.g. develops project and communication plans for strategic initiatives.Works cross-functionally to develop and maintain productive partnerships between the sales organization and marketing, support, and other stakeholder groups.Analyzes sales performance metrics for the business segment; recommends remediation plans at the segment and department level to increase productivity.Proactively identifies productivity and process issues and mitigates challenges utilizing cross functional relationships.Analyzes trends related to segment performance in order to direct training and enablement resources and identify organizational needs.Evaluates segment goals to identify opportunities to gain productivity through quota allocation, territory design, sales stage process and forecasting, lead flow, contract management, and execution of the sales and business processes.Works with other segment business managers to align goals and objectives and resources where possible.Develops and executes change management on key initiatives at the segment and department level.Works with Sales Enablement Partners to develop training with segment impact.Collaborates with internal and external training partners for needs analysis, development, delivery, and assessment of training and development programs.Monitors monthly/quarterly forecasts and respective activities associated to current and future pipeline.Manages and provides visibility around leading indicators of future pipeline development and revenue generation (i.e. activity- based measures).Provides leaders insight and summaries on sales productivity and revenue generation metrics, trends, issues, and methodologies.Develops a deep understanding of the supported business segments and collaboration required with internal teams.Key Performance IndicatorsAccurate management of project and communication plans.Manages activity- based development and revenue generation.Successful planning, execution and communication of cross-functional projects in support of Sales leadership objectives.PERSON SPECIFICATION:Bachelor’s degree in Business or a related fieldIncreasingly responsible and complex work experience in business management, operations and/or strategy required. Sales experience preferred.A professional background including experience planning and managing strategic and operational projects is also desired.Ability to drive business results, influence others, and act strategically, typically indicative of 8-10 years of professional experience.Ability to translate strategic objectives into actionable goals and programs.Advanced communications skills, written, verbal and presentation.Ability to present the same information in a variety of ways and adapt to the specific audience.Comfort in presenting various to audiences both small and large at all levels of the company hierarchy.Uses seasoned judgment to suggest approaches that optimize results within customer needs, policy requirements, process constraints, and business/technological constraints.Understands the principles of change management and is able to architect and execute a change effort.Able to apply effective process management and project management skills.Strong financial and business acumen.Strong analytical skills and ability to focus on details.Desire to work with numbers and formulas.

Name: Risk Analyst
Description: IBC Bank successes are the result of an aggressive and innovative attitude. The Bank's "We Do More" philosophy reflects it's dedication to the growth and success of it's employees, customers and communities. IBC bank hires talented, creative and dedicated individuals to help our business succeed. We are a company that values leadership, community engagement and relationship building that leads to a culture of excellence. We are currently seeking to fill positions across all business segments. IBC's focus is to be customer centric and strive to provide excellent customer experience. Time Type: Full time Department: 673 Enterprise Risk Management Job Summary:JOB SUMMARY The Risk Analyst will work in the development and implementation of the International Bancshares Corporation's (IBOC) Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) program. The Risk Analysts report to the Risk Advisors and are responsible for identification, assessment, and prioritization of risks and development of methodologies and processes to measure and report issues to the business process' Senior Management, Risk Management Committee, and Risk Committee. Job Description:ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS The statements on this job description are intended to describe the general nature of level of work being performed by incumbents. They are not an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required by all incumbents. Assist the Risk Analyst II and/or Senior Risk Analyst perform risk assessments, based on the Committee of Sponsoring Organizations of the Treadway Commission (COSO) Enterprise Risk Management framework, which includes identifying, measuring and communicating risk issues.Aid with the compilation of reports over risk appetite measures.In conjunction with the Risk Advisor(s) and Senior Risk Analyst, help develop, implement, and monitor risk mitigation programs.Support the risk management activities over the Model Risk Management program, excludes model validation activities.Research and prepare regulatory summaries of new or updated guidance, regulations, or policies, issued by the Federal Reserve Bank and Federal Deposit Insurance Corporation (FDIC), used by senior management to determine its applicability to the bank.Stay abreast of current and emerging issues in the banking industry.Assume additional responsibilities as required to fulfill departmental goals.Other duties as assigned.SKILLSSelf-starter and excellent written and verbal communication skills.Good working knowledge of Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.Detail oriented and with the aptitude to research, comprehend, and analyze information.Curious and open to learn various bank business processes.EDUCATIONBachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or General Business. Experience within the financial services or auditing industry may substitute education requirement.SDL2017

Name: Data Analyst
Description: Job Number:10012  Position Title:M2-VP-2  Location_formattedLocationLong:Nashville, Tennessee US External Description: CGM is responsible for the daily management of client investment guidelines through multiple compliance systems, most notably, Fidessa Sentinel. We ensure that investment guideline restrictions are maintained and followed; ensuring proper notification of guideline compliance is dispersed to all relevant parties. The CGM team plays a key role in the investment process; a critical part of performing our fiduciary responsibility is properly implementing and monitoring key investment guidelines. Job Description: We are seeking a Nashville based team leader to join our Client Guideline Management team, which is part of the Investment Management Operations Portfolio Services department. They will be responsible for leading a team of individuals and performing compliance coding functions for the Client Guideline Management function. Describe the role: To perform various Investment Compliance tasks including interpreting guidelines, coding, and ad hoc functions. The individual will be expected to work as the team leader and will need to be able to communicate effectively with various internal and external clients.  Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports:  Client Guideline Management analysts support and/or deal with the following internal clients Portfolio Managers, Assistant Portfolio Managers, Traders, Trade Support, Legal and Compliance, Sales, and Risk. On a daily basis, the Analyst will use Sentinel, Linedata, Microsoft Excel, and Microsoft Office; internal applications such as Apex, Portfolio Management System, ACE, and Global Optimizer (GO); and use multiple vendors such Bloomberg.  The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Read, identify, and interpret investment restrictions from guidelines and various other sources used for effective account management.  Code rules into our compliance applications from client guidelines.  Test new investment restrictions in UAT and document test cases to ensure coding is accurate in Compliance systems.  Perform data integrity checks in the compliance applications and address gaps by working with Data Management and Technology to source or update information.  Develop and perform manual testing for portfolio constraints/rules that cannot be coded into the compliance systems.  Produce reports, document records, maintain and archive such records and reports.  What makes this role unique or interesting?  This role will expose the employee to many functional areas within the investment management process, including sales, portfolio management and risk; the employee will also have the opportunity to learn about the data required to support the client guidelines process, and gain an appreciation for the complexity of the instruments we invest in. The engagement with both front office/trading/portfolio management and back office/technology areas, makes this role especially interesting and challenging. The exposure to multiple business areas including Fixed Income, Equity and Multi Asset will provide the analyst with broad exposure to the different business disciplines. The role consists of daily fixed responsibilities and duties; however, the individual will also be expected to help with many projects and ad hoc tasks. Job Qualifications: The Team Lead will learn a lot about all of the different products that AB offers and the differences between them. They will also have a lot of contact with the front office making this a demanding and rewarding position. Qualifications, Experience, Education: The ideal candidate should have a degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting or another relevant discipline. The candidate should have 4 plus years' experience in the financial services industry; compliance experience is necessary. The candidate has experience working with a team and meeting time sensitive deadlines. Experience with compliance tools is a necessity, however additional training will be provided to support the role. Familiarity with Fixed Income instruments is a plus. Special Knowledge: Our analysts typically have track records of outstanding professional performance or academic achievement, along with excellent analytical skills, financial skills, technical skills, attentions to detail and as well as strong communication skills. Candidates should have a strong ability to work in a collaborative environment and to present results to both expert and non-expert audiences.  Location: Nashville / Tennessee / United States  Community / Marketing Title:VP/Coding Team Leader Company Profile: AB is a leading global investment-management and research firm with more than $500 billion in assets under management and a presence in 22 countries, with more than 3,400 employees worldwide. We serve clients ranging from institutions to individuals and private clients, and we offer independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services tailored to our clients' unique needs. With forward-looking perspective and expertise in equities, fixed-income, alternatives and multi-asset strategies, more than 500 investment professionals collaborate to share ideas and make connections across disciplines, geographies, asset classes and sectors. These collective insights drive innovation and better solutions, helping us keep our clients AHEAD OF TOMORROW®.  EEO Employer Verbiage:SDL2017

Name: Client Relationship and Reporting Analyst
Description: Client Relationship and Reporting Analyst  Location: San Antonio, Texas USApplyJob Number10213San Antonio, Texas USAB is a leading global investment-management and research firm with more than $500 billion in assets under management and a presence in 22 countries, with more than 3,400 employees worldwide. We serve clients ranging from institutions to individuals and private clients, and we offer independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services tailored to our clients’ unique needs. With forward-looking perspective and expertise in equities, fixed-income, alternatives and multi-asset strategies, more than 500 investment professionals collaborate to share ideas and make connections across disciplines, geographies, asset classes and sectors. These collective insights drive innovation and better solutions, helping us keep our clients AHEAD OF TOMORROW®.OPS Group Description: The Client Relations Analyst (“Analyst”) resides within AB’s Investor Services division, supporting the Client Group. The Client Group is responsible for delivering the full scope of the firm’s investment services to corporations, endowments, foundations, public funds, and financial institutions. The Analyst plays a key role in supporting the Client Group’s Sales and Client Service Advisors in servicing client accounts and responding to client requests in a timely and accurate manner. OPS Job Description: We are seeking a San Antonio based Institutional Client Relations Analyst to join our Institutional CRA Team in IIM U.S. West. Describe the role: This position will be responsible for supporting the servicing efforts of our Institutional Investment Management Teams. The Analyst is responsible for delivering excellent customer service through fast and accurate processing of orders, providing client reports, and coordinating with other departments to resolve client inquiries. They will report to a San Antonio TX based Manager and work directly with teams in different regions to support their reporting and client servicing needs. Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports: Ensuring exceptional servicing to our external Institutional Clients by supporting the reporting, trade order, presentation and customer inquiry needs of our internal partners and third-party firms (i.e. recordkeepers, investment managers, custodians, trustees and consultants) with whom we partner to support in our business.  Accurate processing of orders, monitor and maintain scheduled reporting requirements. Utilize various internal systems and collaborate with multiple departments to obtain information needed to fulfill client reporting requests by the designated deadline. Validate accuracy of data provided through quality control review. The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Process cash flow requests   Prepare client review and marketing presentations   Troubleshoot and respond to client inquiries about various topics including:  o account balances, holdings, and activity  o fund transfers  o statement reconciliation  o corporate and class action instructions  o online log-on, password reset, navigation and other trouble shooting   Own the take-on and execution of client custom reporting, including compliance certifications and due diligence reporting   Route and monitor client guideline and restriction lists   Support the implementation of regulatory requirements for client accounts   Partner with Senior Analyst on complex client requests   Keep CSA informed of client account activities, and escalate issues when necessary   Liaise with various departments (including Sales, Portfolio Management, Legal, and Operations) to maintain client relationships and fulfill client requests; interact with senior professionals throughout the firm   Help maintain client management database and provide general support to third party firms, advisors and internal teams   Assist with departmental projects and initiatives as needed What makes this role unique or interesting? Individuals with a background in Client Servicing/Reporting would find this position interesting and view it as an opportunity to advance their experience in their designated fields. Job Qualifications: A Client Relations Analyst has the opportunity to learn about the Institutional Business through interaction with various Teams and Departments who service our external clients. He/she will gain exposure to the systems utilized, reporting requirements for this business and develop relationships with our Defined Contribution Team, Institutional Teams, Legal/Compliance, Portfolio Management & Senior Management. Qualifications, Experience, Education:Bachelor degree, preferably in Finance, Economics, or Marketing, with an excellent academic record1-3 years of experience in a professional capacity; industry experience is preferred but not requiredProfessional, personable, and responsible in mannerDemonstrate initiative and good judgment coupled with the ability to work well under pressureOrganized, thorough, and conscientious. Establishes priorities and follows through on tasks to completion Skills:Strong verbal and written communication skillsStrong problem solving and analytical skills. Number and detail-orientedAbility to work independently and cooperatively in a team settingProficient in the use of typical office desktop packages, such as Outlook, Word, Excel PowerPoint, Visio and AccessExperience with SQL or VBA is a plus Location: San Antonio, TX, USA

Name: Cyber Security Analyst
Description: Cyber Security Analyst Location: San Antonio TX Status: Full Time Clearance: Secret Minimum Education: Bachelor’s DegreeJOB RESPONSIBILITIES:Cyber Security AnalystSuprTEK Inc.San Antonio, TX Superlative Technologies (DBA SuprTEK) has an opportunity for a full-time, experienced, and motivated Cyber Security Analyst in support of the Graduate Training Integration Management System (G/TIMS) program for Air Education and Training Command (AETC). The Cyber Security Analyst monitors and analyzes Information Assurance (IA) hardware and software for potential risks to the program. Additional responsibilities include providing recommendations for repair and creating policies and procedures to operate and review IA products. Excellent technical skills, experience in the cyber security field, and a SECRET Security Clearance are required for this highly important position. About SuprTEK SuprTEK is an IT Engineering and Professional Services firm focused on helping the Department of Defense (DoD) and government agencies assure mission success by delivering exceptional solutions with proven results. With corporate headquarters in Ashburn, VA, SuprTEK has a strong presence in the St. Louis Metro East with its Solution and Engineering Delivery business unit, which is currently fulfilling several contracts associated with multiple Air Force bases across the Continental United States (CONUS).  SuprTEK provides a highly competitive compensation package that includes: Health Insurance (with Dental-Eye Care available)401K w/ MatchTrainingPaid VacationOptional Life and Disability InsurancePerformance RewardsWork-Life BalanceFirst Class FacilitiesState-of-the-Art Information TechnologyJob Description The Cyber Security Analyst performs network monitoring, analysis, and reporting through two main functions, Intrusion and Specialist. Under Intrusion, the Cyber Security Analyst examines, tracks, and diagnoses potential IA risks for remediation and repair. Under Specialist, he or she develops documentation for operating and reviewing IA programs. All tasks completed must conform to the provisions of the DoD Directive 8570.01-M. Primary Responsibilities Intrusion: Examine potential security violations, incidents, attacks, and malicious activity to determine if policy has been breached, assess the impact, and preserve artifacts.Enter and track events and incidents.Support incident escalation and assess probable damages, identify damage control and remediation, and assist in developing courses of action.Supervise the installation, monitoring, testing, troubleshooting, and administration of IA hardware and software systems.Recommend, schedule, and perform IA system repairs, systems administration, and maintenance.Analyze patterns of non-compliance or attacks and recommend appropriate actionsto minimize security risks and insider threat.Configure, optimize, and test network devices.Diagnose and resolve IA problems in response to reported incidents.Enhance rule sets to identify or block malicious traffic.Support the design and execution of exercise scenarios. Specialist: Implement and monitor policies and procedures reflecting the legislative intent of applicable laws and regulations.Prepare, distribute, and maintain plans, instructions, guidance, and standard operational procedures concerning Information Security.Participate in IA risk assessments during the C&A process.Prepare, review, and evaluate documentation of compliance.Prepare recommendations for the DAA.Review IA and IA-enabled software, hardware, and firmware for compliance with appropriate security configuration guidelines, policies, and procedures.QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:Qualifications Qualified Candidates will have: A Bachelor’s Degree or equivalent experience.Five or more years of professional experience in cyber security.CompTIA CISSP Certification or other 8570 IAM III certifications.Experience and proficiency with networking infrastructure.An understanding of common networking ports and protocols, traffic flow, system administration elements, and common security elements.Excellent communication skills and the ability to develop and present ideas in oral and written format.Detail-oriented analytical skills. Preferred Candidates should have: Ability to obtain SECRET security clearance.Ability to obtain ITIL Foundations Certification.Experience with malware analysis concepts and methods.Apply for this Position Apply for this position by visiting the SuprTEK website Careers page:  https://www.suprtek.com/index.php/careers/WORK ENVIRONMENT (if applicable):

Name: Intelligence Analyst - All Source - Principal
Description: Job Description: SAIC is hiring an All-Source Intelligence Analyst in San Antonio, TX. This work will be as a member of a small team supporting the HQ 24AF. The successful applicant will serve as a subject matter expert with a primary focus on supporting a small team of operations, engineering, and cyber subject matter experts, anticipating and responding to intelligence information and conducting extensive technical cyber target systems analysis. This individual will serve as the team interface with the larger intelligence community, champion effective and timely operations and intelligence integration, draft information requirements documents and support a variety of technical and non-technical writing and briefing requirements. Qualified candidates must possess TS/SCI security clearance and be able to obtain a POLY. Job Responsibilities:Collect and analyze digital intelligence with specific emphasis on network operations and cyber warfare tactics, techniques, and procedures focused on the threat to networked weapons platforms and US and DoD information networks. Analyzes network events to determine the impact on current operations and conduct all-source research to determine advisory capability and intent. Prepares assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research and analysis of classified and open source information. Correlates threat data from various sources. Develops and maintains analytical procedures to meet changing requirements and ensure maximum operations. Collects data using a combination of standard intelligence methods and business processes. Produces high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for senior US government intelligence and network operations officials. Required Education and Experience:Bachelors and ten (10) years or more experience; Masters and six (6) years or more experience.Ten (10) plus years of experience as an All-source analyst. Strong experience in cyber operations Clearance Requirement:Must possess TS/SCI security clearance and be able to obtain a POLY10k

Name: Chinese Linguist Intel Analyst
Description: COMPANY DESCRIPTION  With over twenty years of experience, Webhead specializes in providing comprehensive web, IT, and cyber security solutions that strengthen governments and commercial businesses. From website development and cloud computing services to database creation and IT support, we provide customized solutions to fit our clients needs. Webhead is headquartered in San Antonio, Texas, but has satellite worksites across the country. Originally founded in 1994, we have become a trusted partner of the U.S. Department of Defense, civil governments and corporate clients.  Webhead combines big business experience with a small business work environment where every employee communicates and contributes to our projects. Employees are expected to work alone, and as a team, to find innovative solutions for our diverse customer base.  JOB SUMMARY  As an Intelligence Analyst, the team member will support the Air Force Office of Special Investigations (AFOSI) mission to provide professional investigative service to commanders of all Air Force activities. AFOSI identifies, investigates and neutralizes criminal, terrorist, and espionage threats to Air Force and Department of Defense (DoD) personnel and resources Detect and provide early warning of worldwide threats to the Air ForceIdentify and resolve crime impacting Air Force readiness or good order and disciplineCombat threats to Air Force information systems and technologiesDefeat and deter fraud in the acquisition of Air Force prioritized weapons systems In order to provide this support to AFOSI, analysts shall conduct collection and translation of open-source Internet information and provide analysis and reporting of collection efforts that identify threats to United States Air Force (USAF) assets worldwide from foreign governments, international terrorists, and unaffiliated actors (for example, hackers and subversive groups). Analysts shall also conduct open source research and analysis in support of AFOSI Counter Intelligence (CI), Counter Terrorism (CT) and Law Enforcement (LE) inquiries, investigations, and operations worldwide to assist AFOSI field units with their respective casework. Analysts shall utilize the following sources and tools to guide research and analysis  As a Linguist, the team member will produce written reports as well provide gist (summarization of key points), detailed summaries, and transcripts of the material. Linguist should be able to succinctly communicate their findings to senior contract and government personnel. The Linguist must have the ability to function effectively as part of a multidisciplinary team. The Linguist may provide intelligence analysis (i.e. IMINT, SIGINT, HUMINT, MASINT, or all-source and work directly with customers and team members to determine project scope and specifications. Exploit the Internet for threat information facing USAF assets worldwideUtilize language skills or use translation software to search for and identify threats in webpages or documents written in a foreign language.Translate or use offsite translation support to identify threats and translate web pages or documents written in a foreign language.Leverage existing open-source collection efforts of other agencies and classified intelligence information resources.Use AFOSI case information to conduct open source research and analysis in support of AFOSI CI and LE inquiries, investigations, and operations.Using visualizations and analytical software, such as Analysts Notebook, conduct link and trend analysis to discover new information, corroborate existing information, and predict future threats to USAF assets.Participate in AFOSI operational activity, as required.Use data in AFCERT and 35 IS databases for correlations to open-source Internet information on threats to USAF networks.Conduct analysis of threats to automated information systems, networks, and critical information in support of AFNETOPS locations and to Network Operations Security Center locations.Provide routine input into AFNETOPS products from the CI perspectiveConduct link and trend analysis to predict Computer Network Attack (CNA) or Computer Network Exploitation (CNE).Advise on network or system vulnerabilities and assess the threat of exploitation.Provide briefings on Information Warfare (IW) indications and warning and recommend countermeasuresCoordinate, fuse and compile analytical products from numerous resources, to include various databases, to ensure a tailored counterintelligence product is provided to support the protection of critical research and technology.Provide reach-back capability and training as needed to subordinate units and customers on how to identify the Information Operations (IO) threat.Produce Intelligence Information Reports (IIRs), CI Notes and other reporting products; complete post-report process.Produce and present intelligence briefingsAttend intelligence conferences and meetings that support AFOSI CI production efforts.Provide weekly and monthly inputs to activity reports. Education Requirements, Work Experience, and Qualifications Bachelors degree in an appropriate disciplineThree (3) years experience in the field of specializationAny combination of education and/or experience will be considered Security Clearance Level: Must currently process a Top Secret Clearance and be eligible for Sensitive Compartment Information (SCI) access; US citizenship is required by regulation and contract. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION Full- time Position  Physical Requirements: This position primarily consists of working indoors in an office environment, at a customer location. Essential functions: The employee may be required to: sit, walk, or stand for extended periods, talk and hear with the ability to communicate, detect, converse with, discern, convey, express oneself, exchange information, to use the hands and fingers to operate, activate, use, prepare, inspect, place, or position, and see to detect, determine, perceive, identify, recognize, judge, observe, inspect, estimate, and assess.  Travel Requirements: Forecasted travel is one trip during contract period of performance to locations within the continental US (CONUS). Other travel may be required based on business goals and objectives.  Non-Disclosure Agreement: This policy is stated in the Employee Handbook, which will be supplied during the first month of employment. All employees of Webhead will be required to sign and adhere to this agreement.  Schedule Requirements  This position shall require the Intelligence Analyst to be available during normal working hours from 8:00a.m. to 5:00 p.m. Central Standard Time(CST)  Disclaimer  The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.  Web-Hed Technologies, Inc. dba Webhead is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any person on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, sex, national orientation, disability, age, or any other characteristic protected by law. All resumes and applications submitted are reviewed for consideration of employment and do not constitute an employment relationship.  Job Type: Full-time

Summary:  The main functions of a financial analyst are to gather and analyze financial information; will typically conduct quantitative analyses of information affecting investment programs of public or private institutions. A typical financial analyst is responsible for analyzing and communicating financial information for clients.
