Name: Financial Analyst-Senior
Description: Job Summary:This  position will provide support for the analytical, accounting, financial reporting  and budgeting activities within the Long School of Medicine (LSOM) Dean’s office.  Responsibilities include development and implementation of financial reporting,  data analysis, data management, and prediction of current/future financial  performance of departments, to include aspects of the annual budget preparation.  Also prepares and develops analytical methods, including forecasting and  modeling, and produces short-term and long-term financial projections. Job Duties: 1. Responsible for aspects of the “All Funds”  budget and Long School of Medicine (LSOM) Administration. Researches, compiles  and reports actual to budget variances for all funds in the LSOM, including ad  hoc reviews at the departmental level.  2. Design and prepare management reports related to  the financial health of all departments and the LSOM Dean’s office. Manage the  preparation of budget for all components of the LSOM. Provide support to budget  managers and departmental administrators and maintain financial and  productivity models and reports that contribute to the financial planning  efforts. Has oversight of reviewing  departmental annual budget proposals for validity against historical metrics  such as clinical volumes, financial performance, and faculty metrics.  3. Coordinate, develop, assemble and administer the  long-term financial planning and decision support for new initiatives, cost/benefit  analysis of new business and budget including development of the financial  management reporting standards. Define and conduct the statistical analysis for  the development of programs, meet with leadership of departments initiating the  program to present and discuss the financial forecasts, and work with them to  fine-tune the financial model.  4. Other duties as assigned by the Director,  Financial Operations, the Senior Director of Finance & Administration,  and/or the Vice Dean for Finance in the LSOM Dean’s Office. Education: Bachelor's degree in a financially related field. Experience: Five (5) years of directly related experience. Preferred Qualifications: Master's degree in business, finance, accounting,  health administration or related field and at least seven (7) years financial  management experience in a health care setting.

Name: Client Reporting and Sales Analyst
Description: Client Reporting and Sales Analyst  Location: San Antonio, Texas USApplyJob Number10255San Antonio, Texas USAB is a leading global investment-management and research firm with more than $500 billion in assets under management and a presence in 22 countries, with more than 3,400 employees worldwide. We serve clients ranging from institutions to individuals and private clients, and we offer independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services tailored to our clients’ unique needs. With forward-looking perspective and expertise in equities, fixed-income, alternatives and multi-asset strategies, more than 500 investment professionals collaborate to share ideas and make connections across disciplines, geographies, asset classes and sectors. These collective insights drive innovation and better solutions, helping us keep our clients AHEAD OF TOMORROW®.OPS Group Description: The Client Relations Analyst (“Analyst”) resides within AB’s Investor Services division, supporting the Client Group. The Client Group is responsible for delivering the full scope of the firm’s investment services to corporations, endowments, foundations, public funds, and financial institutions. The Analyst plays a key role in supporting the Client Group’s Sales and Client Service Advisors in servicing client accounts and responding to client requests in a timely and accurate manner. OPS Job Description: We are seeking a San Antonio based Institutional Client Relations Analyst to join our Institutional CRA Team in IIM U.S. West. Describe the role: This position will be responsible for supporting the servicing efforts of our Institutional Investment Management Teams. The Analyst is responsible for delivering excellent customer service through fast and accurate processing of orders, providing client reports, and coordinating with other departments to resolve client inquiries. They will report to a San Antonio TX based Manager and work directly with teams in different regions to support their reporting and client servicing needs. Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports: Ensuring exceptional servicing to our external Institutional Clients by supporting the reporting, trade order, presentation and customer inquiry needs of our internal partners and third-party firms (i.e. recordkeepers, investment managers, custodians, trustees and consultants) with whom we partner to support in our business.  Accurate processing of orders, monitor and maintain scheduled reporting requirements. Utilize various internal systems and collaborate with multiple departments to obtain information needed to fulfill client reporting requests by the designated deadline. Validate accuracy of data provided through quality control review. The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:  Process cash flow requests   Prepare client review and marketing presentations   Troubleshoot and respond to client inquiries about various topics including:  o account balances, holdings, and activity  o fund transfers  o statement reconciliation  o corporate and class action instructions  o online log-on, password reset, navigation and other trouble shooting   Own the take-on and execution of client custom reporting, including compliance certifications and due diligence reporting   Route and monitor client guideline and restriction lists   Support the implementation of regulatory requirements for client accounts   Partner with Senior Analyst on complex client requests   Keep CSA informed of client account activities, and escalate issues when necessary   Liaise with various departments (including Sales, Portfolio Management, Legal, and Operations) to maintain client relationships and fulfill client requests; interact with senior professionals throughout the firm   Help maintain client management database and provide general support to third party firms, advisors and internal teams   Assist with departmental projects and initiatives as needed  What makes this role unique or interesting?  Individuals with a background in Client Servicing/Reporting would find this position interesting and view it as an opportunity to advance their experience in their designated fields. Job Qualifications A Client Relations Analyst has the opportunity to learn about the Institutional Business through interaction with various Teams and Departments who service our external clients. He/she will gain exposure to the systems utilized, reporting requirements for this business and develop relationships with our Defined Contribution Team, Institutional Teams, Legal/Compliance, Portfolio Management & Senior Management. Qualifications, Experience, Education:Bachelor degree, preferably in Finance, Economics, or Marketing, with an excellent academic record1-3 years of experience in a professional capacity; industry experience is preferred but not requiredProfessional, personable, and responsible in mannerDemonstrate initiative and good judgment coupled with the ability to work well under pressureOrganized, thorough, and conscientious. Establishes priorities and follows through on tasks to completion Skills:Strong verbal and written communication skillsStrong problem solving and analytical skills. Number and detail-orientedAbility to work independently and cooperatively in a team settingProficient in the use of typical office desktop packages, such as Outlook, Word, Excel PowerPoint, Visio and AccessExperience with SQL or VBA is a plus Location: San Antonio, TX, USA

Name: Intelligence Analyst - All Source Principal
Description: JOB DESCRIPTION:SAIC is hiring an All-Source Intelligence Analyst in San Antonio, TX. This work will be as a member of a small team supporting HQ 24 AF. The successful applicant will serve as a subject matter expert with a primary focus on supporting a small team of operations, engineering, and cyber subject matter experts, anticipating and responding to intelligence information and conducting extensive technical cyber target systems analysis. This individual will serve as the team interface with the larger intelligence community, champion effective and timely operations and intelligence integration, draft information requirements documents and support a variety of technical and non-technical writing and briefing requirements. Qualified candidates must possess JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:Collect and analyze intelligence with specific emphasis on network operations and cyber warfare tactics, techniques, and procedures focused on the threat to networked weapons platforms and US and DoD information networks.Analyzes network events to determine the impact on current operations and conduct all-source research to determine advisory capability and intent.Prepares assessments and cyber threat profiles of current events based on the sophisticated collection, research and analysis of classified and open source information. Correlates threat data from various sources. Develops and maintains analytical procedures to meet changing requirements and ensure maximum operations. Collects data using a combination of standard intelligence methods and business processes. Produces and presents high-quality papers, presentations, recommendations, and findings for senior US government intelligence and network operations officials. #ICAFCLEARANCE REQUIREMENTS:Must possess TS/SCI security clearance and be able to obtain a POLYREQUIRED EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelors and ten (10) years or more experienceAll- source analysis Strong experience in cyber operations

Name: Analyst, Senior Financial
Description: Job DescriptionPosition Summary Analytical support for the Beer Operations division of Constellation Brands, Inc. Assist in understanding results to better interpret and communicate the financial implications of business activities. Position requires a high-level of MS Excel competency and USGAAP, strong problem-solving ability, attention to detail, and highly effective communication skills (in both, English and Spanish). Main Responsibilities: A. Planning and Forecasting Coordinate and prepare the Annual Plan/Latest Estimates for all Beer Operations entities; Statutory and Management. Inputs will be received from all business partners (HR, Glass, Capex, Breweries, Procurement, FSS, and Treasury).Prepare Consolidated Plan Cost per Case.Plan Transfer Prices according to Tax guidelines.Coordinate the completion of the Strategic (Long-Range) Plan.Prepare periodic Forecasts (Monthly, Quarterly, etc.)Analyze plan/forecast figures and prepare monthly bridges/waterfalls vs PY/prior forecasts for the main P&L drivers (materials, conversion, depreciation, G&A, etc.)Prepare a Constant Currency analysis to evaluate the impact of FX rate in the results.Model the spending and variances to present a COGS segment view of the main drivers/variances (taking Profit in Inventory into account).Obtain/prepare the necessary back up schedules to support the analysis (Price/Volume/Mix Breakout, Headcount, , Cost per case, etc.).Obtain/prepare Profit & Loss, Balance Sheet and Cash Flow Financials by entity and Ledger.Understand, prepare and explain main variances in Working Capital vs PY/prior forecasts. Obtain explanation to variances in PP&E expenditure.Responsible to load and reconcile the information in the Planning Application by detail (account, entity, business unit, currency, etc.).Identify and communicate potential Risks and Opportunities to the business. B. Monthly Reporting & Analysis Obtain/prepare detailed monthly variance analysis of Actuals vs LE/PF, Plan, PY for the main P&L drivers (materials, conversion, depreciation, G&A, etc.) of the Segment in a MTD, QTD and YTD view.Prepare a Constant Currency analysis to evaluate the impact of FX rate in the results in every bridge.Prepare a FG Mix analysis by source (Nava v Obregon) and by SKU/Packaging (Bottles v Cans, Modelo vs Corona, etc.)Obtain/prepare detailed monthly variance analysis of Actuals vs LE/PF, Plan, PY for the main cash flow drivers (Inventory, Accounts Payable, VAT, etc.) of the Segment.Prepare benchmark analysis between breweries and identify opportunity areas.Elaborate graphics and waterfalls to explain the main variances in the Monthly Management deck.Assist/Validate the Breweries with the Cost per Case analysis.Ad Hoc Analysis as required.Competencies:Proven work experience as a Financial Analyst.Proficient with Spreadsheets, Databases, MS Office and Financial Software applications.Hands on experience analyzing data from multiple sources.Proven experience of Financial Forecasting, Variance and Trend Analysis and Planning.Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business, or Finance; CPA or CMA preferredBusiness Bilingual skills (English-Spanish).Manufacturing environment experience.Big 4 experience a plus. Physical Requirements/Work Environment Occasional lifting up to 25 lbs.Sitting, working at desk/personal computer for extended periods of timePrimary work environment is professional corporate officeAbility to travel commercially to domestic and international locations Location  San Antonio, Texas  Additional Locations  Job Type  Full time  Job Area  Finance & Accounting  Equal Opportunity  Constellation Brands is committed to a continuing program of equal employment opportunity. All persons have equal employment opportunities with Constellation Brands, regardless of their sex, race, color, age, religion, creed, sexual orientation, national origin or citizenship, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition (cancer or genetic characteristics), marital status, gender (including gender identity or gender expression), familial status, military or veteran status, genetic information, pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding, or related conditions (or any other group or category within the framework of the applicable discrimination laws and regulations).SDL2017

Name: Analyst - Sirius Academy Program
Description: A position within the Sirius Academy program is a sought-after role from which to launch a career in IT services. It provides career growth and robust professional development, including: recognized industry certifications; dedicated classroom and e-learning training; on-the-job immersion and real client project experience. Highlights:This exciting opportunity offers proven success with graduates working in multiple areas of IT, including security, networking, virtualization, data center solutions, project management, and managed services.Experience our state-of-the art data center facility with more than 40 different vendors and 150+ types of technology.Attain valuable certifications in the latest technologies, giving you a competitive career advantage.Gain meaningful insight into different areas of the business through rotational training.Sharpen your professional presence with clients through online and classroom learning.As an Analyst in the Academy, you will split your time between our office in Skokie, IL and the Sirius Data Center in Elk Grove Village, IL. After completion of a 6 month training program in the Chicago area starting in January 2019, you will relocate within the continental US to assume a Services Delivery role in one of Sirius’ practices. Possible relocation areas include, but are not limited to: Dallas, San Antonio, Houston, Austin, Kansas City, Omaha, Seattle, Portland, Los Angeles, Phoenix, Denver, Milwaukee, Minneapolis, Charlotte, Raleigh, Tampa, the New York City metro area, or Washington, D.C. Relocation assistance is available. Once with a Services Delivery team, up to 60% overnight travel is expected. Position Summary: The primary purpose of this position is to participate in the Sirius Academy program, which prepares employees to begin careers in IT Consulting with Sirius. Employees will receive exposure to various business units and work on several teams, experience online and classroom learning, and develop soft skills to make them more impactful in front of clients. Additionally, employees will participate in shadowing and mentoring opportunities and hands-on technology training, all designed to help develop the necessary skills for an ultimate role as a member of our services organization. Primary Duties& ResponsibilitiesParticipates in a several month training curriculum at the Sirius offices in the Chicago area: o Completing assigned rotations through various business units  o Self-development and certification courses  o Hands-on experience in the Sirius Data Center  o Practical exposure through on-the-job training which includes mentoring by a team of dedicated engineers and introduction to designing technology solutions for a client environment Learns and develops in all phases as an Information Technology engineer, to include: o Systems design  o Implementation& installation  o Integration  o Systems assurance  o Project management Obtains satisfactory evaluations through progress reviews in order to advance in training programDevelops a base level of technical and consulting enabling performance of quality service for clients Basic Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Management Information Systems, Information Technology, Engineering, Mathematics or a related fieldExperience with MS Office suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint)Other Position Requirements:Demonstrated ability to multitask and prioritize workload under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environmentDemonstrated organizational, time-management, problem solving and follow-up skillsDemonstrated presentation and communication skillsDemonstrated ability to work as a team memberPreferred Qualifications:Linux experienceProgramming experienceExposure to an Agile environmentPrior experience with VMWare (automation, orchestration, cloud)Prior experience with Cisco route/switch Networking solutions, and/or Network Security solutions (Palo Alto, Cisco ISE)Prior experience with Aruba Wireless (HP) solutionsData Privacy and Security:All Sirius employees are responsible to safeguard the information and information systems that they use or handle in the execution of their duties. Employees are obligated to know and perform their duties in accordance with Sirius policies, standards, and procedures related to security and report security violations to the appropriate Sirius authority.Participate at hire and annually in the Information Security Awareness training as well as other required training identified by the Human Resources department. Other data privacy and data security related regulatory training may be required based on your role or assignment.Essential Functions: This position exists to provide technical consulting solutions to customers and as such requires the ability to travel to and from customer sites and interact with customers on an ongoing and regular basis.  The above primary duties, responsibilities, and position requirements are not all inclusive.  Sirius is an equal opportunity employer that values diversity. As a government contractor, Sirius takes affirmative action to employ and advance in employment qualified women, minorities, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans; maintains a drug-free workplace; and participates in E-Verify.  Individuals who receive job offers will be required to complete pre-employment screening that includes a background check verifying name, residences, education, work experience, and criminal convictions consistent with the Fair Credit Reporting Act; and a drug test for controlled substances consistent with the Drug-Free Workplace Act and the Americans with Disabilities Act.  Sirius will not sponsor work eligibility for this position.

Name: Investment Administrator Analyst
Description: Investment Administrator Analyst  Location: San Antonio, Texas USApplyJob Number10199San Antonio, Texas USAB is a leading global investment-management and research firm with more than $500 billion in assets under management and a presence in 22 countries, with more than 3,400 employees worldwide. We serve clients ranging from institutions to individuals and private clients, and we offer independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services tailored to our clients’ unique needs. With forward-looking perspective and expertise in equities, fixed-income, alternatives and multi-asset strategies, more than 500 investment professionals collaborate to share ideas and make connections across disciplines, geographies, asset classes and sectors. These collective insights drive innovation and better solutions, helping us keep our clients AHEAD OF TOMORROW®.OPS Group Description: Separately Managed Accounts (SMA) Operations ensure that all accounts are invested in their selected model in a timely, efficient and accurate manner. We support equity and fixed income portfolio management and sales teams by performing critical daily, weekly and monthly tasks to ensure account data is accurate and accounts are invested properly. The member of this team will perform various daily, weekly and monthly duties, field inquiries from internal and external clients and work on high level tasks, projects and issues as needed. OPS Job Description: We are seeking a San Antonio, Texas-based Analyst to join our Oversight Team in the SMA Operations Team. Describe the role: The Analyst will be responsible for performing and overseeing the various tasks that support the SMA fixed income and equity portfolio business. The best candidate for this position will possess outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills; excellent communication skills; intermediate operational knowledge involving: securities, trading, portfolio management, trade settlement, reconciliation corporate actions and reporting.  Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports:  The SMA Analyst will be responsible for providing service and support to the SMA fixed income and equity portfolio management and sales teams. The Analyst will be responsible for a wide variety of evolving tasks related to but not limited to this support. Key applications used are Fiserv Security APL, MS Excel, MS Access, AWD, Bloomberg and web based sponsor trading and trade support applications. The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Oversee our 3rd party service provider (SEI) who builds most equity trades, processes our new and terminated account action items and reconciles our accounts with the custodians. We have a large number of controls in place to ensure SEI performs to our standards. The candidate will monitor daily and weekly controls to ensure a high level of service from SEI.Review accounts in the portfolio management system and ensure that they are coded appropriately at all times.Review accounts to ensure they are reconciled in a timely manner by SEI and update aged item reporting weekly.Manage Trade Rotation and SMA Orders: Review block trade orders to implement model account changes, analyze trades for potential violations of account restrictions and communicate block trade orders to the AllianceBernstein trading desk for execution.Update and communicate Portfolio Management model changes to sponsorsReview account termination requests processed by SEI are in full compliance with client instructions (full liquidation, partial liquidation, and keep as is)Set up new securities and benchmarks as necessary on Security APL ensuring data matches Bloomberg’s security attributes.Process municipal fixed income trade files and trade allocations using various sponsor web sites.Regularly monitor assigned accounts for potential restriction violations.Analyze current holdings of perspective clients to managed account styles and make recommendations to sell or hold securitiesServe as mentor and trainer to staff and internal clientsTests and provides qualitative and quantitative feedback to management for process changes and enhancements, including workflows, automation initiatives and risk control designReview and complete error correctionsConduct independent evaluations of critical processes to ensure that exposure areas are adequately controlledLead workflow management to ensure work is completed timely by the teamReview multiple web portals, work queues and inboxes to ensure outstanding work has been completed by teamQuality review of work processed by the team and our 3rd party service provider (SEI), which is sent to trading for executionIndependently develop and test team proceduresLead on boarding initiatives of new relationships with SEI, State Street and internal stakeholdersWork directly with SEI to review and resolve escalated items and issues (workflow, technology, etc.) What makes this role unique or interesting? The person in this diverse and fast-paced role will be exposed to a wide scope of ever-evolving businesses within our firm. He or she will be encouraged to develop better practices for existing tasks, enhance procedures and continuously cross train on other areas of our business within SMA Oversight. What is the professional development value of this role? The person in this role will have an opportunity to drive the success of this department by partnering with various internal and external groups to enhance processes, mitigate risks, and launch new clients and products. This person will also be exposed to many areas within our firm and will become familiar with the processes of various groups over time. Job QualificationsQualifications, Experience, Education: The candidate should have very strong communication and analytical skills and be highly organized and detail-oriented. The candidate should demonstrate proficiency in manipulating and generating Excel spreadsheets and using Access databases. The candidate should demonstrate a strong understanding of securities markets. The ideal candidate would have at three to five years’ experience in the finance industry and ideally a Business or Finance degree. Skills:Proficient in the use of office desktop packages such as Outlook, Word, Access, Excel, AWD; Bloomberg.Exceptional communication, time management, problem framing, and follow up skills requiredDemonstrated experience of outstanding analytical and problem-solving skills.Organized, thorough and conscientious. Establishes priorities and follows through on tasks to completionDetail oriented• Ability to front face with other operational teams, sales, portfolio management and tradingSpecial Knowledge:Demonstrated intermediate operational knowledge involving: securities, trading, portfolio management, trade settlement, reconciliation, corporate actions and reportingDemonstrated ability to work in a fast-paced environment and able to adapt to changeDemonstrated ability to work independently, when applicable, and cooperatively in a team settingCandidate must be customer focused and extremely flexibleDemonstrated ability to further develop skills through training and as provided through coaching and feedbackWilling to learn new applications as needed based on job requirements and changes that may take place Location: San Antonio, Texas USA

Name: Financial Analyst-Senior
Description: Purpose of JobWe are currently seeking talented Senior Financial Analyst for our San Antonio, TX facility.  Routinely, guides and facilitates cross functional teams. Teaches and mentors others about simple to moderately complex financial processes. Proven ability to use financial principles to solve complex business problems through one or more of the following activities: forecasts/plans, modeling scenarios, income, profitability, liquidity, capital, leverage, asset and liability management.Job RequirementsGuides and facilitates cross-functional teams: performing financial forecast and plans, modeling scenarios, executing stress tests and performing economic modeling for USAA business units.Applies advanced knowledge to lead a financial process or financial category that may include: income, profitability, liquidity, capital, leverage, asset and liability management.Acts as a key resource and valued business partner, providing informed, proactive financial analysis with fact-based, holistic and forward-looking perspectives that will enable better decision making by senior management.Routinely interacts with senior management becoming their trusted advisor on financial issues. Makes recommendations to solve day-today, as well as strategic financial business problems.Acquires and applies advanced knowledge of the business, its products, services and processes.Serves as a resource to team members on escalated issues of a complex nature.Teaches others about financial processes, drivers and systems ensuring information sharing and knowledge transfer to less experienced team members. Reviews the work of other analysts.Minimum RequirementsBachelor's degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field required. Four additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree OR Masters degree in Business, Accounting, Finance, Economics, or a related field required.If Bachelor's, Six or more years of related experience and accountability for complex tasks and/or projects required OR If Masters degree, Four or more years of related experience and accountability for complex tasks and/or projects required OR If One year of progress towards an advanced financial degree or completion of 2 exams towards the CFA designation, Four years of financial / accounting analysis or related work experienceAdvanced knowledge of data analysis and relevant technical accounting/finance acumen required.Advanced level of business acumen in the areas of the business operations, industry practices and emerging trends required.PreferredMaster's Degree in business, finance, economics, mathematics or a related field, CFA, CPAExperience with financial modeling; high proficiency with excelExecutive presence; ability to communicate effectively with Executive leadership across the Enterprise The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.  At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals.  USAA also offers a variety of on-site services and conveniences to help you manage your work and personal life, including seven cafeterias, two company stores and three fitness centers. Relocation assistance is not available for this position.

Name: Fusion Engineer - Technical Analyst
Description: As a member of the Support organization, your focus is to deliver post-sales support and solutions to the Oracle customer base while serving as an advocate for customer needs. This involves resolving post-sales non-technical customer inquiries via phone and electronic means, as well as, technical questions regarding the use of and troubleshooting for our Electronic Support Services. A primary point of contact for customers, you are responsible for facilitating customer relationships with Support and providing advice and assistance to internal Oracle employees on diverse customer situations and escalated issues.  As a Sr. Support Engineer, you will be the technical interface to customers, Original Equipment Manufacturers (OEMs) and Value-Added Resellers (VARs) for resolution of problems related to the installation, recommended maintenance and use of Oracle products. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in their competencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also, you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to complete assigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, you will routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions to customer issues.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. Have an understanding of all Oracle products in theircompetencies and in-depth knowledge of several products and/or platforms. Also,you should be highly experienced in multiple platforms and be able to completeassigned duties with minimal direction from management. In this position, youwill routinely act independently while researching and developing solutions tocustomer issues.  Job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. Name: Senior Financial Analyst - Petco Foundation
Description: The Petco Foundation is an independent 501(c) (3) non-profit organization dedicated to supporting lifesaving animal welfare work in communities across the country. Since 1999, the Petco Foundation has harnessed the power of donations made at more than 1,500 Petco and Unleashed stores across the country to invest more than $200 million in animal welfare organizations. With thousands of animal welfare partners, the Petco Foundation inspires and empowers communities to make a difference by investing in adoption and medical care programs, spay/neuter services, pet cancer research and treatment, service and therapy animals, and numerous other lifesaving initiatives. Through the Think Adoption First program, the Petco Foundation partners with Petco stores to increase pet adoptions. So far, they’ve helped more than 5.5 million pets find loving families. POSITION SUMMARY:The Senior Financial Analyst – Petco Foundation, will be in our San Antonio, TX office and will reporting to the Financial Planning & Analysis Manager, and will provide information and support to the extended Petco Foundation team with a primary focus on Lifesaving Initiatives and furthering the goal of creating a lifesaving nation.From a strategic perspective, the successful candidate will analyze current systems and processes related to data capture, reporting, etc., and develop and implement recommendations to improve efficiency, effectiveness and accuracy. Additionally, they will research the best ways to leverage Petco data as well as partner data to conduct in depth quantitative analysis to drive lifesaving initiatives. On a daily basis, the Lifesaving Analyst serves as back office support for the Manager of Financial Planning and Analysis as well as the rest of the Senior Petco Foundation Team by generating lifesaving reports and communicating results via dashboards, presentations, etc. Additionally, this Lifesaving Analyst will be working on the Strategic Lifesaving Impact model and collaborating with the Financial Planning Manager and the Petco analytics team to develop analytics that will support the Foundation’s mission to become a leader in philanthropic analysis.SCOPE AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Generate, analyze, and interpret data to develop and implement behavioral and predictive models and strategies to ensure partner effectiveness at maximize lifesaving impact.Utilize broad skill-set to analyze complex data and identify trends that present opportunities or exposures for the Foundation and its lifesaving strategy as well as make recommendations on appropriate actions.Communicate complex analytical work in a clear and comprehensible manner through strong presentation and personal communication skills.Analyze current systems and processes related to data capture and lifesaving reporting to develop and implement recommendations to improve efficiency, effectiveness and accuracy.Create clear and concise PowerPoint presentations that convey test results, conclusions, and ultimately, strategic recommendations.Utilize skills to analyze the lifesaving department’s data to identify trends that present opportunities or exposures for the Foundation and the Animal Welfare Industry and make recommendations on appropriate actions as needed.Assist in the development and review of presentation materials monthly to Senior Officers and quarterly to the Board of Directors and as needed during the annual budget and audit processes.Provide field program managers with standard and customized reports to support lifesaving initiativesWork independently or with Petco IT and/or CRM teams to set-up or request lifesaving and other reports to meet the needs of the Foundation team.Translate data and trends into a variety of charts and reports that may be used to develop lifesaving strategies, collateral such as the annual report, and presentations for staff, Board and other meetings.Train other team members as necessary on systems capabilities and routine field reporting.Perform additional duties as assigned.Provide support for the development and refinement of Foundation’s lifesaving vision and strategy Support the work on the development of investment models for evaluation of lifesaving and other cause investment strategies Collaborate with all Foundation teams and Petco related departments on all lifesaving partnerships and programs; Utilize multiple internal and external data sources to generate the most meaningful and actionable insights from the data. Data sources include EDW, RMS, Polaris, PALS and Foundation. EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE:Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Finance, or related, plus 5 years related experience; Master’s Degree preferred. Highly proficient in MS Excel (including pivot tables, charts and formulas) allowing the quick and easy manipulation of data for a variety of applications. Working knowledge of MicroStrategies (EDW), Petco’s data warehouse system, would be helpful. Demonstrated ability to prioritize workload and ability to manage multiple projects while meeting deadlines.Excellent analytical skills and ability to produce reports with a high degree of accuracyAbility to create presentation decks using MS PowerPoint.Excellent client service skills and ability to think “customer first.”Strong ability to build and develop relationships with internal stakeholders and teammates.Ability to quickly learn current technology and systems and determine best way to leverage resources to complete projects, while making recommendations for future technology enhancements.Self-motivated, self starter, comfortable operating under a degree of ambiguity. Passionate about animal welfare and the Petco Foundation mission.

Name: Sr. Financial Analyst
Description: You'll be interested in this long term temporary-to-fulltime position with one of our clients, if you're looking for work as a Senior Financial Analyst. This Senior Financial Analyst position is located in San Antonio, Texas. If you can be our client's primary point of contact for all financial issues, including project spending, planning, forecasting and annual budgeting, you might be a good fit for this role. If you can perform analysis of the operating results and financial performance of core business segments supporting public reporting requirements, and provide decision-making support for future company investments, you might be a good fit for this Senior Financial Analyst consultant role. How you will make an impact - Be able to analyze financial results, distill and synthesize key issues, communicate updates to senior management all in order to drive existing management reporting - Collaborate with Operations and Accounting to drive improved management reporting by tracking financial results more discreetly and accurately - Create sustainable business, operational, and financial processes widely understood by all necessary teams - Optimize business performance by identifying and executing financial analysis - Work closely with Functional leads - provide management reporting, accounting and compliance guidance, and ensure alignment of operational initiatives - Evaluate financial results, summarize key trends, assess current and future business risks, and communicate critical updates all in the course of preparing monthly and quarterly reporting to senior leadership - Cultivate positive relationships with key business partners and Finance/Accounting leadership - Provide assistance in ad-hoc analysis and presentation requests  Our industry-leading alliances and broad client network provide you greater access to a variety of unique interim and long-term project opportunities that can keep you continuously engaged. We also provide competitive benefits and compensation packages, as well as online training and continuing professional education (CPE). Our parent company, Robert Half, has appeared on Fortune? magazine's list of "World's Most Admired Companies" since 1998.  At Robert Half Management Resources, your experience matters - and we put it to good use. To apply for this position or for more information on other engagements, visit us online at roberthalfmr.com or call your branch office at 1.888.400.7474.  All applicants applying for U.S. job openings must be authorized to work in the United States. All applicants applying for Canadian job openings must be authorized to work in Canada.  ? 2018 Robert Half Management Resources. An Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disability/Veterans  By clicking 'Apply Now' you are agreeing to Robert Half Terms of Use. Req ID:* 04080-0010732649Functional Role:* Sr. Financial AnalystCountry:* USAState:* TXCity:* San AntonioPostal Code:* 78215Compensation:* $35.63 to $41.25 per hourRequirements:* - Creative problem solver who anticipates risks and opportunities and maintains a vision for continuous improvement - A BA/BS degree in Finance, Business, or related field necessary - Able to think critically and operate effectively with management - CPA or MBA preferred - Efficient with process reengineering and optimization - Well-versed in office systems, reporting software, databases and other BI tools recommended - Ability to communicate verbally and in writing effectively throughout all levels of the company - 5+ years experience in operations finance required - Demonstrated understanding of Microsoft PowerPoint - Possess strong Microsoft Excel skills - Comprehensive knowledge of account analysis - Financial modeling experience - Strong familiarity with forecasting modeling - US GAAP experience preferred - Skilled in working cross functionally across teams and gaining favor of key decision makers

Name: Administrative Assistant/Operations Analyst
Description: Carenet Healthcare Services is proud to open new paths to health for millions of people each year as we guide them to be more informed about their healthcare options, more engaged in their wellness, and more educated about healthcare costs the may face.  As an Administrative Assistant / Operations Analyst, you'll be joining a team of talented, passionate professionals who are helping to improve healthcare one call at a time. You'll feel proud of the work you do, knowing you're helping others in a profound way.  The Administrative Assistant / Operations Analyst performs a wide range of both Administrative and Analyst duties for our Operations Team.  Duties and Responsibilities include but not limited to: Creating correspondence, reports, minutes, agendas, or memos from drafts; preparing outgoing correspondence, including emails, faxes, and memos; creating spreadsheets and enters information into databases to meet reporting requirements; compiling and generating regular and special reports using appropriate word processing, spreadsheet; developing and preparing both routine and non-routine correspondence, including presentations, letters and memorandums, operating results, schedules, expense reports, ad hoc reports and other materials as neededCoordinating special projects as required by management, planning and coordinating internal or external events and/or functions as needed, planning, prioritizing, organizing, and managing tasks/projectsCreate reports on historical operating performanceReview operating statistics for trends and performanceScheduling and coordinating team members' travel, conferences, committee meetings, and staff meetings, (participate in and implements as directed); handling agendas and meeting minutes as needed; coordinating electronic calendars as requiredCollects data and compiles related reportsEducation and Experience:High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) requiredMinimum of two years related experience and/or training requiredProficiency in MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, & Outlook) requiredExperience with process improvement initiatives and automationExperience with workflow toolsExperience preparing reports and business correspondenceStrong analytical skills including complex data analysisStrong problem solving and creative thinking skillsStrong time management skills and the ability to manage multiple assignments At Carenet Healthcare Services, our teams have the wonderful responsibility to guide millions of people to the healthcare resources and cost savings they need, and to help make the healthcare process less complicated for them. Whether it's finding the best doctors and pharmacies under their health insurance coverage, receiving expert guidance from a registered nurse, enrolling in extra benefits such as gym memberships, or getting an expensive test or procedure done without breaking the bank we are able to guide them to the right resources at the right time.SDL2017

Name: Data Quality Analyst I
Description: Purpose of JobWe are currently seeking talented Data Quality Analyst I for our San Antonio, TX, Remote, Colorado Springs, CO, Phoenix, AZ, or Plano, TX facility.  Interprets results using a variety of techniques, ranging from simple data aggregation via statistical analysis to complex data mining independently. Defines data quality rules and ensures the proper implementation of data quality during the creation and modification of data, according to Enterprise Data and Analytics data quality standards, guidelines, metrics and quality-expectations. Defines rules to evaluate data quality and creates effective test plans, according to Enterprise Data and Analytics data quality standards. Ensures accuracy, completeness, integrity, consistency, uniqueness, and timeliness of data. Executes Enterprise Data and Analytics data quality tests/assessments and data cleansing activities. Monitors compliance of data flows against Enterprise Data and Analytics data quality standards. Serves as liaison between business and internal and external clients.Job RequirementsLeverages advanced data management knowledge to define data quality and metadata processes, define data quality rules, thresholds, and standard metrics/quality-expectations for data elements that support critical business processes. Develops and implements data quality tests/assessments. Leads discussions with cross-functional teams.Establish data profiling standards and best practices. Investigates effectiveness of data quality controls and metadata capture, and identifies improvement opportunities. Consults with business and IT process owners to review the effectiveness of data quality controls and metadata capture, and aligns best practices and tools based on business needs.Leverages advanced knowledge to consult on the development and implementation controls to mitigate data quality risk. Monitors data quality results, reports and dashboard, and consults on data quality corrective action plans. Establishes best practices to ensure adherence to enterprise data quality programs and standards.Partners with enterprise data and analytic stakeholders to establish metrics for data quality process assessment. Checks and reviews failures from complex compliance assessments.Consults with enterprise on standards for metadata repository management, access requests, metadata association.Leverages advanced data management knowledge to consult on the impact of complex changes to reference data, and to coordinate requests for reference data changes that involve multiple business areas. Collaborates with enterprise data and analytic peers on reconciliation and maintenance of reference data. Minimum Requirements Bachelor's Degree in a Business or Science discipline. Four additional years work experience in data management, data quality or business applications function or related experience can be substituted in lieu of a degree in addition to the minimum years of work experience required OR A Master's Degree in a Business or Science discipline or a related discipline OR A PhD in a Business or Science discipline or a related discipline.If Bachelor's degree, 6+ years experience in data management, data quality or business applications function OR If Master's degree, 4+ years experience in a data management, data quality or business applications function OR If PhD, 3+ years experience in a data management, data quality or business applications function. *Qualifications may warrant placement in a different job level.*  When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not be able to change your responses.  Preferred Advanced knowledge of frequency and duplicate analysis, cross dataset dependencies, orphan child data rows, redundancy analysis; data extraction techniques and applications.Advanced knowledge in Data Quality tools, SQL, SAS, BI tools or other analysis software.Advanced knowledge of relevant industry data & methods and demonstrated ability to connect external insights to business problems.Demonstrates advanced skills in: understanding and correcting data discrepancies; reading and translating data models; data querying; identifying data anomalies and root cause analysis; understanding and capability to explain Master Data Management.Proven ability to influence business decisions. The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.  At Employer our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. Relocation assistance is available for this position. For Internal Candidates: Must complete 12 months in current position (from date of hire or date of placement), or must have managers approval prior to posting. Last day for internal candidatesto apply to the opening is 09/25/18 by 11:59 pm CST time.

Name: Microsoft Application Solutions Analyst
Description: Job Title:Microsoft Application Solutions Analyst-2480Location:Corporate Campus-TX054Full-Time/Part Time:Full-timeJob Description:Position OverviewDesigns, develops, implements, tests, deploys, supports and documents Microsoft based solutions across a variety of distributed platforms. Plays a role in defining, growing, enhancing and implementing the web technology strategy to position the web environment for the long term. Utilizes the Integrated Solution Group's varied web technology to enhance business capabilities and increase process efficiency both within MIS and with the lines of business in the organization. Works with the lines of business to understand and transpose business requirements into pragmatic solutions utilizing standard MIS procedures and technology that are cost effective and designed commensurate with their importance. Develops, maintains and configures Microsoft infrastructure tools and utilities and any ancillary technologies used to complement the Microsoft solutions in the Credit Union. Ensures new and existing solutions extract maximum reuse from application services, tools and utilities to manage the IT footprint and keep the environment as simple as possible.Essential Job FunctionsWorks with partial autonomy from technical leads in designing, implementing and supporting Microsoft based solutions including such technologies as Visual Studio, Sharepoint, CRM Dynamics, WCF, Silverlight, SQL Server and Windows Server.Makes substantial contributions in guiding the design and standards of web integration access methods that are applicable to the Credit Union. Provide consultancy and support for all initiatives that have a need to integrate data or systems or other web resources into new or existing web applications.Supports existing Microsoft based production solutions including problem resolution, monitoring, performance management and capacity management. Supplies feedback into the organization for the implementation of process or technology improvements to ensure issues do not reoccur.Implements Service Requests for the lines of business requiring enhancements or other modifications to Sharepoint based intranet applications or other internal .Net based solutions. Plays a role in setting the direction and implementation of enterprise solutions to ensure configurations that are within recommended practices of deployment and are scalable, reliable, and durable.Additional Job ResponsibilitiesUnit tests development components to ensure features, functions and customizations are problem-free with minimal negative impact on members/users. Ensures systems are easily maintainable.Develops a significant understanding of the business processes and goals of the lines of business involved to ensure designed solutions meet business needs and minimize possible negative impact on business' day-to-day operations. Works with the business to translate non-technical requirements into realistic, pragmatic, technical solutions that meet business timelines and align with the strategic direction within MIS.Provides timely status and feedback to MIS management, team leaders and project sponsors as required through clear and concise communication when providing guidance, responding to questions and setting expectations.Keeps abreast of new technologies and applications through formal and/or self-paced professional development to improve internal software development processes and implement creative solutions for the lines of business.Assists with the evaluation, implementation and support of packaged application tools throughout the organization. Understands the applicability of the tool within the project and software development lifecycle and offer suggestions for use.Education and TrainingBachelors Degree in Management Information Systems, Computer Science, Engineering or comparable education and/or experience.Knowledge and ExperienceTwo years experience and/or training designing and implementing technical solutions.Two years of documented application development experience of a structured Software Development Lifecycle process, performing among others, the following activities: (a) Requirements gathering, (b) Use case generation and documentation, (c) Design of complex solutions involving two and three tier architectures, (d) Generation of both functional and technical design documents for use by other programming staff.Documented experience designing, developing and delivering solutions using a wide range of enterprise applications, using custom and/or packaged product approaches. While experience should be biased towards .Net applications, additional light knowledge in diverse alternative technologies is required.Strong knowledge of internet based infrastructure, technology and concepts in a large corporate web environment, with the ability to grasp quickly new technologies, applications and concepts, and apply them as required.Documented use of structured application development methodologies and principles, with an understanding of structured environments using distinct development, test and production environments.Experience planning, designing, implementing and supporting infrastructure components such as: source code control utilities, environment administration and monitoring technologies, IIS, SharePoint, Visual Studio, JavaScript, AJAX, SQL Server, ActiveX, ASP.Net, XML, Service Oriented Architecture, WCF, Silverlight, Web Services, .Net security implementation, MVC and Dynamics CRM.Proven experience in participating in multiple projects and ability to work with limited supervision showing creativity, innovation, motivation initiative and professionalism.Skill CompetenciesAbility to work in a team environment, meet deadlines, mentor, share knowledge and take on responsibility and accountability for assigned areas.Proven ability to organize and structure a growing inventory of application assets, and be able to draw and maintain diagrams that can quickly convey the overall context of the environment/solution.Excellent interpersonal, analytical, written and verbal communication skills.Physical RequirementsSEDENTARY WORK: Sedentary work involves sitting most of the time. Walking & standing are required only occasionally. Close visual acuity to perform activities like analyzing data, typing, writing, viewing a computer, reading, inspecting small parts or assembling. Generally works in an office environment but may occasionally be required to perform job duties outside of the typical office setting. Evening and/or weekend shifts may be required. We are an EEO/AA/M/F employer that hires veterans and those with disabilities.

Name: Pricing Analyst
Description: Pricing Analyst  Location: San Antonio, Texas USApplyJob Number10115San Antonio, Texas USAB is a leading global investment-management and research firm with more than $500 billion in assets under management and a presence in 22 countries, with more than 3,400 employees worldwide. We serve clients ranging from institutions to individuals and private clients, and we offer independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services tailored to our clients’ unique needs. With forward-looking perspective and expertise in equities, fixed-income, alternatives and multi-asset strategies, more than 500 investment professionals collaborate to share ideas and make connections across disciplines, geographies, asset classes and sectors. These collective insights drive innovation and better solutions, helping us keep our clients AHEAD OF TOMORROW®.Company Description: AB is a leading global investment management firm that offers high-quality research and diversified investment services to institutional clients, individuals and private clients in major markets around the world. AB employs more than 500 investment professionals with expertise in growth equities, value equities, fixed income securities, blend strategies, and alternative investments, and, through its subsidiaries and joint ventures, operates in more than 20 countries. AB’s research disciplines include fundamental research, quantitative research, economic research and currency forecasting capabilities. Through its integrated global platform, AB is well-positioned to tailor investment solutions for its clients. AB also offers independent research, portfolio strategy and brokerage-related services to institutional investors. OPS Group Description: The Pricing group supports the entire firm focusing on interactions with the Global Fund Accounting area, Client Reporting and Performance, Portfolio Management, and Legal and Compliance. Pricing is responsible for timely and accurate valuations of all assets held in client accounts. The pricing group reviews and updates securities pricing for clients on a daily, weekly, and monthly basis. Prices securities for institutional and private clients as well as support daily NAV processing on AB Mutual Funds and similar vehicles. The pricing team will resolve pricing issues that arise as a result of quality control processes or direct challenges by Portfolio Management staff. The team reviews daily vendor supplied prices and researches and resolves pricing exceptions in a timely manner. They manually price securities that are not provided by vendors using brokers, models, or other approved methodologies. They process and manage data related to pricing activities. The team also analyzes price movements against market expectations, prior data and secondary sources. OPS Job Description: We are seeking a Pricing Analyst to join our Pricing Department in the Institutional Investment Management Operations Team located in San Antonio, TX. Describe the role: The Pricing Analyst will be responsible for performing tasks daily in pricing the asset managed by AB and involved in ensuring compliance with AB Policy. These pricing tasks are in support of AB critical business functions. The Analyst will participate in the daily Valuation Committee Conference Call. The Pricing Analyst will review vendor supplied data and will work closely with the Valuation Committee (senior Risk and Compliance officers), data vendors, traders, portfolio managers, global fund accounting, custodians, and other key AB and external staff. They will manage and maintain workflow driving quality control reports and also review hard to price securities and provide research and analysis on key inputs to pricing these assets – with the end result of providing accurate and timely valuation. Describe the applications and business or enterprise functions the role supports: The Pricing team supports most core functions at AB including Global Fund Accounting, Client Reporting and Performance, Portfolio Management, Legal and Compliance, and Financial Reporting. The data distributed by this team effects daily valuation, Mutual Fund NAV’s, regulatory reporting, financial reporting, and trading. The key job responsibilities include, but are not limited to:Research prices for assets in AB valued accounts.Review and validate daily key quality control reports in support of pricing:Missing pricesDaily price varianceStale pricesSystem reconciliationsContact with data vendors to gain commentary on prices as well as challenge pricesContact with internal traders and external brokers to monitor market activityContact with AB portfolio managers and research analysts to comment on hard to price securities and fluctuations in prices of held securities.Assist with the pricing end of day closing process and issues that come up during closing – Vendor and/or Fund delays, Large Variances, NAV Impacting movesWhat makes this role unique or interesting (if applicable)? This role is an entry level role into the field of pricing and valuations. The regulatory and client service environment is continually changing and the Pricing Analyst is at the forefront of this. There is regular interaction with senior members of AB as well as the AB Valuation Committee. AB manages most current asset types (Stocks, Bonds, Asset Backed, all types of Over-the-Counter Derivatives) and the pricing analyst will be exposed to these asset types. What is the professional development value of this role, i.e. what learning and professional growth does the role offer the candidate? The role is currently evolving as the environment changes. This role provides an opportunity to learn from some of most experienced investment professionals in the business as well as very seasoned members of the AB pricing team. This role will have significant exposure to senior members of AB management team and provide opportunities to contribute in a very meaningful way. Job Qualifications (The ideal candidate should have the following): Qualifications, Experience, Education:4-year undergraduate degree preferably in a business-related discipline, such as Finance, Accounting, Economics, MathA strong interest in the financial markets is essential2+ years of work experience in financial industry/services, preferably experience in Pricing, Data Management, Corporate Actions, Fund Accounting etcSkills:Knowledge of multiple asset classes and how they can be used in portfoliosAbility to prioritize, multitask and work effectively within a team, in a deadline-driven environmentStrong interpersonal skills and capability to effectively communicate and build relationships with teams throughout the organizationDemonstrate attention to detail and an analytical approach to problem-solvingIntermediate experience with Microsoft Office applications, especially ExcelPrevious work experience with data/file management, workflows, databases, SQL knowledge preferredWorking knowledge of company analysis, corporate finance and vendor methodology is preferredSpecial Knowledge (if applicable):Knowledge of Bloomberg workstationVendor knowledge, Bloomberg, ICE Interactive Data, Pricing Direct, Reuters, IHS MarkitLocation: City/State/Country: San Antonio/Texas/USA

Name: Marine Analyst
Description: Requisition ID 75424 - Posted 11/06/2018 - Texas  Requisition ID: 75424  Key Responsibilities  + Coordinates with Corporate Analytics, VP Marine & Commercial Operations and Director Commercial Shipping to prepare Marine budget, analyzes variances against monthly actuals, and forecasts year-end position.  + Develops, tracks and reports Marine chartered vessels performance metrics. Assists team with review, analysis, and explanation of variations. Participates in development and enhancement of reporting metrics and dashboards.  + Develops and maintains vessel tracking report/model in coordination with Singapore office to track crude, heavy oils and product cargo flows for Traders.  + Researches/collects, prepares market research to support Chartering. Analyzes market trends. Acquires and maintains external and internal information and resources to develop market intelligence and insights into regional supply/demand issues and knowledge of market fundamentals. Collaborates with the Market Analysis group to prepare data analysis for the team to produce relevant market research.  + Consolidates marine shipping information to summarize and communicate to Commercial/Marine entities.  + Performs time charter fleet administration, voyage estimate vs. actual performance analysis, and monitors and confirms rebills are properly allocated. Liaison between Marine and Accounting to validate actual versus budget discrepancies  + Becomes voyage system power user, acts as liaison between SAT and Singapore offices and Tesoro IT and software provider for updates, testing etc.  + Marine P/L consolidation and communication  + Communicate Tesoro controlled fleet voyage costs to internal customers  + Development and maintenance of Marine reporting tools and systems  + Consolidate and summarize daily marine-related publications to Commercial  + Assists in resolving marine voyage system financial conflicts  + Produces reports as required from Management (actual vs. estimates, vessel/fleet utilization, most economical speed analysis, CPP/DPP market, process monthly  + Ad hoc projects and reports supporting Marine and Commercial activity  + Maintenance of marine freight models. Experience  + 2 or more years of experience in business/analytical support to include financial analysis and development of performance metrics, preference for maritime transportation background required.  Functional Skills  + Problem Management  + Analysis  + Shipping Operations  + Business Processes  + Relationship Management  + Compliance  + Charter Parties  + Information and Reporting  + Standards and Procedures  + Marine Chartering  + Market Research  + Metrics  Andeavor, formerly Tesoro, is a premier refining, marketing and logistics company in the western United States. Our Company operates 10 refineries with a combined capacity of approximately 1.2 million barrels per day, an extensive logistics network, and a retail-marketing system that includes approximately 3,000 retail stations marketed under multiple well-known fuel brands. We employ more than 13,000 talented people.  Our strength lies in our investment in employees and in their future. We measure success not only by the products we bring to our customers, or the financial results we deliver to our shareholders, but also by remaining true to our core values of safety and environmental stewardship, respect and integrity. Name: Systems Analyst (EPASS-HN)
Description: Successful candidate will provide EPASS Advisory and Assistance Services to the Command, Control, Communications, Intelligence, and Networks (C3I&N) Directorate (AFLCMC/HN) at the AF Life-Cycle Management Center (previously the Electronic Systems Center). The C3I&N Directorate’s primary mission is: Connecting Warfighters with Affordable, Secure, and War-Winning Cyber, C3I and Network Systems. The Directorate provides C3I connectivity, network, and infrastructure between Joint, Coalition, AF, and Allied countries space, air, terrestrial, and cyber domains. The Directorate in headquartered at Hanscom AFB, MA with 11 other operating locations. This position will have to interface with a team of military, Government civilian, contractor project managers and FFRDC/A&AS support personnel in the day-to-day activities associated with management of HN’s projects, programs and initiatives.  QUALIFICATIONS:  Ranges from, Level II: BA/BS, 10 years of experience (3 yrs DoD); or 15 years of directly relatable experience (5 DoD); to Level III: Advanced Degree (MA/MS) and 12 years of experience (5 years DoD), or BA/BS degree, and 15 years of experience (5 years DoD), or 20 years of directly related experience with proper certifications (8 DoD). Note: Oasis has some flexibility to swap experience for degree requirements and vice-versa. IT Certifications are a plus. ADDITIONAL INFO: Position Location(s): Hanscom AFB, Lackland AFB, Maxwell AFB Gunter Annex, Wahiawa, HI, Tokyo, Japan.  Travel: Occasional CONUS/OCONUS travel may be required.  Secret clearance (depending on location); or as a minimum, the ability to obtain a clearance Specific Responsibilities: The successful candidate will perform work that involves applying analytical processes to the planning, design, and implementation of new and improved information systems to meet the business requirements of customer organizations. Functions required to be performed by individuals in this specialty may include but are not limited to: Performing needs analyses to define opportunities for new or improved business process solutionsConsulting with customers to identify and recommending requirementsRecommending overall functional and systems requirements and specificationsConducting business process reengineeringConducting feasibility studies and trade-off analysesPreparing business cases for the application of IT solutionsRecommending systems scope and objectivesDeveloping cost estimates for new or modified systemsEnsuring the integration of all systems components; e.g., procedures, databases, policies, software, and hardwarePlanning systems implementation; and/or ensuring the rigorous application of information security/ cybersecurity policies, principles, and practices to the systems analysis processSupporting implementation and execution of Agile software execution in concert with Government and Prime contractors.General Responsibilities:Works with assigned administrative, and matrixed acquisition support, financial management, engineering contracting, configuration and data management, and other staff.Works with the Oasis Task Lead and Oasis teammates to document processes, and initiate and implement AFSO21 Rapid Improvement Events, Training Events and mentoring sessions for all task personnel.Responsible for developing Integrated Master Schedule inputs, and tracking and reporting on Progress for assigned program(s).Develops, reviews, and approves plans, schedules, and other technical documentation.Facilitates and supports Division meetings and reviews, team building, strategic planning, and other on- and off-site activities.Assists as needed in preparing and reviewing program/project documentation, e.g. Determinations and Findings, Justifications and Approvals, Requests for Proposals (RFPs), Statement Of Objectives (SOOs), Statements-of-Work (SOWs), Program Implementation Packages (PiPs), Performance Works Statements (PWS), Systems/Technical Requirements Documents (SRD/TRD), Contract Data Requirements Lists (CDRLs), Program Support Agreements (PSA), EMAs, 1067s, etc. and assist in source selections.Performs other duties as required.

Name: Quantitative Risk Analyst Lead (Controls Oversight)
Description: Purpose of JobWe are currently seeking talented Quantitative Risk Analyst Lead for our San Antonio, TX or Remote facility.  Conducts and develops quantitative and analytic models, assessments and/or applications in support of risk management efforts that assess the market and identify risks and gaps in existing or proposed processes. Applies diverse methodologies and deep experience in a variety of disciplines to identify and solve complex and/or undefined risk problems. Works with leadership to remediate gaps and improvements identified between existing practices and regulatory requirements. Leads and executes complex initiatives and cross functional teams within the Chief Risk Office and across the Enterprise that drive problem resolution. Leverages broad enterprise knowledge and/or expert knowledge of core business discipline(s), products and processes.  Job Requirements Applies expert analytical knowledge to utilize advanced analytics to assess future risk and/or new risks, opportunities, and effectiveness.Translates results into meaningful solutions to enhance decision making.Presents findings to senior level leadership.Applies expert knowledge and industry best practices to quantify risk and aggregate exposures.Develops complex systems and programs that measure aggregate risk exposures.Performs model validations and presents results to senior leadership.Applies innovative and scientific/quantitative analytical approaches to draw conclusions and make recommendations to answer business objectives and drive change.Translates recommendations into communication materials to effectively present to senior leadership.Recommendations typically have a major impact on business results.Provides subject matter expertise in operationalizing recommendations.Applies expert knowledge to produce advanced analytical material to lead discussions with cross functional teams and senior leadership to understand complex business objectives and influence solution strategies.Demonstrates thought leadership in cross functional team environments.Drives and creates cross functional teams in support of initiatives that have significant impact to the enterprise or a core business area.Provides direction and mentorship to other team members in the peer review process.Expertly communicates analytical results, findings and solutions to governance committees and business process owners and influences business analysis. Minimum Requirements Bachelor's degree in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, or other quantitative discipline required. 4 additional years of related experience beyond the minimum required may be substituted in lieu of a degree. 8 or more years of related quantitative analysis experience in a discipline relevant to risk management to include statistical analysis, modeling, mathematics or other quantitative discipline Or advanced degree/designation in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, Actuarial Sciences, or other quantitative discipline and 6 or more years work experience in a quantitative discipline relevant to risk management Or PhD in Economics, Finance, Statistics, Mathematics, or other quantitative discipline and up to 4 years work experience in a quantitative discipline relevant to risk managementSuccessful completion of an analyst assessment may be required.Qualifications may warrant placement in a different job level.* When you apply for this position, you will be required to answer some initial questions. This will take approximately 5 minutes. Once you begin the questions you will not be able to finish them at a later time and you will not be able to change your responses.  Preferred Experience in the mapping of processes, risks, and controls.Experience developing a framework and standards to independently monitor and evaluate risk and controls.Experience working with regulatory bodies such as the OCC, FDIC, or Fed.CPA DesignationExperience with CCAR or SOX Controls The above description reflects the details considered necessary to describe the principal functions of the job and should not be construed as a detailed description of all the work requirements that may be performed in the job.  At USAA our employees enjoy one of the best benefits packages in the business, including a flexible business casual or casual dress environment, comprehensive medical, dental and vision plans, along with wellness and wealth building programs. Additionally, our career path planning and continuing education will assist you with your professional goals. Name: Senior Financial Analyst
Description: Purpose of JobWe are currently seeking talented Senior Financial Analyst for our San Antonio, TX facility.  Routinely, guides and facilitates cross functional teams. Teaches and mentors others about simple to moderately complex financial processes. Proven ability to use financial principles to solve complex business problems through one or more of the following activities: forecasts/plans, modeling scenarios, income, profitability, liquidity, capital, leverage, asset and liability management.Job RequirementsGuides and facilitates cross-functional teams: performing financial forecast and plans, modeling scenarios, executing stress tests and performing economic modeling for USAA business units.Applies advanced knowledge to lead a financial process or financial category that may include: income, profitability, liquidity, capital, leverage, asset and liability management.Acts as a key resource and valued business partner, providing informed, proactive financial analysis with fact-based, holistic and forward-looking perspectives that will enable better decision making by senior management.Routinely interacts with senior management becoming their trusted advisor on financial issues.
