Name: Decision Support Analyst *Secret Clearance Required* with Kn
Description: The position listed below is not with San Antonio Interviews but with Knowesis Inc.  San Antonio Interviews is a private organization that works in collaboration with government agencies to promote emerging careers. Our goal is to connect you with supportive resources to supplement your skills in order to attain your dream career. Job Description Knowesis has guided the Air Force Medical Service’s Analytics capability for over 10 years. Our team is comprised of a cadre of data scientists will support sanctioned projects and optimization activities with data mining, analysis, recommendations, implementation, monitoring, and continuous improvement. Conduct and manage research, analysis, and optimization projects with coordination from multiple functional areas, departments, and organizations. Our Decision Support Analyst will be a qualified Data Scientist that can work independently and as part of a team to apply all aspects of data science to meet our clients needs.  This work is performed in San Antonio, TX . This position requires an active Secret clearance and the ability to maintain such clearance. Position Requirements/Specific Tasks: The individual will support the team lead in implementing the organization's strategy and business processes related to information and information management  They will perform, collection, analysis, and reporting of data  The individual will translate data analysis findings and research principles into written documents and presentations.  They will manipulate and transform data through the use of databases, spreadsheets, and queries for purposes implementing prescribed methodologies and clean and validate data.  Have hands-on experience with both SAS and SQL programming for purposes of querying very large databases  Comfortable Writing software to clean and investigate large, messy data sets of numerical and textual data  Possess data presentation capabilities using Tableau, Qlikview, SAS, MS SSRS or other visualization tools  Have solid understanding of database concepts  Basic statistical concepts and sampling methods  Strong presentation development and writing skills (e.g., proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint and Word)  Ability to translate requirements into products  Ability to work within small teams to complete a project  Strong written and oral skills required  The qualified candidate will;  Have extensive experience with Military Health System (MHS) Management Analysis Reporting Tool (M2), Medical Data Repository (MDR) Defense Enrollment Eligibility Reporting System (DEERS), and the TRICARE military health program.  3+ years SQL code development to manipulate and extract data from very large databases  Database development and management concepts  3+ years developing reporting products in Tableau, Qlikview, Crystal Reports or MS SSRS  Education: Minimum Bachelor's Degree in Business, Economics, Mathematics, Psychology (I/O Psychology, Sociology, Information Technology, or Hard Sciences with a focus on research and analysis  Clearance: Candidate must possess or be able to obtain a DoD SECRET security clearance  Location: San Antonio, TX

Name: Access Management Analyst
Description: DescriptionEvery day at Perspecta, we enable hundreds of thousands of  people to take on our nations most important work. Were a company founded on a diverse set of  capabilities and skills, bound together by a single promise: we never stop  solving our nations most complex challenges.  Our team of engineers, analysts, developers, investigators, integrators  and architects work tirelessly to create innovative solutions. We continually push ourselvesto respond, to  adapt, to go further. To look ahead to  the changing landscape and develop new and innovative ways to serve our  customers.  Perspecta works with U.S. government customers in defense,  intelligence, civilian, health care, and state and local markets. Our  high-caliber employees are rewarded in many waysnot only through competitive  salaries and benefits packages, but the opportunity to create a meaningful  impact in jobs and on projects that matter.  Perspectas talented and robust workforce14,000  strongstands ready to welcome you to the team. Lets make an impact together.Perspecta has an immediate need for an Access Management Analyst - Public Trust in San Antonio, TX.An Access Management Analyst works as part of an integrated Global Service Center operations team focused primarily on the facilitating appropriate levels of access for system users based on the submission of appropriate documentation and approvals. The Access Management Analyst works with customers both inside and (as appropriate) outside the organization with clients, partners, and stakeholders. The Access Management Analyst works under the direction of the Access Management Lead to provide support for inbound requests for access to a variety of Military Health System (MHS) applications such as AHLTA or CHCS and also requests for access to the Medical Joint Active Directory (mJAD) domain. The Access Management Analyst will interface with multiple levels of the organization as well as the client organization (DHA), to research access issues and define areas for potential innovation/improvement. Responsibilities: • Review inbound DD2875 access requests for accuracy and completeness, and engage the appropriate Government approval authority to validate the account request. • Document all activities in the DHA Remedy system to ensure full accountability of actions taken and also approvals received. • Coordinate with customers (in person, by phone, or via Email) across the MHS who submit access requests, to capture missing information and also to provide guidance for any local activities that need to be completed prior to the submission of the request. • Coordinate with DHA Cybersecurity to ensure that access requests are being handled according to current security procedures and policies for new or modified user accounts. • Track inbound requests using DHA Remedy and provide routine reporting to the Access Management Lead on any request backlogs or access issues that may be encountered. • Document process and procedures related to different access models that are put in place to support the various systems for which the team handles account access controls. • Other activities as assigned by the Access Management Lead.QualificationsSkills: • Strong customer service and communications skills, both oral and written. • Strong critical thinking skills that facilitate technical innovation. • Ability to establish a solid working relationship with customer, staff, managers and peers. • Ability to understand and apply knowledge of current industry standard access management processes and procedures. • Proven technical competency in the following areas: • Microsoft Office Products: Word, Excel, PowerPoint and Outlook • Microsoft Visio and SharePoint • BMC Remedy version 8.x or higher Requirements: • Department of Defense security clearance (ADP II Public Trust) or the ability to obtain one. • Security+ Certification (Required within first 90 days) • BA/BS Degree and two years of related work experience or 6 years of related work experience. • ITIL v3 Foundations Certification (Recommended) EEO Tagline: Perspecta is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories
